loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia has been running a general store for more than five years in her village. She also sells food and meals.  She makes good earnings from the business. With the revenue generated, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. In order to restock her store, she requested a new loan to buy more grocery and beverages. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery and beverages to restock her store

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Primah is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance, having borrowed eight times from the same institution. She borrows as a member of Peace Group and is happy that group members have always guaranteed her. This has enabled her to get loans. She is a married woman and a mother of five children, who are all in school. This is the reason why she works hard to earn profit from the business. It allows her to pay school fees for all her children and to see them through school.

Primah has a bridal business in Bushenyi town, which she started in 1998. She started it with a hope of generating enough income to cater to the needs of her family. In addition to bridals and the decoration that she does, she also works in agriculture on a small scale. This helps boost her income.

She applied for a loan to buy more decoration materials so that she can out-compete her competitors and earn much. Her clients are party makers in the same district and sometimes people outside Bushenyi District. Her major challenge is the rainy season, which disturbs her and dirties her decoration materials and wedding gowns. Depsite these challenges, she is determined to carry on the business, to earn profits and to build a good residential house for her family. This will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy decorations.

loans.name: Rosalba Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rosalba, a sus 59 años de edad, sigue siendo una mujer pujante y trabajadora, dedicada a laborar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo bolsas plásticas puerta a puerta, sus principales clientes son los propietarios de panaderías, carnicerías, tiendas de abarrotes. La idea surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para solventar sus gastos personales, pues no tiene hijos que le colaboren económicamente; por lo que se vale por sí misma para conseguir su sustento diario. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más referencias de bolsas plásticas, para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando las ventas y logrando una fidelización para así, seguir generando sus ingresos.
Rosalba manifiesta que su mayor deseo es convertirse en una distribuidora de desechables reconocida en el sector, pues esto le permitiría mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y podría disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosalba is 59 years, old and she is still a strong, hardworking woman.  She is an independent retailor, and sells plastic bags door-to-door.  Her main customers are bakery, butcher shop, and grocery store owners.  The idea emerged from the need to generate income to pay for her personal expenses.   Since she doesn’t have children that support her financially, she fends for herself to earn her daily bread.  She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase more secondhand plastic bags to meet customer demand and gain loyalty, and thereby, improve sales and continue generating income.    Rosalba says that her greatest desire is to become recognized in her area as a distributer of disposable products, as this will allow her to improve her business’s profits and enable her to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional secondhand plastic bags.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste, a 48-year-old father of five, from Embu, has a business as a mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Peninah, who helps him in farming. Celeste also runs a general shop, a business which supplements his income. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,500 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan he has applied for, from Vision Fund Kenya, he will be able to purchase farm inputs. Additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Celeste would like to improve upon his business. He hopes to become self-reliant.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ancheta is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Ancheta has been fattening pigs for 18 years and also earns additional income from a ticketing outlet. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 32 years old and married with children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins.

Gloria has been in the poultry business for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehriniso was born in 1962. She is married and has 4 children. She lives with her family in an agricultural region. She has been busy with growing vegetables more than 20 years. She also has a Pharmacy business. 

She grows onions, potatoes, carrots and cabbage. She has her own land which is located near her house. She has a good opportunity to develop her business with farming as there is a good watering system. Her son and daughter-in-law help her to grow vegetables. She is going to make a new planting and that’s why she is asking for a loan. She is asking for 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, a 33-year-old single mother of three from Mwingi, has a business as a livestock seller. She earns a monthly income of about KES 8,800 which she uses to support her family. This marks her third loan term with Vision Fund Kenya. With the loan she has applied for she will be able to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys to sell. 

Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Josphine would like to give her children a quality education and reinvest in her livestock selling business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family and eradicate poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows, sheep and donkeys to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Grace is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old and a widowed mother with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for twelve years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
This will be the second loan with Kiva for Lena, who lives in Vanadzor City, in the Tavush region. The first loan she used for the purchase of a winter assortment of clothes and underclothes for her clothes-trading business and the results were great. She is very satisfied with that winter period income and hopes for one more profitable cooperation. 

Lena still works at the Vnadzor wholesale market at the rented stall. Her stall merchandise she brings from Yerevan in a rented car, once in a month. She sells men's, women's, and children's clothes of different fashions and sizes. She is happy that she managed to keep and develop her trading business during these 16 years since, through this occupation, she greatly helped her husband to earn their family's living. She also perfectly organized her daughters’ wedding parties. Lena lives with her retired husband, who worked at the furniture factory, but now he receives a pension.

Lena asks for a loan of AMD 500,000 (Armenian drams). Since spring season clothes are already in great demand among her customers, it is high time to renew her stall’s clothes collection and to change it all from winter to spring, full of colors and brightness.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a Ugandan married man, aged 27 years, and he lives in Kagadi where he has been operating a wholesale and retail shop, farming and selling produce to earn a living. He ventured into business so as to have several sources of income to support his family. He hopes to educate his children despite the challenges of price fluctuations of agricultural products and unpredictable weather changes. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy sugar, maize, cooking oil and sodas.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize, cooking oil and sodas.

loans.name: Clara

texts.pt: Senhora Clara  é casada e tem 2 filhas adolescentes frenquentando o ensino secundário,vive na casa própria com sua familia, é negociante a 7 anos e trabalha mais de 8 horas diarias.Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar produtos diversos para revender. No futuro espera ampliar seu negócio e construir uma mini mercearia.Seu desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo o mais rápido possivel de modo a solicitar outro empréstimo.
texts.en: Mrs. Clara is married and has two teenage daughters who attend high school. She lives with her family in a house that she owns. She has been a trader for 7 years and works more than 8 hours a day. With the money from the loan she'll purchase an assortment of merchandise for re-selling. In the future she hopes to expand her business and build a small grocery store. Her challenge is repaying the loan as quickly as possible so she can apply for another loan.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of merchandise for re-selling (rice, sugar, etc.).

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt: Senhora Cristina  tem 39 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 04 filhos dos quais dois estudam frenquentando ensino primário,vive na casa dos pais,com os irmãos e com os filhos. É negociante a mais de 9 anos e trabalha mais de 8 horas diarias.Com o dinheiro do empréstimo vai comprar bebidas, refrigerantes para revender. No futuro espera ampliar sua casa e comprar os móveis. Como desafio é manter o sustento da familia.
texts.en: Ms. Cristina is 39 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom attend elementary school. She lives in her parents' house with her siblings and her children. She has been a trader for over 9 years and works more than 8 hours a day. With the money from the loan she'll purchase beverages and soft drinks for re-selling. In the future she hopes to enlarge her house and buy furniture. Her challenge is supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and soft drinks for re-selling.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2012, he started his own business which is a barbershop. He is a proprietor of a shop located at the same region where he lives. He newly got involved in this type of business, but Hasan was capable of proving his talents in this domain and attracted a big number of customers. 

With his youth loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l he will purchase tools needed for his store, such as scissors, blades, shaving creams and brushes etc. Hasan states that with these new purchases, he will definitely be able to better serve his customers and satisfy them even more. 

Since we already mentioned that he is quite new in this type of business, it’s obvious that giving a hand to him will assist in remarkably improving his business, especially since Hasan is very ambitious and has lots of plans for his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for his store, such as scissors, blades, shaving creams and brushes, etc.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marième est une commerçante de profession, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle habite dans un quartier de la commune et évolue dans l’achat et la vent de diverses marchandises comme les chaussures, sacs,  tissus qu’elle va acheter dans la sous région.  Elle a comme charges les frais de nourriture et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans son activité. Marième sollicite ce montant pour renforcer son activité et diversifier ses articles. A l’avenir aussi grâce à l’institution, elle voudrait augmenter ses revenus et épargner un peu d’argent à coté pour être autonome dans son commerce.
texts.en: Madam Marième is a shopkeeper by profession, she is married and a mother. She lives in a neighborhood of the commune and is progressing in buying and selling a variety of merchandise such as shoes, bags, and fabric that she buys in the subregion. Her responsibilities are the cost of food and her children's school fees. She has more than 10 years experience in her business. Marième is requesting this amount to strengthen her business and diversify her items. In the future also thanks to the institution, she would like to increase her income and save a little money on the side to be autonomous in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Gabriel Eduardo

texts.es: Gabriel de 41 años de edad es un hombre casado y padre de 2 hijos en las edades de 11 y 16 años, que vive en un municipio del departamento de Bolívar y se dedica a la hojalatería o trabajo con láminas de zinc, fabricando con este material, canales para recoger el agua. Este arte es tradicional en su familia, pues lo aprendió de su padre, y con esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, convirtiéndola en su única fuente de ingresos.  A este negocio ha agregado el servicio de soldadura y también es productor de  trapeadores.    Su meta es extenderse u aumentar el tamaño de su negocio para favorecer la educación de sus hijos y lograr suministrarle posibilidades de éxito. Como profesionales futuros. Su mayor desafío es apoyar a su hija en estado de discapacidad, pero es su máxima motivación que lo impulsa a cada día trabajar mucho más. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es no menor de setecientos ochenta mil pesos colombianos y maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 17% con un potencial de incremento progresivo si aplica a su negocio más capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales para elaborar artículos como canales de agua, trapeadores etc.
texts.en: Gabriel, 41, is a married man and the father of 2 children ages 11 and 16 years. They live in the town of Bolivar. He earns his living working with sheet metal and zinc metal sheeting. He uses this material to manufacture gutters used to collect water. This work is a traditional art in his family because he learned it from his father. With this work, he has managed to raise his family although it is their only source of income. He has also added the service of welding and making mops. His goal is to extend or increase the size of his business and to promote the education of his children to achieve better chances of success as future professionals. His biggest challenge is to support his daughter who has a disability but she is also his greatest motivation that drives him to work harder everyday. Currently, his necessary working capital is no less than 780,000 Colombian pesos. He has a return on sales of not less than 17% with a potential to increase if he applies more working capital. Currently, he has applied for his first Kiva loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy materials to make items such as water gutters, mops, and more.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his metal working shop.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. Gina has been in this business for 5 years, and earns more income from farming and selling vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 30 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell, like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

She has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load. Angela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, like snack foods, sugar, soap, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Belarmina

texts.pt:
Casada oficial , tem 38 anos de idade e mae de 4 filhos todos em idade escolar e vive na casa propria com mais 2 netos. 
ế comerciante com larga experiencia na actividade e o seu esposo trabalha na funcao publica. Com o presente emprestio pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade ( arroz, acucar,e muito mais) a grosso e retalho.  Possui um negocio muito forte na praḉa.
tem como desafio manter se estavel no negocio para poder pagar o emprestimos  sem problemas e garantir os proximos creditos para ampliar o negocio e outras ambicoes empresariais.
texts.en:
Married officially, Belarmina is 38 years old and is the mother of 4 children who are all of school-going age. She lives in a house she owns with her family and 2 grandchildren.

She's a trader with a lot of experience in her activity and her husband works as a civil servant. With this loan she intends to buy essential products (rice, sugar and much more) in bulk to sell on. She has a very strong business at the market.

Her challenge is to keep a stable business so that she can pay back her loan repayments without any issues and guarantee future loans to expand her business and other entrepreneurial ambitions.

loans.use: buy essential products (rice, sugar and much more) in bulk to sell on

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt: Senhor Ernesto  tem 56 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 7 filhos vivendo com ele, dos quais 3 estudam e outros a trabalhar, é negociante junto com a sua esposa a mais de 25 anos.O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de diversos produtos como; arroz, açúcar amendoím, refrigerantes para revender no seu estabelecimento.No futuro espera aumentar o volume do seu negócio. Os principal desafio e de  construir uma ferragem para venda de material de construção.
texts.en: Mr. Ernesto is 56 years old and married. He has seven children who live with him. Three of the children go to school and the others are in the workforce. He has been a vendor alongside his wife for over 25 years. The money from the loan will be used to purchase an assortment of merchandise such as rice, sugar, peanuts and soft drinks for re-selling in his store. In the future he hopes to increase turnover in his business. His main challenge is building a hardware store in order to sell construction supplies.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of merchandise such as rice, sugar, peanuts and soft drinks for re-selling in his store.

loans.name: Maty Seny's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le début des activités du banc villageois. Il est composé de 4 femmes issues du même 

village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques. Madame Mame Bana, la responsable, est une femme mariée âgée de quarante cinq ans et mère de trois garçons. Elle est debout à gauche de la photo. Elle s'active dans le commerce de poissons frais depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 

Son nouveau crédit de quatre cent mille francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des panier de poissons pour les 

revendre au détails au niveau du banc villageois et du petit marché de son village. Les bénéfices réalisés par 

son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires sanitaires et scolaires de ses 

enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was created since the beginning of the business of the "banc villageois." It consists of 4 women from the same village and united by good social and economic relationships. Madam Mame Bana, the leader, is a married woman who is forty-five years old and mother to three boys. She is standing to the left in the photo. She has been selling fresh fish for a long time and has good experience in this domain.

Her new loan of 400,000 FCFA will allow her to buy herself baskets of fish to resell retail at the "banc villageois" and the little market in her village. The profits made by her business will allow her to take care of the food, sanitation and school needs of her children and to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for a little shop.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.
She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, soap, shampoo and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, soap, shampoo and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 35 years old and married with four children between the ages of 16 and 4, three of whom attend school.
His main business is transportation. He is a taxi driver along the Kagadi - Hoima road, but he also deals in produce and trades in crops like beans and rice.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to complete his house, and he hopes to pay using incomes from the transport business. Frank describes himself as hardworking and honest, and his main dream is to finish his house and educate all his children.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy de 30 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 4 a 10 años, genera ingresos familiares a través de dos actividades: por un lado vende sopas diariamente, actividad que le da una rotación de efectivo diario y por otro lado  se dedica al comercio desde hace 9 años, vendiendo a plazos pactados con los clientes y de contado, artículos como ropa, productos cosméticos etc. Su negocio inició impulsado por la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de su hogar, al lado de su cónyuge. Las compras de sus artículos las hace en grandes depósitos, que le ofrecen precios de mayoristas y le ayudan a ganar un poco más en sus ventas. Deisy tiene sueños de  prosperidad, como el de tener su propia casa y un local para trabajar impulsando su actividad, mientras continua administrando su hogar muy de cerca. Su mayor desafío es lograr ahorros para reinvertir, pero su trabajo constante y buena disposición, hacen que tenga un gran potencial de incremento de su negocio, apuntándole al aumento de su capital de trabajo, con el fin de  lograr un volumen de sus compras. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos alimenticios y mercancías como ropa productos de belleza para poco a poco aumentar su volumen de ventas, rotando rápidamente sus productos en impulsar el éxito de esta inversión..
texts.en: Deisy is the 30-year-old mother of 4 children between the ages of 4 to 10 years. She generates the family's income through two activities. One is selling soups, a daily activity that brings in cash. The other is a trade she has done for 9 years which is selling clothing, cosmetics, and more to customers on credit with fixed repayment schedules. She started her business driven by the need to generate profits to support and maintain her household alongside her spouse. She purchases the articles she sells in wholesale markets where they offer bulk prices which allow her to earn a little more when she sells. Deisy has dreams of prosperity, having her own home, and a fixed location for her business while she continues to manage her home closely. Her biggest challenge is to save and reinvest but, through her hard work and dedication, she has a great potential to expand her business. She aims to increase her working capital in order to increase her volume of sales. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which she will use to buy food supplies as well as clothing, beauty products, and more to gradually increase sales volume. Rapidly rotating her products will boost the success of this investment.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her soup business as well and cosmetics, clothing, and more to sell.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt: Senhora Horténcia  é solteira, tem 36 anos de idade, é mãe de uma filha frenquentando ensino secundário, vive na casa dos pais, é negociante, trabalha mais de 8 horas diárias. Com o montante do empréstimo vai aplicar na compra de sapatos, cortinas, bolças para revender. No futuro pretende adiquir um espaço para construir casa própria.O seu maior desafio e de manter o sustento escolar da sua  filha, e reembolsar o empréstimo sem cair em mora.
texts.en: Ms. Horténcia is 36 years old and single. She has a daughter who's in high school. She lives with her parents. Horténcia is a trader and works more than 8 hours a day. With the amount of the loan she'll purchase shoes, curtains and purses for re-selling. In the future she intends to acquire some space in order to build a house of her own. Her biggest challenge is paying for her daughter's schooling and repaying the loan without becoming delinquent.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, curtains and purses for re-selling.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.pt:
Natural da cidade de Maputo , jovem de 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos menores de idade. Vive na casa propria com sua familia .
Comp o presente emprestimo pretende comprar material dee construcao ( cimento, ferros , areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa do sonhos . 
Tem como plano futuro concluir a escola no nivel superior e construir residencias para os filhos. Compromete se a pagar bem os emprestimos para poder aceder a outros, abrindo possibilidades de materializacao de mais sonhos.
texts.en:
Originally from the city of Maputo, this young man is 29 years old, married and the father of two children, both minors. He lives in a house he owns with his family. 

With this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement, iron, sand and others) to continue the building work on his dream house.

In future he plans to complete his higher education and build homes for his children. He commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can obtain further loans which will open up more opportunities to make his dreams come true.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, iron, sand and others) to continue the building work on his dream house

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
O Julio tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos e todos estudam em diferentes niveis de ensino. Vive na casa propria com a sua famila.
ế comerciante bastante conhecido e fornece quase todo tipo de material de construcao na sua zona. Pretende um emprestimo para comprar material  de construcao para revender na sua ferragem ( cimento e outros materiais) possui um meio de transporte que ajuda na sua actividade e tambem presta servicos  de transporte de diversos produtos na sua comunidade. Ha forte demanda do produto que se propoe a vender e conta com o emprestimo para poder responder a demanda.
Tem como desafio responder a demanda  de varios materiais de construcao. Sonha ampliar o seu negocio e tornar se um empresario de sucesso.
texts.en:
Julio is 46 years old, married and the father of 5 children who are all at different levels of education. He lives in a house he owns with his family.

He is quite a well known trader and provides almost all types of construction material in his region. With this loan he plans to buy construction material to sell on in his hardware store (cement and other materials). He also has a form of personal transportation which helps in his activity and also allows him to transport various products for people in his community. There is strong demand for his product and he is counting on this loan to meet demand.

His challenge is to meet demand of all the different kinds of construction material. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy construction material to sell on in his hardware store (cement and other materials)

loans.name: Shiela Mae

texts.en:
Shiela Mae is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studies BS Criminology in a university. Her mother earns from her buy-and-sell business and it helps a lot to cover household expenses. . She helps her mother on weekends to earn money for her allowances but to pay the school tuition fees, she needs financial assistance to make it possible. 

With her GDMPC education loan, Shiela Mae will be able to continue studying without the hassle of thinking of her financial needs. In the future, she is hopeful to find a better job according to her desire.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, la mayor de ella trabaja vendiendo zapatos en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa y e ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Maria desde hace varios años posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, Maria esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: granos basicos, cafe, aceite, refrescos, azucar, golosinas, etc. para continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener junto a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and resides in her own home with her two daughters. The oldest daughter works by selling shoes at the market near their house, thus allowing her to help with the household expenses. Maria has managed a small store at home for the past several years. She has many customers who prefer to do business with her because of the quality of her products and the good prices.

Maria is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy more merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soft drinks, sugar, snack foods, and other products so that she can continue her sales. This business is her only source of income, so the loan will help her and her daughters have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, soft drinks, sugar, snack foods, and other products.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander, 51 years old and a father of three, sells balut (fertilized duck eggs) in their village for a living. For more than a year, the business has been running smoothly and he earns a better income from this. He has competitors in the village, but the taste of his vinegar inspires his customers to come back again and make some purchases and often to eat balut  in his store. He is hopeful that with this business, he will be able to save a portion of his income for the future needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more balut to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be capable. She operates a farm where she grows kale, cabbage and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm supplies for use on her farm. Her business goal is to be very prosperous within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm supplies for use on her farm.

loans.name: Yustus

texts.en:
Yustus is a 31-year-old man who is married to Yohana, a 28-year-old housewife. They are blessed with 2 children: Yofrianus, 7, an Elementary school student and Adam, 3, who is not attending school yet.

Yustus is working as a mini-truck driver, transporting building materials from the store to the customers' place. Every day, he operates from 8 a.m to 6 p.m. He usually parks the mini-truck in front of the building store. From this work he can make 70,000 IDR for each delivery. The average monthly income he generates is IDR 1,000,000. 

He intends to initiate a tire pump service in his hometown. Due to the lack of money to do so, he applied to TLM for an individual loan of IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on a compressor machine. His young brother will help him to run the business. He hopes the business will make a good impact on his family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Rosiris Margoth

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Rosiris con su anterior credikiva, pues logró hacer adecuaciones a los baños de su vivienda y sus ingresos aumentaron, gracias a ello sus hijos están estudiando en la ciudad de Barranquilla y también con su ayuda sacaron la libreta militar. Rosiris dice a sus financiadores que se encuentra muy agradecida con los créditos recibidos. Hoy necesita comprar materias primas e insumos como hilos para elaborar hamacas y diversas artesanías en tejido transversal. Con su crédito aspira a continuar mejorando su vivienda impactando sus ventas con su gran esfuerzo.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting the previous Kiva loan to Rosiris. She managed to make improvements in the bathroom of her home and her income increased. Thanks to that, her children are studying in the city of Barranquilla which helped them avoid compulsory military service. Rosiris would like to tell her Kiva funders that she is very grateful for the loans she has received. Today, she needs to buy raw materials and inputs such as yarn to make hammocks and various knitted and crocheted crafts. With her loan, she aims to continue improving her housing which impacts her business effort.

loans.use: to purchase yarn to make hammocks and more.

loans.name: Gildardo

texts.es:
Gildardo, a sus 66 años de edad, se gana la vida trabajando como productor y comercializador de alimentos y dulces; el oficio lo aprendió mientras trabajaba en una empresa de conservas, pero luego de un recorte de personal que se realizó, él se quedó sin empleo y con la obligación de sostener a su esposa y sus 5 hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (frutas, azúcar, conservantes) esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y estará en la capacidad de aumentar su producción para satisfacer la demanda de sus productos, generando así mejores ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Gildardo manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando y luchar para cumplir sus deseos, especialmente el de tener una gran distribuidora de productos alimenticios donde pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, dando paso a una mejor calidad de vida para disfrutar en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Gildardo, at 66 years of age, earns a living producing and marketing food items and sweets. He learned this trade while working in a canning company. After some layoffs at the company, Gildardo found himself without a job but still with the responsibility of providing for his wife and five children. The loan Gildardo is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of bulk supplies (fruit, sugar, preservatives). This will allow him to continue working and give him the capacity to increase his production enough to satisfy the demand for his products. Earning more money in this way will allow him to pay his family's expenses. 

Gildardo shows that his age does not prevent him from dreaming and fighting to achieve his goal, especially that of having a big distribution center of food products where he can generate employment opportunities and improve the profitability of the business. This will provide a better quality of life for him to enjoy with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (fruit, sugar, preservatives).

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt: Senhor Jorge tem 26 anos de idade, solteiro,é pai de um filho menor, vive na casa própria, é segurança e trabalha em turnos, tem um irmão na sua responsabilidade.Com o montante do recente empréstimo aplicará na compra de cimento, areia, para reabilitar sua casa.Seu maior sonho e de tirar carta de condução e tornar se motorista de profisão.Seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem cair em mora de modo a garantir mais financiamentos com a hluvuku.
texts.en: Mr. Jorge is 26 years old and single. He has an underage son and lives in a house that he owns. He's a security guard and works by shifts. He has a brother under his care. With the amount of the current loan he'll purchase cement and sand in order to fix up his house. His biggest dream is to get his driver's license and become a professional driver. His biggest challenge is repaying the loan without becoming delinquent so he can ensure more loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand in order to fix up his house.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul is a widow and has two children. Ugul is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her family. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry six years ago. She also has a dried fruit selling business. Little by little she has developed her businesses. Now, her businesses are going well. 

Ugul requested a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy feed for her cattle. From the profit from her business, she is going to improve her living conditions. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona was born in 1985. She is not married and lives with her parents in a rural area. Two years ago she began her own business of dealing in animal husbandry. She has always had a dream of earning a living and providing her family with all necessary things. 

Farzona keeps cows. She sells milk and milk products as kefir and sour cream to local people. The milk products are processed by Farzona herself. She tries to do her job in high quality fashion.

She needs to buy feeds for her cows, so she is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy feeds for cows.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman and the mother of a seven-year-old daughter. They are from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket making business for more than seven years now. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for basket weaving, like bamboo and straw, and to pay for the repair of her house. Her house was devastated by the earthquake. Aida hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving, like bamboo and straw, and to pay for the repair of her house.

loans.name: Corsino

texts.en:
Corsino is a married man and a father of three children, ages 17, 14, and five. He lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol. Corsino earns a living through his hog-raising business and his motorcycle transport business. 

Corsino is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle, like wheels, tires, nuts and bolts, and chains, as well as additional piglets to raise. 

In the future, Corsino hopes to expand his business and make it a success. Furthermore, he wants to save money to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en: Ponciana lives in the village located in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has been providing sewing and making garments for sale. She also accepts garments for repair, and she earns good income for her needs. To improve her services, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy thread and fabric. She is very energetic in doing her work, even at her age. She makes all of this with the support of her husband. In the near future, she wants to have savings for her needs.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, crianza de cerdos y a la jarcia, estas actividades las realiza junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas, este negocio es el que le da los recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares, actualmente no le representa dificultades.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos, pita plástica y de algodón, fortalecerá su negocio y podrá tener la materia prima para elaborar los productos que luego venderá a sus clientes, teniendo así mejores ventas y los ingresos aumentaran, con los cuales se dispondrá a cancelar sus cuotas y mejorar su estilo de vida familiar.
El sueño de Natividad es mantenerse trabajando para poco a poco mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Natividad earns her living cultivating basic grains, raising pigs, and making rope items. These activities are also performed by her husband and two daughters. These businesses give her the financial resources to cover family expenses which does not give them any difficulties right now.
The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pigs as well as plastic and cotton fibers that will be used to strengthen her business because she will have the raw materials she needs to make products to sell to her customers which will bring in better sales and increased profits. They will allow her to pay her repayments and enhance her family's lifestyle.
Natividad's dream is to keep working to gradually improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase plastic and cotton fiber.

loans.name: Calista Lilian

texts.es: Calista de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia, con ella habita su hija, yerno y una nieta. Calista se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, su yerno quien es obrero mecánico soldador de una fabrica aporta para alimentación, el servicio del agua y la luz. Calista tiene la necesidad de construir un tapial alrededor de su vivienda ya que actualmente el cerco es de lámina vieja que no presenta ningún tipo de seguridad (como puede apreciarse en la fotografía). Como no tiene el total del dinero para la construcción del tapial, ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el hierro, ladrillo de obra, cemento, grava y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción del tapial perimetral.
texts.en: Calista is 63 years old and lives in her own home; her daughter, son-in-law, and one granddaughter live with her.  Calista buys and sells corn for a living; her son-in-law, who works as a welder at a factory, contributes to their food, water, and electricity.  Calista needs to build a rammed-earth wall around her home because the fence they currently have is made of old sheet metal and it does not offer any security at all (as you can see in the photograph).  As she does not have all the money for the wall, she has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy iron, building bricks, cement, and gravel, and to pay for labor to build the rammed-earth perimeter wall.

loans.use: to buy iron, building bricks, cement, and gravel, and to pay for labor to build a rammed-earth wall

loans.name: Josue Romeo

texts.es: Josue tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida. Josue es vendedor de pan y de esta forma lleva el sustento y junto a su compañera de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Josue es un hombre trabajador y muy dedicado a su familia por lo que desea construir un cuarto para contar con mayor comodidad dado que su humilde vivienda solo cuanta con un área geográfica. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para proceder lo antes posible a la construcción del cuarto.
texts.en:
Josue is 20 years old and resides in his own home with his life companion. He sells bread in order to make a living. Josue and his companion partner together in order to maintain the household finances. He is a hardworking man who is devoted to his family. For this reason, he wants to build a room so that he can make his family more comfortable. His modest home only has limited living space at the moment.

Josue is requesting this loan FUSAI so that he can invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood. He would like to proceed with the construction of the room as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood for building a room.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 13 years to 32 years. She describes herself to be  an achiever. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are institutions. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be shortage of stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock  of cereals. Her business goal is to improve her  business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock  of cereals

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is 49 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the north part of Tajikistan. It is an agricultural country where people develop businesses with animal husbandry and farming. Mamlakat is one of the citizens of Tajikistan who has been busy with animal husbandry more than five years. She feeds cows in her house where she has a big cowshed. She buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. Her husband helps her with managing her business. Her business is the main source of the family income. Mamlakat is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy feed for her cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Sofiah

texts.en: Sofiah is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from two years to six years. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages, carrots, and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lacking enough capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of cabbages, carrots and potatoes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  A previous loan of KES 15,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cabbages, carrots and potatoes.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a female, married and aged 44 years. She has 6 children and 8 dependents. She is a teacher by profession and gets additional income from farming. She has been in service for 2 years and her office is found at Kisiiha Primary school. Her love for children inspired her to join the teaching profession. 

However, the problem is that she gets paid a low salary by the government, yet she desires to educate her children to university. Stella is asking for a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 58 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of rice to sell. In the future, Zenaida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino, es soltero, vive solo, gustosamente se dedica a trabajar la tierra el cultiva granos básicos (maíz, maicillo y frijol) y comercializa ganado, lo hace con ayuda de mozos, su ventaja es que lo realiza en terrenos propios, actualmente no ha tenido problemas administrando su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en compra de aditivos, plástico y pago de mozos, ya que son implementos necesarios para realizar los silos con los cuales producirá el alimento para su ganado en época de verano, le ayudara a mantenerlo en buenas condiciones y evitar que su precio en el mercado sea menor.
Su objetivo es continuar trabajado para que su negocio crezca y sea autosuficiente.
texts.en: Rufino is single and lives alone. He very much enjoys working the land to make a living. Rufino grows basic grains (corn, sorghum, beans) and sells livestock. He uses the help of paid laborers to carry out this work on some land that he owns. At this time, he does not have any problems managing his business. The loan Rufino is requesting will be invested to buy additives, plastic, and to pay for labor. These are necessary for him to be able to fill the silos with which he will produce feed for his livestock in the summer season. These will help him keep his crops in good condition and avoid wasting which would drive their market price down. Rufino's goal is to continue working so that his business grows and he becomes self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy additives, plastic, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, es casada, por el momento no tiene hijos, desde hace 3 años se dedica a vender comida como una forma de tener mejores ingresos para aportar en los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio y le ayudan dos empleadas.
Ella solicita capital para comprar verduras, carnes, arroz, aceite, bebidas, etc., y mejorar la infraestructura de su local, contara con ingredientes necesarios para elaborar la comida así como también dará una imagen más agradable de su negocio ante sus clientes.
Su visión es tener un negocio más rentable que le permita crear un patrimonio digno para cuando tenga sus hijos y continuar ofreciendo empleo a las personas que le colaboran.
texts.en:
Berta is married and has no children at this moment. For three years, she has made a living selling food as a way to have a better income to contribute to her household expenses. She has a lot of experience in the business and the help of two employees.

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meats, rice, oil, beverages, etc. and to improve the infrastructure of her store. She will count on the necessary ingredients to prepare food and this will also create a more pleasant image of her business for her customers. Her vision is to have a more profitable business that will allow her to generate personal wealth for when she has children and to continue offering employment to the people that she works with.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, rice, oil, beverages, etc. and to improve the infrastructure of her store

loans.name: María Franquelina

texts.es:
María es una mujer luchadora y activa, que se ha enfrentado con valor a las dificultades que le pone la vida; ya que hace algún tiempo, por problemas de orden público en el sector donde reside, le asesinaron a su esposo y a uno de sus 3 hijos, esto la hizo entrar en una crisis de depresión durante un tiempo, sin embargo, motivada por el amor a sus otros dos hijos decidió emprender la labor de venta de mercancía por catálogos y por encargo, esto con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y sentirse útil.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, tenis, accesorios, cosméticos, cremas corporales), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, lo que le ayudará a fidelizar la clientela y atraer a nuevos compradores.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su negocio, ofreciendo cada día más variedad de productos con lo que podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita salir adelante, pues realizando esta actividad tendrá la posibilidad de superar mejor la difícil situación que vive, tras el fallecimiento de sus seres amados.
texts.en:
Maria is an active, hardworking woman who has courageously faced the difficulties that life has placed upon her.  Some time ago, due to problems with public order in the area where she lived, her husband and one of her three children were killed.  This caused her to fall into a depression crisis for a while.  However, motivated by the love of her two other children, and with the goals of generating her own income and feeling useful, she decided to undertake the task of selling merchandise through catalogs as well as on order.  

She will use the requested loan to purchase wholesale merchandise (perfume, sneakers, accessories, cosmetics, and body lotions).  This will allow her to have a wider variety of products to offer her customers and meet their diverse tastes and needs, which will help her maintain customer loyalty and attract new buyers.

Maria says that her greatest desire is to strengthen her business, offering a wider variety of products each day.  This will guarantee financial stability that will allow her to get ahead. Engaging in this activity will make it possible for her to better overcome the difficult situation she is living in, following the death of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (perfume, sneakers, accessories, cosmetics, and body lotions).

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan, who is a 33-year-old single woman, lives in Batumi city, west Georgia. She lives with her sister and her son, and both members are temporarily unemployed. The only source of the family's income is Rusudan's job, working as a baker at a private company. Her generated salary consists of 400 GEL per month. 

However, this income is hardly enough for a 3-member family to cover all daily costs and basic needs, so Rusudan decided to get another source of income alongside her main activity. For more than 3 years she has worked as a baker and has great experience in making good confectionery products. 

Her request has now been approved within the framework of Kiva and Credo, so she is able to use a start-up loan for starting a private baking business in her house and getting private orders. The loan of 2,300 USD will help her to purchase a stock of merchandise such as pastry dishes. Rusudan thinks that the business will be profitable, as she will gain the loyalty of people by making a good product. This additional income will enable her to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.

loans.use: To buy pastry dishes and start private baking.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en: Noriniso was born in 1974.  She is married and a careful mother of five children. Some of them are non-adults. Ten years ago, Noriniso began her business with animal husbandry, but from this business she had a small income. So she decided to organize a new business with sewing. She learned to sew national women’s dresses. She took part in a course, "To get Ahead", from a women’s organization with this aim. Noriniso is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 45-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are attending school. She has worked from her home selling clothes since 2011. Nawal works hard to improve her own business and to retain loyal customers over the years by offering them the best values. 

Presently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l in order to purchase new merchandise for her summer collection such as pants, tops, dresses etc. Vitas notes that Nawal already benefited from her previous Kiva loans that helped her to develop and enlarge her operations. She has no doubt that she will profit from this new loan as well to move forward with her job, continue to please her customers, and be able to obtain everything that she intends for her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing for summer collection such as pants, tops, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, es una persona que aprendió de su padre a trabajar en la agricultura y en la crianza de cerdos, actualmente son actividades que realiza con el fin de tener los recursos económicos con los cuales salir adelante junto a su familia, está acompañado y tiene cinco hijos, algunos de ellos estudian y otros le colaboran en el negocio.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, le facilitara aumentar las ganancias cuando realice las ventas de los mismos, así podrá pagar la deuda adquirida y seguir cumpliendo con la responsabilidad de dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más establecido e incorporar la compra y venta de ganado.
texts.en:
José is a man who learned to work in agriculture and raise pigs from his father. He is currently performing these activities in order to have the financial resources to continue moving forward with his family. He has five children. Some of them are in school while others work in the business. He will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs and feed concentrate to feed them, raise them, and sell them. He will pay the debt he incurs and continue to fulfill his responsibility to give his family a better lifestyle. 
His dream is to have a more established and mainstream business buying and selling cattle.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and concentrated pellets for feeding them.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ciirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Communal Bank “Buena Vista”, which is located in the District of Huayopata in La Convención Province, Department of Cusco.

She continues to manage an agricultural business. Cirila has a plot of land on which she grows coffee, cacao, and bananas. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Cirila has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her coffee.

Cirila is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a successful business lady who lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. She has her own small food market, where she sells a great range of products for everyday use (bread, candies, canned goods, sausages and juices). She buys some of her market products from suppliers and some items she brings from the Yerevan wholesale markets. 

She has been running her business for 15 years already, and during these years her business success and good income allowed her to support her family with good living conditions.

Tamara has two sons. Her elder son serves with the peace-keeping troops in Afghanistan, and at the same time he is a student of Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute in the department of distance learning. Her second son is also a student at the same institute. 

Tamara is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to refresh the assortment of her market products. She especially wants to buy a new assortment of candies, and she also wants to buy souvenirs, for which she decided to separate some space in her market and try the sale of them also.

loans.use: to refresh the assortment of her market products and also to buy souvenirs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marina Ester

texts.es: Marina de 58 años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos de 17 y 14 años y una niña 10 años de edad. Ella sola sostiene los gastos del hogar, la educación y salud de su familia. De su ex compañero de vida recibe una pequeña ayuda para la alimentación de los tres hijos, Marina trabaja como empleada domestica para una familia de la capital y que diariamente debe viajar de su lugar de trabajo hasta su casa para estar pendientes del bienestar de sus hijos. Marina necesita construir un baño y servicio de fosa séptica y pozo de absorción ya que el actual es una letrina de hoyo seco. Por tal razón ella ha solicitado un crédito para comprar ladrillo de barro, cemento, arena, grava y pagar la mano de obra que implica la construcción
texts.en: Marina is 58 years old and she lives with her two sons, who are 17 and 14 years old, and her 10-year-old little girl.  She alone is responsible for her family's household expenses, education, and health.  She receives a small amount of support from her ex-life partner to feed her three children.  Marina works as a housekeeper for a family in the capital and every day she has to travel from her work to her home to ensure her children's wellbeing.  Marina needs to build a bathroom and install a septic system as they currently have a dry latrine.  For this reason, she has requested a loan to buy mud bricks, cement, sand, and gravel, and to pay for labor for the construction.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and install a septic system, as they currently have a dry latrine

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 53 years old and married. Marina works very hard to provide for her family. She sells dry goods in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional dry goods to sell to customers. Marina has been in this business for twenty-four years and sells a variety of items such as slippers, umbrellas, and school supplies. In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Serap

texts.en:
Serap is married and has one child. She looked after her father-in-law, who had health problems, for a long time. At the same time, she did different jobs to support herself and contributed financially to the household to take care of her family and child. 

In 2004, she opened a stand in her city's Odun Market, growing her business of selling jewelry and knitted items. At first she worked hard to learn the different styles and went to her family to learn about them. In the beginning she had to work very hard to attract as many customers as possible. 

Serap, who has had her stand for 10 years, will use the loan to buy materials to make jewelry, so she can offer a wider variety of products and attract more customers. In the future she wants her children to finish school and have nice, comfortable lives.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Serap Hanım, evli ve 1 çocuk sahibi .   Uzun bir süre felçli olan kayınbabasına bakmış.  Bu süreçte aynı zamanda ayaklarının üzerinde durabilmek için çeşitli işler yaparak, ailesine ve çocuğunun rahat etmesi için eve destek sağlamış.  2004 yılında odun pazarında stant yeri alarak ufaktan işini geliştirmiş.  Takı ve örgü satan Serap Hanım önceleri zorlandığı için farklı modeller öğrenebilmek için  ailesinin yanına giderek değişik örgü ve takı modelleri öğrenmiş.   Başlarda çok mücadele etmiş müşteri potansiyelini sağlayabilmek için çok emek vermiş.  10 yıldır stant da satış yapan Serap hanım Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile takı malzemeleri alarak ürün çeşidini artırmak ve daha çok müşteri gelmesini istiyor.  İleride ki zamanda ise oğlunun okulunu bitirip güzel rahat bir yaşantı yaşamasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Zeferino

texts.pt: Senhor Zeferino tem 33 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos dos quais um vive com ele e outro vive com os avôs,vive na casa própria,sustenta sua familia, é policia e trabalha 8 horas diárias .Com o valor do financiamento pretende comprar cimento,varões,chapas para ampliar a sua casa. No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e iniciar um negócio. Terminar  o empréstimo sem cair em mora.
texts.en: Mr. Zeferino is 33 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom lives with him and the other one lives with his grandparents. He supports his family and lives in a house that he owns. He's a police officer and works 8 hours a day. With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase cement, rods and metal sheets so he can enlarge his house. In the future he intends to finish building his house, start a business and repay the loan without becoming delinquent.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods and metal sheets so he can enlarge his house.

loans.name: Benjabil

texts.en: Benjabil is studying in a university for a Bachelor of Science in Criminology.  Benjabil is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his future. His parents earn from working as teachers. He wants to make them proud of him, so he never disappoints his parents. He studies well and makes high grades as a present to his parents.  He is requesting this loan to pay for the school tuition fees for the second semester of this current school year. His goal is to have a better life and career in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school tuition fees for the second semester of this current school year.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea, and she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be heavy rainfall, which affects tea. 

Hellen will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tealeaves for resale. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a farmer living in Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with her husband and three children. She loves farming and has been at it for 15 years.  Her primary source of income is from milk, tea, bananas, mangoes, and vegetables. Her biggest challenge is lack of good marketing skills and insufficient rain.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help farmers to access finances for establishing their farming projects. During the training, she learned how to develop a savings culture. This loan will enable her to purchase farm inputs, so that she can produce more, and get more income, which will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta octavo grado en la escuela, la situación económica no le permitió continuar, por lo que tuvo que abandonar sus estudios para dedicarse a vender productos de primera necesidad, luego tuvo la suerte de casarse con  un hombre muy trabajador el cual se dedica a la albañilería, un trabajo muy duro, pero la necesidad es mayor. María se esfuerza mucho por su hija de tres años de edad, ella tiene claro que para poder salir adelante tiene que trabajar fuerte. 

El comercio, es la actividad a la cual María se dedica desde hace 20 años, anteriormente ella solo vendía productos como sal, azúcar y café, pero debido a la demanda del lugar, decidió invertir en su tienda, y con mucho esfuerzo hoy tienen una tienda más surtida, ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque existía la necesidad de cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la tienda, comprará bebidas refrescantes, productos de belleza, artículos escolares y otra clase de productos que son de primera necesidad, el crédito será de mucha ayuda para ella ya que por el momento no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para invertir en ella y además al obtener más ganancias mejorarán los ingresos para su familia.

María es una mujer con mucha visión y metas, ella se ha propuesto para un futuro, tener un pequeño almacén con el que logre abastecer a la mayoría de la población  del municipio, así también, quiere dejarle a su hija un negocio que le genere ingresos suficientes, pero por el momento se le hace difícil, porque no tiene los recursos necesarios, con los que pueda seguir haciendo crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and succeeded in her studies until eighth grade, when her financial situation did not allow her to continue. As such, she had to abandon her studies to make a living selling basic goods. Later she had the good fortune to marry a very hardworking man, who makes his living in masonry. This is a very difficult job, but the family's need is great. María strains herself a lot for her 3 year-old daughter. She knows well that to be able to move forward, one must work hard.

For 20 years, María has made a living in business. Previously, she only sold products like salt, sugar, and coffee, but due to local demand, she decided to invest in her store and with a lot of effort, she now has a more varied store. She decided to make her living in this business because there was an existing need to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the store. She will buy refreshing beverages, beauty products, school items, and other basic goods. The loan will be a lot of help for her because at the moment she cannot rely solely on her own financial resources to invest in her store. Furthermore, obtaining higher earnings will improve her family's income.

María is a woman with a lot of vision and goals. She has set up plans for the future to have a small storehouse with which she will supply the majority of the population of her town. She also wants to leave her daughter a business that will generate sufficient income, but at the moment it is very difficult for her because she does not have the necessary resources, with which she could continue making her business grow.

loans.use: to buy refreshing beverages, beauty products, school items, and other products that are primary necessities

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Ella es Mary Luz tiene 36 años, tiene 4 hijos, la situación económica de Mary Luz es muy regular, ella tiene varios gastos por los hijos y si kiva le puede ayudar para que ella termine la carrera como a querido, siempre realiza puntualmente los pagos, ella quiere terminar de estudiar para darle a los hijos una mejor calidad de vida y tener mejor oferta de trabajo, ella esta estudiando auxiliar administrativo en salud 2 semestre, le gusta mucho la salud en el área administrativa.
texts.en: This is Mary Luz.  She is 36 years old and she has four children.  Mary Luz's financial situation is very regular; she has various expenses because of her children and if Kiva can help her finish her degree like she wants to, she will always be on-time with her payments.  She wants to finish her studies so she can give her children a better quality of life and have better job offers.  She is in her second semester of studying to be a health administrative assistant.  She likes health administration very much.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala vive en la ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de Pascuala es la venta de frutas pues tiene varios terrenos de plantaciones frutales. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar a los peones que van a cosechar las plantaciones frutales. Pascuala agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. 

(Huayopata es un Distrito Tealero, tiene un Centro Poblado San Pablo, su población aproximada es de 12 mil habitantes.)
texts.en:
Pascuala lives in the city of Huayopata, which is located in the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.  Pascuala's main source of income is selling fruit, as she has several plots of land sown with fruit crops.  She is a responsible and kind person who has belonged to Asociación Arariwa's Buena Vista Communal Bank for several years.  She currently needs a loan to pay the laborers who are going to harvest her fruit crops.  Pascuala thanks the investors for her loan and promises to make her payments very responsibly.  

(Huayopata is a tea-growing district; it has a village, San Pablo; its approximate population is 12 mil. inhabitants.)

loans.use: to pay the laborers who are going to harvest her fruit crops

loans.name: Selsabeil 24 Group

texts.en:
Selsabeil 24 is a group that consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Samira is a 26-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in Hodeidah, Yemen. She studied elementary school, but couldn't complete her studies because of her family's economic situation. Two months ago, Samira decided to help her husband by earning money in order to improve their living standards. She is a door-to-door clothes seller. Her business in going very well, and she has earned good profits. Therefore, she has decided to continue her business. 

Now, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's and children's clothes, incense and perfumes. Samira looks forward to opening a small clothing and incense store, and then expanding her business to other regions.

loans.use: to buy more women's and children's clothes, incense and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 55-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 10 years to 28 years. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather conditions. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to invest back into her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A senhora ana ế casada e mae de 3 filhos dos quais dois frenquentam ensino primario. Vive com seu marido e com amis um familiar sob sua responsabilidade. Tem um salario mensal na sua actividade laboral.
Com o presente emprestimo de 40.000,00mt pretende comprar materiais de construcao para concluir a  obra da sua casa e no futurao mais proximo, iniciar um negocio de papelaria.
Tem como desafio terminar a sua lincenciatura e sonha tornar se um empresario de sucesso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is married and has three children, two of whom attend elementary school. She lives with her husband and a family member who's under her care. She earns a monthly salary from her work.
With the current loan for 40,000mt she intends to purchase construction supplies in order to finish building her house. In the near future she'll start a stationery business.
Her challenge is finishing her undergraduate studies. She dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Los Puntualitos De Oyara Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PUNTUALITOS DE OYARA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de truchas, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the LOS PUNTUALITOS DE OYARA Communal Bank.  This bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, which belongs to the province of La Convención in the department of Cusco.

Bank Member Marisol is 46 years old and in a relationship.  She works at her grocery business and she also has a business selling trout.  She sells necessity items, such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She has had her business for a year and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery business.  She is requesting this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice. 

The other bank members work in farming, selling fruit, selling groceries, and selling prepared foods.
 
This bank member thanks those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments in the designated time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice

loans.name: Erika Paola

texts.es:
Ella es erika paola, con apenas 15 años ella no tenía nada claro a qué dedicarse en el futuro, entre las sesiones a las que asistió en el colegio hubo una que le gustó especialmente, no recuerda con exactitud qué les dijo aquella recién graduada en Enfermería, solo sabe que habló tan convencida de la carrera y de lo lejos que se  puede llegar sin salir de la habitación del paciente, llego  a casa y le dijo a la madre que quería estudiar para  ser enfermera.
