She hopes that her children get a good education and can enjoy a better standard of living than she has had.  

Thanks the community loans program at FUSAI, Maria can have access to finance and improve her situation little by little.  Considering the future well, Maria has decided to ask for this loan to invest in building materials for a kitchen, such as corrugated sheets and wood.  She tells us that she has the means to pay off the loan in the required monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy corrugated sheets and wood to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Makane's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui été crée le 04 juin 2011.Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. Elles vivent une bonne cohésion sociale et exercent le petit commerce comme activité.
Awa, celle qui lève la main sur la photo est représentante du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants, dont 3 fille, la cadette a 4 ans. Elle fait comme activité le commerce. Avec le prêt elle compte acheter du bissap et du niébé en quantité, qu'elle va stocker jusqu' au moment favorable pour la vente. La bassine de bissap coute actuellement 1500f à 2000f; d'ici 5 mois elle va le revendre à 3000f. Concernant le niébé elle achète le kg à 400f pour revendre à 500f.
Les bénéfices lui permettront d'acheter des moutons qu'elle va élever pour les besoins de la famille. Elle va renforcer son activité et appuyer ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group, which consists of three women, is part of a Banc Villageois created on June 4, 2011.  The members of the group live in the same village or in a village nearby.  They are united by a good social cohesion and work in small retail.

Awa, raising her hand in the photo, is the group's representative.  She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of seven children, three of whom are girls.  Her youngest daughter is four years old.  Awa is involved in retail business.  She plans to use her loan to buy large quantities of hibiscus leaves and cowpeas, which she will store until the time is right to sell.  A large bowl of hibiscus leaves currently costs between 1,500 and 2,000 francs.  In five months, she will be able to resell the same for 3,000 francs.  As for cowpeas, Awa pays 400 francs for a kilo and resells the same for 500 francs.

With her profits, Awa will buy some sheep that she will raise to meet her family's needs.  She will also boost her business and contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy hibiscus leaves and cowpeas.

loans.name: Sylver

texts.en:
Sylver used his previous loan to buy clothes to sell. Being an innovative man, he used the proceeds from the clothing sales, his piggery and restaurant businesses to start up a retail shop dealing in general merchandise for his wife to supplement the family's income. He has great dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children, though he is challenged with limited capital to expand his businesses.

Sylver wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store and increase sales. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to sell

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim is requesting a new loan to buy net materials for producing bathing scrubs. Tim's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy net materials for producing bathing scrubs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as rice and confectionery to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store, to increase sales, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as rice and confectionery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the range of things she sells.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está soltero y vive junto con su hermana y dos sobrinos que ambos cuidan, pues otra hermana se los dejó cuando se fue para Estados Unidos, los sobrinos tienen entre 15 y 17 años de edad y actualmente estudian en secundaria. 


Juan siempre se ha dedicado al trabajo de motorista, trabajó más de 25 años conduciendo buses de transporte público y actualmente conduce un taxi alquilado con el cual le ha ido muy bien y  lleva más de tres años laborando con él.

Él necesita de este préstamo, para cambiar el techo de su casa, por lo que es necesario comprar “duralita” ya que está muy vieja y fácilmente se quiebra, además ya viene el invierno y quiere prevenir por lo cual le urge cambiar el techo de su casa.

Él sueña con tener un taxi propio, pues así ya no tendría que alquilar y estaría más conforme. También desea que sus sobrinos salgan adelante, se gradúen y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan is 46 years old. He finished ninth grade in school. He is single and lives with his sister and two nephews who he both cares for since another sister left them behind when she moved to the U.S. The nephews are 15 and 17 years old and are currently in high school.

Juan always has been dedicated to work as a driver. He worked more than 25 years driving public transport buses and currently drives a rented taxi which has gone very well and he has three years experience doing this.

He needs this loan to change the roof on his house. For this, it is necessary to buy "Duralita" since the roof is very old and could easily fall in. Also, since winter is coming, he wants to prepare so he is urged to change the roof on his house.

He dreams of having his own taxi as then he would not have to rent and he would be more comfortable. Also, he wishes that his nephews get ahead, graduate and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy Duralita (roofing material) and change the roof of his house.

loans.name: God's Hand Group

texts.en:
God's Hand Group consists of two members who live in Dansoman, Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan of 2,600 GHS from ID Ghana to invest into slippers and porridge.

Eric is a 32-year-old single man from Dansoman, Accra, Ghana, who is the featured borrower. Eric didn't give up and started a business with the little money he had six years ago. He sells ladies slippers at the market. Currently, he wants to buy different ladies slippers, but he doesn't have enough capital. He decided to apply for a loan of 1,400 GHS from ID Ghana in order to purchase more slippers to sell to customers. 

He looks forward to improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to look after her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Franklin Adalberto

texts.es: Franklin, un hombre de 29 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace más de 6 años. Él, su esposa e hijo habitan en casa propia y gracias al gran esfuerzo que junto a su esposa realizan mantienen la economía del hogar y tratan de dar a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida. Franklin desea construir un cuarto dormitorio en su terreno para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Franklin, 29, has been selling bread for more than six years.  He lives with his wife and son in their own house.  They are able to pay for household expenses thanks to their hard work.  They do everything they can to give their son a good standard of living. 
 
Franklin wants to build a bedroom on his plot of land, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron.  He hopes to be able to get this loan so that he can start building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro, requiere un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tinta, papelería y algunas piezas para la imprenta, de esta manera podrá continuar trabajando y respondiendo a los compromisos económicos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su producción y a cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, actualmente sus ingresos son mejores.
texts.en:
Pedro needs a new loan to invest it in the purchase of ink, paper and some pieces for the press so he will be able to continue working and responding to the financial commitments he has under his responsibility.

The previous loan helped him to improve production and meet his customers' orders. Currently, his income is better.

loans.use: to buy ink, paper and some pieces for the printing press.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is an ethnic Egyptian married mother of two who needs your financial help to renovate her so called ‘home’. She is very poor, as you can see from the photograph, and she also suffers from heart conditions. 

Kindly note that many members of the Egyptian community due to lack of nutrition and terrible living conditions suffer from many diseases unfortunately. A few of them, after the communist era collapsed, made a better life, yet some of them still suffer. Day after day, you see parents and children of this community digging in the large trash bins of cites for sellable scrap.

Together with her husband, they do night watch for pay in addition to their little agricultural activity on the site; they plant beans, potatoes, tomatoes and onions and sell them to the farmer’s market.

loans.use: this extremely poor ethnic woman needs your help to make some basic renovations to her so called 'family home'

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks and pure water to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas vive en la ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde siembra café , cacao, té y frutas como por ejemplo naranjas, papayas, plátanos, guanabas, mandarina, mangos y otras. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes.

Felicitas agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Felicitas lives in the city of Huayopata that is located in the province of Convencion in the region of Cusco. Her main economic activity is farming where she plants coffee, cocoa, tea and fruit like, for example, oranges, papayas, bananas, guanabas, tangerines and others. She is a responsible and friendly person who has belonged to the "Buena Vista" (good view) community bank of the Arariwa Association for many years. At this time, she needs the loan to buy fertilizers.

Felicitas thanks the investors for the loan and promises to make payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggie cubes to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es:
Maria Paz es una mujer joven y luchadora, emprendedora con una edad de 21 años, casada y madre de 1 hijo el cual está muy pequeño y no estudia ya que no está en edad escolar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario incompleto el cual curso hasta el cuarto grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. En compañía de su esposo ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra aproximadamente hace varios años ya que en la zona la actividad que genera dinero para el sustento de las diferentes familias es la caficultura. Las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos son elaboradas por ellos 2 y juntos son apoyo mutuo en la agricultura como unión familiar las cuales están ubicadas en la misma zona donde ella habita a la cual se traslada caminando. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local en pequeña escala con los diferentes vendedores que llegan a la zona ya que el acceso a la misma no es difícil y puede transitar vehículo. 
Actualmente Maria Paz solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos que mejoraran sus cultivos de café ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar sus cosechas y el producto para generar ingresos para su familia. Sus planes y metas a futuro son de ampliar sus cultivos comprando más tierra en la que ella pueda trabajar y fortalecer el patrimonio para sus futuros hijos venideros. Su sueño es ver a su hijo realizado y estudiado a nivel universitario ya que de esa forma ella podrá prepararlo académicamente y dando en el seguridad y confianza para desenvolverse en un futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Paz, 21, is a young hard-working woman with a nose for business.  She is married with one son who is very young and not old enough to go to school yet.  She studied until fourth grade but had to give up her education because her parents did not have enough money to support her.  

She learnt from her husband how to work on the land a few years ago.  Growing coffee is a very important industry in her area and helps families get along in life.  Both of them work on the plantations which are a short walk away from where she lives.  She sells her product at the local market on a small scale to the various traders who visit the area.   Visitors have easy access to the place where she lives and can reach them by car.

Maria Paz is asking for help to buy supplies which will help improve her coffee plants and make sure that she gets a good harvest.  This will provide an income for her family.  In the future, she would like to expand her plantation, buying more land to work on and setting the family business up for her future children. 
 
She dreams of seeing her son studying at university and getting a good education which will give him confidence and allow him to develop in later life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies which will help her protect and maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alicia en su anterior credikiva, pues con esta inversión pudo responder a los pedidos de su clientela fija y ocasional, referente a ropa calzado, cosméticos y variedades. Con este credikiva fortaleció su capital de trabajo logrando así beneficiarse, aumentar las ventas y utilidad  de su negocio. Desde que recibió su credikiva sus ingreos familiares mejoraron pues las utilidades sirvieron para reinvertir y fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, utiles escolares y además cosméticos con lo que planea  aumentar  sus ventas y utilidades una vez mas. Ella dice a sus finaciadores " Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pido que sigan apoyandome para continuar progresando con mi negocio. " Con su nuevo credikiva adaptará sus inventarios a la temporada escolar para que su clientela siempre esté satisfecha.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Alicia with her last Kiva loan.  With that investment, she was able to buy shoes, cosmetics and various other items to satisfy the demand of her regular customers and of some new ones.  In turn, she was able to make a profit and increase her sales and productivity.  She was also able to take care of the household expenses and improve their standard of living by reinvesting the money in her family life.
  
She is now asking for a new loan to buy shoes, school supplies and cosmetics, which will help her to increase her sales and service once again.  She says, “Thank you very much to Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  I hope you continue offering me your support so I can develop my business”.  With her new loan she will adapt her stock so that she has goods for the new school season, which will meet demand and keep her customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rokhy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 8 femmes, a été crée le 24 octobre 2007. Il est composé de membres qui habitent dans le même village et les villages environnants. Les membres vivent une bonne entente et sont très solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche.
Rockhy,assise sur la chaise et levant la main, est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 garçons. 
Avec le prêt elle va acheter un bœuf pour l'engraisser à 200000f et de l’aliment pour le nourrir. Elle va aussi prendre en charge le frais vétérinaires. Avec le reste de l'argent elle mène comme activité parallèle la vente de bissap et de mil.
Elle compte aider sa  famille surtout pour les besoins en nourriture et les frais médicaux. Elle compte aussi renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" of which this group of 8 women is part, was created on October 24, 2007. It consists of members who live in the same village and the surrounding villages. The members get along well and are very united. Their main businesses are shopkeeping and animal fattening.

Rockhy, sitting on the chair and raising her hand, is 43 years old. She is married and mother to 2 boys.

With the loan she is going to buy an ox to fatten it at 200,000 f and food to feed it. She is also going to take care of the veterinary expenses. With the rest of the money she simultaneously manages the sale of bissap and mil [African cereal].

She plans to help her family especially with food needs and medical expenses. She also plans to strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy an ox, mil [African cereal] and bissap.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.fr:
Désiré  fait partie du groupe Business et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est célibataire de 28 ans. Il a sous sa charge un membre de sa famille élargie . 

Il  fait le commerce de  chaussure  depuis  4 ans. 

Il  est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va acheter  beaucoup de paires de chaussures à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les  prochaines années, il voudrait  augmenter son capital parce qu’il a eu des pertes lors de l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura en 2013.
texts.en:
Désiré is part of the group Business and lives in Bujumbura. He is single and 28 years old. He has a member of his extended family under his care.

He has been selling shoes for 4 years.

He is on his fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is going to buy many pairs of shoes to resell, to make more.

In the coming years, he would like to increase his capital because he had losses during the fire at the central market in Bujumbura in 2013.

loans.use: to buy many pairs of shoes to resell, to make more.

loans.name: Fatou Faye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont fait parti ce groupe de 8 femmes, a été crée le 24 octobre 2007. Il est composé de membres qui habitent dans le même village et les villages environnants. Les membres vivent une bonne entente et sont très solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'embouche. 
Fatou,assise sur la chaise et levant la main, est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont une fille. 
Avec le prêt elle va faire de la couture. Elle confectionne des draps et des pagnes pour les revendre. Elle achète du tissu et du fil en quantité pour coudre elle même les draps et les pagnes. Elle a une bonne expérience avec cette activité pour l'avoir depuis son adhésion dans le banc villageois.
Elle compte renforcer ses épargne avec les bénéfices et pourvoir à ces besoins et celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" of which this group of 8 women is part, was created on October 24, 2007. It consists of members who live in the same village and the surrounding villages. The members get along well and are very united. Their main businesses are shopkeeping and animal fattening.

Fatou, sitting on the chair and raising her hand, is 42 years old. She is married and mother to 3 children of whom one is a girl.

With the loan she is going to sew. She makes sheets and pagnes to resell. She buys fabric and thread in large quantities to sew herself even sheets and pagnes. She has good experience in this business, since joining the "banc villageois."

She plans to strengthen her savings with the profits and take care of her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Shri Lakkammadevi - Nandikeshwar Group

texts.en:
Shankaravva (the lady in extreme left & wearing green sari in the photo) aged 40 years, lives in Nandikeshwara, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She has 2 sons who are in school. Her husband runs a small business and she is a daily wage labor in agriculture fields and earns 100 Indian Rupees (INR) a day. Her family is traditionally into sheep & goat rearing. Hence she has good experience & is well aware of the activity.

Shankaravva has done schooling till second grade. By rearing more goats and sheep she wants to increase her family income and for that she needs a loan. Her dream is to uplift her family economically, give a good education to her children and support her husband.

She is the leader of "Shri Lakkammadevi" Joint Liability Group (JLG). In the group totally there are six members and all are doing coolie work as well as rearing goats and sheep.

loans.use: To buy lambs for rearing

loans.name: Sokort

texts.en: Sokort is 50 years old and a widow with three children at Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a beer retailer and her child is a staff member of a Microfinance Institution. Both of them can earn $15 per day. She would like to apply for loan of $500 to buy beer to sell to for her clients. This loan helps her to have enough capital to run her business. She hopes that her business can be expanded and her house can be renovated.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of medicines to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, to increase her income, and to help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of medicines to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 31-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy stock of groceries to open a grocery store for his wife. This will enable them to increase their income. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to open a grocery store

loans.name: Phung

texts.en: Phung is requesting a new loan to buy a hair washing chair, hair tools, and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a hair washing chair, hair tools, and shampoos to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying more gas tanks and gas cookers from different suppliers to satisfy her customers. Lien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks and gas cookers for selling.

loans.name: Humility Group

texts.en:
The Humility Group consists of three members who live in Dansoman, Accra-Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 1,500 from ID-Ghana to invest in cosmetics, plastic products and groceries.

Faustina is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Dansoman, Accra-Ghana. She is the featured borrower. 

She has been selling cosmetics for seven years. Currently, she wants to buy more cosmetics, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 500 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more cosmetics and sell them to customers. She looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, plastic products and groceries.

loans.name: Gam

texts.en:
Gam is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a grocery store business for the people in their community.

Gam would like a loan to purchase better quality foods such as rice and vegetables to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality foods such as rice and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yenny Maritza

texts.es:
Ella es Yenny Maritza, es una persona amable,  honesta, cumplida, respetuosa, paciente y con mucho optimismo y responsabilidad con todo lo que se propone, con ganas de seguir adelante para cumplir las metas adquiridas.
Ella va estudiar en Campo Alto  el programa Auxiliar Administrativo en salud, ya que  le gusta toda la parte de facturación, atención al usuario y la parte administrativa para crecer personal, laboral mente y  alcanzar los logros,  ella quiere que la tengan en cuenta en el convenio kiva para que el valor de las cuotas que ella cancela quede un poco mas económico.
texts.en:
This is Yenny Maritza. She is a friendly, honest, organized, respectful, and patient person. With much optimism and responsibility in everything she does, she wants to get ahead to meet her goals.  

She is going to go to school at Campo Alto in the Administrative Health Aide program, because she likes everything about billing, customer service and administration. She wants to grow personally and professionally and meet her goals. She wants to be helped with the Kiva contract so that the payments she makes will be a little more economical.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Fatmata from Jui in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. For the past five years, Fatmata has established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. six days a week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and lacking a proper business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase drinks, pure water and a block of ice to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, pure water and a block of ice to expand her business.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en: Trang, a 26-year-old mother of one son, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a driver for hire. She supports her family by making bathing scrubs, a business she began four years ago.  Trang requires a loan to purchase larger quantities of net materials and related equipment, to produce and sell a larger quantity of products. She hopes that her business runs smoothly and enables her to improve her family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase net materials and related equipment to produce and sell bathing scrubs products.

loans.name: Xoan

texts.en: Xoan, 35 years old, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Xoan and her husband earn money through their business producing belts. She would like to get a loan to buy a stock of leather to increase her production of belts, so that she can better meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy leather to make belts.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina, es viuda, vive sola, sus hijos ya son independientes,  se dedica a la crianza de ganado y la agricultura, trabaja todos los días, ella cuida de su ganado y la agricultura la realiza con ayuda de mozos, son conocimientos que heredo de su padre.
Está solicitando un préstamo para pagar la recolección de caña y molerla en el trapiche, con esta inversión procera en menos tiempo la caña para que el dulce de atado sea comercializado y así tener mejores ingresos.
Su aspiración es mejorar su economía y poco a poco ir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquilina, a widow, lives alone; her children already live on their own.

Aquilina works every day and earns a living raising livestock and farming.  She takes care of her livestock herself and farms with the help of laborers.  She acquired this knowledge from her parents.

Aquilina's requesting a loan to pay to pick the cane and grind it at the mill.  This investment will allow the cane to be processed more quickly so she can sell "dulce de atado" [log-shaped candy] and earn more income.

Her goal is to improve her finances and expand her business little by little.

loans.use: to pay for picking sugar cane

loans.name: Teona

texts.en: Teona is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Zugdidi district with her husband and two children. Her children go to the local kindergarten. Her husband works at a local car wash and gets 250 GEL monthly. Teona and her husband are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grown nut trees. The harvest is sold to local retailers. Teona decided to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 1,000 for purchasing a cow. When the cow is purchased, Teona will start producing dairy products. Teona will sell the dairy products and will raise her income. With increased income, she will provide better living conditions to her family. Teona awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to produce dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.


El socio Lauro se dedica  al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y plátanos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el terreno de cultivo.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of  Huayopata, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cuzco.

Lauro works in the business of agriculture. He has some land where he grows coffee, cacao and plantains. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m, With this business, he wants to get ahead. He has been doing it for several years and it is going very well for him. His dream is to expand the area of the crop. He is asking for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil and bags of garri

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Rugiatu from Jui Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone.  She is married with 5 children.  For the past 4 years, Rugiatu established her retail business.  She began her business because she wants to develop her home.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and a proper business location.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase bread and general stock to expand her business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her status of living and increase her business.  In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business even more.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bread and general stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Feda

texts.en: Feda is a hard working single woman, age 25, living in Hoima,Uganda.  She has a boutique business and has additional income from a pool table.  She started the business in 2009 to be self sustainable and be able to meet her increasing needs.  Feda hopes to a have a reknowned and fully stocked boutique so as to attract more customers and increase her profits even though she gets seasonal customers.  She is acquiring a loan to add more stocks of clothes in her shop.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes in her shop.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Fatmata from Jui western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children. For the past five years, Fatmata has established her medical drugs business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 A.M. until 5:30 P.M.  seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children, and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, candy, biscuits, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark has been photographed with his wife, Vitore.  The minibus you see in the background is what Marks uses for the transportation of school children. The loan that Mark is requesting from Kiva lenders will help him get the papers from the city to start running the school minibus again after the recent changes in the procedures and tougher rules in driving from the Ministry of Transportation. 

Mark and his wife have four children.  In addition to the transportation business they practice agriculture/livestock as well.  They’ve got one dairy cow, five goats and they plant mostly potatoes; they sell raw milk and baby animals and potatoes at the local farmers’ market.  They come from the rural north and the way Vitore is dressed is traditional amongst women in that region.

loans.use: after the recent changes in the procedures and tougher rules in driving from the Ministry of Transportation, Mark needs to get papers for the minibus to start running it soon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her shop with different types of plastic utensils and sets of pans.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown. She is married with three children, who are currently attending school.  For the past four years, Rugiatu has established her fast food business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to take care of her family. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her operation area.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Rugiatu plans to expand her business to the higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He has a bar located on a busy street, that sells drinks. Robert is charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. He does farming on a large scale, and earns a salary as an additional income. Robert started the business to increase the household income. His major clients are the community around Masindi. Robert has a great dream of educating his children and starting up a research institute of farming. However, he is challenged with weather changes and price fluctuations. He intends to use the loan to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Turemeshanye Group

texts.fr:
Odette  fait partie du groupe Turemeshanye et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à  Joseph,  un  menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, le cadet a 13ans et l’aîné 18ans, tous étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  riz  depuis  14 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité  beaucoup de kilos de riz à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir il voudrait être une exportatrice de riz dans les pays voisins et voir ses enfants étudier
texts.en:
Odette is a member of the Turemeshanye group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and married to Joseph, a carpenter. The couple have 2 children, the youngest of whom is 13 and the eldest, 18. Both of the children attend school.

Odette has been selling rice for 14 years. This is her 18th loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will enable her to buy several kilos of rice for resale, so that she can earn more money. In the coming years, she would like to become an exporter of rice to neighbouring countries, and to see her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of rice for resale.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 4 juin 2011.Une bonne entente règne entre les membres qui composent ce banc. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Sagar debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 filles. Les 3 derniers n'ont pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école.
Avec le prêt elle va acheter 1000kg de mil à 200f le kg pour le revendre à 300f le kg. Elle va aussi acheter 40 bassine de bissap à 2500f l'une et du niébe pour une valeur de 75000f. Le reste de l'argent va constituer son fond de commerce.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille: en nourriture, en santé.
texts.en:
This group of 2 women was created on the 4th of June, 2011. The two women enjoy a good relationship. Their main activity is retail.

Sagar, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of 9 children, 4 of whom are girls. The 3 youngest children are too young to go to school yet. She will use this loan to buy 1000 kilos of millet (at 200 francs a kilo) so that she can resell it at 300 francs a kilo. She will also buy 40 containers of dried hibiscus flower (at 2500 francs a container) and 75 000 francs worth of black-eyed peas. The rest of the money will be invested in her business. The profits will be used to take care of the family's food and health needs.

loans.use: to buy millet, black-eyed peas and dried hibiscus flowers.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez, age 33, has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 8 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help Kaneez continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for her embroidery business

loans.name: Zula

texts.en:
Zula is married with seven children. Four of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (an aunt). She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.

Zula has a business making and selling samosas and chapatti. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include defaulters and ever increasing prices of cooking oil and wheat flour. She generates additional income from farming. She aspires to own a big bakery and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Zula has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil for her business making samosas and chapatti

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en:
Sarrah is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is from Jui in the  western rural area in Freetown.  Sarrah operates a retail business selling charcoal and wood, which she has been doing for five years. She works at the business throughout the week. Her main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Sarrah requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics and plates.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr:
Ce membre fait parti du banc villageois qui été créé le 4 juin 2011.
Rachelle est une femme âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 filles. 
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter un bœuf à 2500000f, de l'aliment pour le nourrir à 50000f. Au bout de 3 mois elle va le vendre à 400000f. Elle va aussi acheter pour une valeur de 100000f des porcs qu'elle va élever aussi.
Avec les bénéfices elle va réinvestir dans la couture, elle va agrandir ces centres de couture qui se trouve dans la localité.
texts.en: Rachelle is a member of the "banc villageois" which was created on the 4th of June, 2011. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 4 daughters. She will use this loan to buy a head of cattle (for 250 000 francs) and some feed (50 000 francs worth). She will resell the ox after 3 months for 400 000 francs. She will also buy 100 000 francs worth of pigs which she will also raise. She will use the profits to invest in her tailoring business and expand the sewing workshops she owns in the area.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle and some pigs.

loans.name: Waziran

texts.en:
Waziran is a 41-year-old married woman in business selling milk for many years. She has one cow for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of five children and is very motivated to provide for them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.

Waziran has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with their support. Now she requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase one buffalo. She hopes to increase her milk production capacity which ultimately helps generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo for milk sales

loans.name: La Paix Du Christ Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX DU CHRIST est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ziarath (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 33 ans a fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Ziarath est mariée à un marchand nommé Yacoubou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ziarath vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont supportées par Ziarath et son mari. C’est pour cette raison, Ziarath vend des friperies, du savon et divers articles dans sa boutique depuis quatre ans environ. Ziarath s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de diversifier son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle Ziarath ensemble avec les membres du groupe LA PAIX DU CHRIST 1 sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The "La Paix Du Christ" group is made up of 3 friends. The group representative, Ziarath (the woman with her hand raised in the picture) is 33 years old went to school until secondary level. Ziarath is married to a merchant called Yacoubou. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom attend school. Ziarath lives with her husband and children. Both Ziarath and her husband cover the family expenses. In order to be able to cover those expenses, Ziarath has been selling second-hand clothing and other items in her shop for about 4 years. Ziarath gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Ziarath is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the "La Paix Du Christ" group, so that she can diversify her business and better meet the needs of her customers. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and other items.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a male, married and age 59 years. He has ten children and only five attend school. He is a teacher and the sole breadwinner of his family. He has hopes of educating all his children plus starting up a piggery project for additional income as he has the difficulty of little salary pay from the government. Francis is acquiring a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 39-year-old married woman in business selling bed covers and bed sheets for the past 7 years with her son. She offers great variety to her customers and has become famous in her locality. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy good quality bed sheets, covers and spreads to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy good quality bed sheets, covers and spreads for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lumber for his carpentry work

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of seven. 

She has been running a business selling cloth for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Najma requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew lives in the town of Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming whereby he cultivates maize at a large scale and also buys and sells to others. His business is located in a rural area. He started the business because it is what he could manage to do based on the fact that agriculture is the backbone of our Ugandan economy. Andrew has a great dream of buying a motor vehicle to aid him in transporting his products to his customers despite being challenged by weather changes. 

He wants a loan to buy produce.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lumber and grinding wheels

loans.name: Doriss

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Doriss from Jui Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. 

For the past 10 years, Doriss has been establishing her milk business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is moving door to door, which is very difficult.

Doriss requires a loan in order to purchase bag of milk to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Doriss plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 39 years old and a married woman. She has six children and one of her sons is shown in the photo. He is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for five years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Naila has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She has been successfully running a small general store. She offers various goods of daily use at reasonable prices. Her husband assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. By now she has attained a good number of regular customers. 

 She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, toffees, snacks and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her ninth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of sugar, biscuits, toffees, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more children's used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Shugfta

texts.en:
Shugfta is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been doing a business of tailoring for the past three years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household with the educational needs of children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

She has now requested a loan of 55,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more reels of threads, and packs of buttons and laces, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shugfta hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, and packs of buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Agness from Jui, western rural area, in Freetown. She is married with two children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Agness runs a retail business; she sell charcoal and wood for resale. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and six days per week. Agness says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operation area.

Agness has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza, a 36-year-old woman, has been photographed with her husband, Ylli (Star ,in English) and with their middle child in front of their barn.  They’ve got three kids, 11, six, and one year old. The loan will be used for health reasons, since her sister-in-law, for whom they are the caretakers and who lives with them, is paralyzed on the right side of her body.
Mimoza and her family live in a little town where the unemployment rate remains higher than other parts of the country.  During the communist era, this town was 100% industrial and had a zero unemployment rate.  There were a super-phosphate plant, a copper smelting plant and a chromium processing plant.  All these have not been functioning ever since the collapse. The only one that still remains in action is the pant processing flour, that is operated by a private company.

loans.use: to take her paralyzed sister-in-law to the doctors

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 48 year-old married woman who has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has two calves and three buffaloes. She sells milk to many of her neighbors and other people in her community.  Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life. She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 
It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation.  Now she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, age 49, is a married woman. She deals in a business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase more cattle. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 24-year-old married woman who is running a business selling milk. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

She needs to earn much more to meet everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy one more buffalo to meet the demand of more of her customers. She expects a boost in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Bernardo Afrodicio

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su familia. Bernardo es un joven trabajador quien  desde muy pequeño aprendió el oficio de albañilería dado que no tuvo la oportunidad de sacar una carrera universitaria. Muchas personas lo conocen y saben de la calidad de trabajos que realiza por lo que tiene muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios. Bernardo desea reparar el techo  y encementar el piso de a vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de tejas, madera, arena, cemento y ladrillo de piso.
texts.en: Bernardo is 23 years old and lives in a home of his own with his family.  Bernardo is a young worker who learned to be a mason when he was very small, given that he didn’t have the opportunity to attend university.  Many people know him and know that he provides quality services, so many customers seek his services.  Bernardo wants to repair his roof and install a cement floor in his home, so he is asking for this loan through FUSAI so he can buy tiles, lumber, sand, cement, and bricks for the floor.

loans.use: to repair his roof and install a cement floor.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali wants a loan to invest in produce/maize business. He is a male, married, aged 35 years, and has four children. He is a businessman dealing in produce and has additional income which he gets from a maize milling machine. He started business in 2010 with an aim of  improving household income. He hopes to purchase a second milling machine and expand the business but finds a challenge of inadequate capital. He is an honest man and would like to tell lenders to continue with this program which has improved people's standards of living.

loans.use: invest in produce/maize business

loans.name: Edwin Ignacio

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven , preocupado por el bienestar de su familia, actualmente  tiene una relacion estable de la cual han procreado un hijo, por quien lucha cada dia para darle un mejor nivel de vida. Este  joven labora en centro de salud desempeñandose epidemiologo, con  5 años de laborar para dicho ministerio.
este joven tiene una necesidad  de darle mayor seguridad a su familia,  por ese objetivo se presento a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un financiamiento el cual lo utilizaria en pago de tramite  y ecritura de terreno y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: Edwin is a young man concerned about his family’s wellbeing.  He is in a stable relationship and has a son for whom he strives every day to give him a better quality of life.  This young man works as an epidemiologist in the city center.  He has been doing this for five years and needs to provide more security for his family, so he approached CEPRODEL to ask for a loan, which he will use to pay for and deed some land.  This way he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay and deed land.

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year old Hulda from Jui Western rural area in Freetown. She is married and has four children. She began her business to be self-dependent. 

Hulda runs a retail business within her community, where she sells cups, plates, and food containers.  Hulda says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living.  In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en: Tanzeela is a 30 year-old married woman. She has three children.  She decided to work to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has applied a loan of PKR 40,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase cloth, spools of threads, laces and zippers in various colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, spools of threads, laces and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and the mother of three children. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been running a business selling cloth. He buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of the community, and mostly, to the shops. He has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through the business. 

Bushra is now requesting a 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) loan from the Kashf Foundation so that her husband can buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to inflate his sales. Bushra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and plans to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Hripsime

texts.en:
Hripsime lives in Sardarapat village with her husband and two sons. The whole family besides Hripsime's little son has been engaged in farming. Hripsime's little son is a student studying at a local university.
 
The farm that the family owns includes livestock (cows, calves, pig and piglets) and arable land where wheat and tomatoes are cultivated. In the village there is a high unemployment rate, but a farm business helps the family have some stable income. They sell the gathered harvest at nearby markets and gather income for the family's living expenses.

Hripsime has now applied for this loan of $1,500 to be able to purchase seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation, and to cover fuel costs. This will be a huge financial support for this family's farm, and Hripsime waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation, and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 29-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman. 

She sells sweet potatoes, and she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an ideal market, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 1,200 GHS (Ghana cedis) loan to buy more sweet potatoes to sell, and she will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. Her business goal is to have a big business with more branches within five years.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois dont ce groupe de 4 personnes fait parti; a été crée le 4 juin 2011. Les membres qui le composent habitent pour la plupart dans le même village et s'activent et en général dans le commerce et l'agriculture. Elles entretiennent de bonnes relations et ont des liens de parentés.
Amy debout sur la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 3 filles.
Avec le prêt; elle envisage de renforcer sa boutique en riz, sucre, huile et autres produits alimentaires pour une valeur de 180000f. Elle s’approvisionne dans les boutiques en gros pour revendre détail.Comme activité parallèle elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 2 moutons à 70000f
Les bénéfices serviront à prendre en charge aussi bien ses besoins que ceux de la famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois this group belongs to was established on June 4, 2011. It is made up of four women, and most of them living in the same village.

Their businesses include retail and farming. They go along well and are bound by links of kinship.

Amy, age 47, is married and the mother of eight children, three of them girls. She intends to use XOF 180'000 from her loan to increase the stock of products (rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other food products) in her shop.

She gets her supplies from wholesale stores, and resells retail. As a secondary business, she raises sheep. She will buy two sheep for XOF 70'000.

Her profits will be used to cover her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products and two sheep

loans.name: Durga Devi - Kiresur Group

texts.en:
The featured member belongs to the “Durga Devi” Joint Liability Group (JLG), which is located at Shirsur, Bagalkot, Karnataka.

Sudha (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the leader of the group. She has done her schooling until seventh grade. She is married, and her husband works in the nearby town as a daily wage worker. She is a hardworking woman, and she also works in agriculture fields for daily wages. Sudha started goat and sheep rearing so that she can contribute to the family income.  She owns a small house in their village.
  
Sudha wants a loan to expand her farm by purchasing additional sheep. She plans to use the money earned from her expanded farm to provide for and secure their future and improve the standard of living of her family.
  
The four other group members are Seetha, Bharathi, Marathangeavva and Kasibai. All the group members are very happy and excited to take this opportunity, and also are very thankful to the lenders for the support.

loans.use: to buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend to her coffee crops this season.

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARIE représente le groupe BASNEWENDE. CHANTAL se porte bien mais a décidé de faire une pose. Marie est mariée et  mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02  vont à l’école.
Mme vend des fruits depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 cartons de bananes et 03cartons d’orange.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne agrandir le champ de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is the Basnewende group representative. Chantal is doing well but has decided to take a break. Marie is married and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is 11 and the youngest, 6. Both of her children go to school.

Marie has been selling fruit for 3 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy 2 boxes of bananas and 3 boxes of oranges. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She aims to expand the area she does business in and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of bananas and 3 boxes of oranges.

loans.name: Nong6Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme SYLVIE  représente le groupe NONG-TAABA. Mariée  est mariée, elle est  mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. 02  vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des produits de beautés depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 10douzaines de différentes pommades.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne s’acheter une moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sylvie represents the Nong-Taaba group. She is married and the mother of 2 children, the eldest of whom is 13 and the youngest, 10. Both of her children go to school. She is also responsible for 4 more people.

Sylvie has been selling beauty products for 7 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are men and women. She would like to buy 10 dozen different beauty creams. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She aims to buy a motorbike and to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozen different beauty creams.

loans.name: Somsoore Iigroup

texts.fr:
Mr SOUMAILA est la responsable du groupe SOMSOORE II. Marié,  il est  maintenant père d’01 enfant  âgé de 02mois. Il a 02 personnes en charge. 
Mr vend des prêts à porter depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont  les hommes.
Il veut s’acheter 20chemises et une balle de pantalon.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il souhaite étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Soumaila is the leader of the Somsoore II group. He is married and the father of a 2-month-old infant. He is also responsible for 2 other people.

Soumaila has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for 5 years. He gets his supplies at the market in his sector. His customers are men. He would like to buy 20 shirts and a bale of trousers. He wants to reinvest his profits in his business. He would like to expand his business and take be able to better take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 20 shirts and a bale of trousers.

loans.name: Gowrishankara - Kiresur Group

texts.en:
Basamma (raised hand in the photo), aged 28 years, lives in Kiresur, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She is married and has five children; three of them are in school, and one is in pre-school, while another is still a baby. She has done her schooling until third grade only.

Her husband is a daily wage worker in agriculture fields. Basamma also works in agriculture fields as a daily wage worker, earning Rs. 100 per day. She has also started a sheep rearing farm. Basamma has been trained by the local NGO (Future Greens Samsthe) on the sheep and goat rearing techniques.  

She requests this loan to purchase more sheep so that she can expand her farm. This expansion will help her earn more income and bring in financial stability for her family.

Gowrishankara is a Joint Liability Group (JLG), where members of the group are accountable to each other for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en: Kaniz is 43 years old, married, and a mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses. Now his rickshaw requires maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Kaniz has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. Kaniz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Irene se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”. The bank is located in the district of Huayopata, belonging to the province of La Convencion and department of Cusco. Irene works in agriculture. She has a plot of land where she grows coffee, cocoa beans and bananas. The member works from 8:00 to 5:00 p.m.  The member has worked already many years in this business and is doing well. Her dream is to have a place from where she can sell the coffee. The member is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Jiguiya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, et ont en moyenne 7 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Siékourani un village de Loulouni faisant partir de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Awa fait la vente de céréale dans ce groupe de femmes Jiguiya, Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  18 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à Loulouni et les villages environnants de Loulouni. Après l’approvisionnement elle faite les stockages dans un grand magasin à domicile avant la vente. Sa vente se faite en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Jiguiya group are married women with an average age of 49 and, on average, 7 children, most of whom live in traditional families in Siékourani, a village in the rural commune of Loulouni, part of the Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are on their 25th group loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso so that they can satisfy their customer needs.

Awa is the group representative who sells cereals. She is standing second from the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 18 100-kilo bags of cereals. She gets her supplies in Loulouni and the villages around Loulouni (town). She then stores her supplies in a large warehouse on her property before reselling it. She makes her sales from her home and at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women, for cash and credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 55 000 francs, part of which she will use to repay the loan and part of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Eleanor from Jui Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wants to create income to take care of her family’s welfare.  

Eleanor runs a retail business. She sells palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Eleanor says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.

Eleanor has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family’s welfare and repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en:
Ayisha is 23 years old who financially helps her family. Five years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates so they can have a better future. Her business is beneficial for her household and society as a whole. 

Ayisha requested her third loan from Kashf Foundation for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables to accommodate more students. She hopes to have more students in her school in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as chairs and tables

loans.name: Akhtari

texts.en:
Akhtari is a 60-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business selling cloth. 

Akhtari buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Her husband is a laborer, and his income is not enough to meet his family’s expenses.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase stock of cloth in various colors and designs. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history. She expects a boost in her earnings through her larger sales.
