loans.use: to purchase stock of cloth in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende manzanas, naranjas, uvas, platanos y mandarinas, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y mandarinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “HUAYOPATA-CHONTA.” This bank is located in the district of Huayopata, province of La Convención and department of Cuzco. 

The member works selling fruits; apples, oranges, grapes, bananas and mandarins. She has a stall in the market where she sells fruits. She works from 8am to 5pm. She has been doing this work for 7 years and it’s going very well. 

Her dream is to have an on-premise place where she can sell fruits. She is requesting a loan to purchase oranges, bananas and mandarins.

She is happy for the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas and mandarins

loans.name: Siguikame Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Siguikame sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Siékourani un village de Loulouni faisant partir de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Korotoumou fait la vente de céréale dans ce groupe de femmes   Siguikame, Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  18 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à Loulouni et les villages environnants de Loulouni. Après l’approvisionnement elle faite les stockages dans un grand magasin à domicile avant la vente. Sa vente se faite en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Siguikame group are married women with an average age of 46 and, on average, 4 children, most of whom live in traditional families in Siékourani, a village in the rural commune of Loulouni, part of the Sikasso region (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are on their 24th group loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to satisfy their customer needs.

Korotoumou is the group representative who sells cereals. She is standing second from the right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 18 100-kilo bags of cereals. She gets her supplies in Loulouni and the villages around Loulouni (town). She then stores her supplies in a large warehouse on her property before reselling it. She makes her sales, for cash or credit, from her home and at the market to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and part of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Norapat village with her husband, daughter, and son. Her children are students and her husband is a constructor. 

Gayane is an agronomist. She cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, and cabbages and sells the gathered harvest in nearby markets. 

Gayane has now asked for this loan of USD 1,300 to purchase seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation and to expand her farming business. The loan is important for Gayane's farm and she hopes that lenders will support her.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Vyara Group

texts.fr:
M Jeanne fait partie du groupe  Vyara et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 32 ans. Elle a 2 enfants l’un a  6 ans et l’autre de 7 ans.
Il a sous sa charge son cousin qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce des habits et du charbon de bois   depuis  2ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  être un importatrice des habits et  voir ses enfants  étudient.
texts.en: M. Jeanine is a member of the Vyara group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 32-year-old widow with 2 children aged 6 and 7. She is also taking care of a cousin of hers who is a student. She has been selling clothing and charcoal for 2 years. This is her first loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her working capital and enable her to buy a lot of clothing for resale, so that she can earn more. In the coming years, she would like to become a clothing importer and watch her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a lot of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: Don Zenón es originario de la comarca El Pochote en la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de dos hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de Artesanía en cuero. Inicio su negocio como ayudante de su hermano en la elaboración de mecate para luego comercializarlos.  Su meta próxima es seguir trabajando en el negocio y lograr cancelar el crédito. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Espuelas de acero y Cuero en pie. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecerles mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes y lograra obtener mejores ingresos. Su plan futuro es comprar un vehículo para poder movilizar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Zenón is originally from the region of El Pochote in the city of Boaco. He is married and is a father of two children. He is a trader and works in the business of leather handicraft. He began his business as his brother’s assistant making mecate (a rein system) to later sell.  His next goal is to continue working in his business and pay off his loan.
 
He is requesting a loan to purchase steel spurs and leather. He is happy the loan will be a great help because he can offer more quantity of products to his clients and earn a better income.

His plan for the future is to purchase a vehicle to be able to move his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase steel spurs and leather.

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est la responsable du groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que les autres membres. Marié, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. Ses clients sont les gens du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 03 rangées de bois et 05sacs de charbon de bois.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lamoussa is responsible for Sidlawende II Group. She's very well, as are the other members of the group. She's married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 15 years old, the youngest is 5. Two of them attend school.

Mrs. Lamoussa has been selling firewood and charcoal for the past seven years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding provinces. Her customers are people from the neighborhood.

She wants to buy three cords of wood and five sacks of charcoal. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. She ambitions to expand her business an improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 cords of wood and 5 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Gruhalakshmi - Mallapur Group

texts.en:
Renuka lives in Mallapur, Bagalkot district, Karnataka, India. She is married and has one daughter and two sons. Her husband is working as a mason. Her family owns a small house in their village. She is presently into sheep and goat rearing. She also works as a daily wage worker in others’ fields in her village and earn Rs.75 per day. 

Renuka is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. The present income is not enough to maintain her family. She is the group leader of a five-member group. With the loan, she is seeking to purchase more sheep, then rear and sell them. 

With the expected profits from her expanded farm, she wants to provide her children a good education and improve the living standards of her family. 

This is the first time the group, Gruhalakshmi - Mallapur, a Joint Liability Group (JLG), is taking a loan. The other four members of her group are Santangeavva, Suvarna, Basavva and Girija. They all want loans for the same purpose, and they are daily wage workers in agriculture fields.

loans.use: to buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Scarleth De Los Angeles

texts.es: Scarleth es una joven comerciante de productos varios de manera ambulante, es soltera sin hijos, apoya a sus padres con sus  gastos diarios, solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio con productos de limpieza del hogar,   utensilios de cocina, ropa nueva, calzado, que le permitan realizar sus ventas satisfactoriamente, esperando en un futuro crecer en productos y obtener más  clientela, mejorando así sus ingresos.
texts.en: Scarleth is a young business woman who sells a variety of things in the streets. She is single with no children. She supports her parents with the daily expenses. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business buying cleaning products, cooking utensils, new clothing and footwear. This will allow her to make her sales and she hopes that in the future to have more products and gain more clients, in order to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to invest in home cleaning products, cooking utensils, new clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Hakilitoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Hakilitoyerela sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Siékourani un village de Loulouni faisant partir de la région de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur vingt-cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Minata faite la vente de céréale dans ce groupe de femmes  Hakilitoyerela, Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  18 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à Loulouni et les villages environnants de Loulouni. Après l’approvisionnement elle faite les stockages dans un grand magasin à domicile avant la vente. Sa vente se faite en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of group Hakilitoyerela are married women, who are on average 46 years old with six children. Most of them live in traditional families in Siekourani, a village from Loulouni township, in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).
To meet their customers' expectations, this is their twenty-fifth solidarity loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.
In this women's group from Hakilitoyerela, Mrs. Minata trades in cereals. She is standing in second place from the left to the right in the picture.
With her loan, she plans on purchasing 18 hundred-kilo bags of cereals. She gets her supplies from Loulouni and neighboring villages. After purchase, she stocks merchandise in a large store in her house, until the sale. She retails from home to a mixed-gender clientele, and she accepts cash or extends credit.
She is counting on an average monthly benefit of 55,000 XOF, part of which will be used to pay back the loan with interests, and part of which will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Leonisia Isabel

texts.es:
Leonisia, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar madera, loza, pintura, entre otros materiales que le servirán para crear sus diferentes artesanías.
Para Leonisia el crédito anterior le facilito la adquisición de materiales que le han permitido aumentar  la producción, incrementar sus ventas, ganar nuevos clientes y la su situación económica está más estable.
texts.en: Leonisia has decided to get another loan to buy wood, ceramics, paint and other materials which she uses to make her different handicrafts. Her previous loan allowed Leonisia to acquire materials to increase her production, improve her sales, gain new clients and make her financial situation more stable.

loans.use: to buy wood, ceramics, paint, etc.

loans.name: Wend Goudoum Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZARATA représente le groupe WEND GOUDOUM. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 05mois. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 07personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration (vente d’haricot) depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 05sachets d’attiéké (couscous de manioc), 02bidons  d’huile et  01sac d’haricot.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  épargner. Mme ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et  mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zarata is the Wend Goudoum group representative. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 5 children. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest, 5 months. Four of her children attend school. She takes care of 7 people.

Zarata has been running a restaurant (and selling beans) for 10 years. She gets her supplies at her local market. Her customers are women and men. She would like to buy 5 packets of attiéké (cassava-based couscous), 2 cans of oil and a bag of beans. She wants to save her profits. Her aim is to expand her business and make sure her children get a better education.

loans.use: to buy 5 packets of attiéké (cassava-based couscous), 2 cans of oil and a bag of beans.

loans.name: Varamahalakshmi - Thugunosi Group

texts.en:
The Joint Liability Group “Varamahalakshmi” started with its first loan cycle with Future Greens. Basamma is the leader of this group. The members of this group are engaged in rearing of sheep, goats and rams. They are also daily wage workers in agriculture fields. 

The loan which the group is availing will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Basamma (the lady with her hand raised in the picture), a 22-year-old woman who lives in Thugunosi, Bagalkot, Karnataka. She has studied until tenth grade. She was able to start her own farm with a small amount of capital. 

Basamma works in agriculture fields and is a social worker too. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture fields as a daily wage worker and earns Rs. 150 per day.                       

The loan she is seeking will be used to increase her capital for buying sheep. She will acquire the animals in her community, raise and sell them. This enables her to generate income so that she can support her family in building social and economic security. Basamma hopes to save enough to build her own house in the future.

This group consists of five members.

loans.use: to buy lambs for rearing.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 56 años de edad,, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, y su compañero de vida ya fallecio; tiene cinco hijos de los cuales 2 viven en Estados Unidos y los otros tres, ya tienen su propio hogar y con ella solamente vive un nieto de 7 años de edad, es el quien depende de ella.

Ella se dedica al negocio del ganado de repasto y lo ha hecho por muchos años y lo hacia junto a su compañero de vida. El ganado lo mantienen cerca de su casa y lo hace con el apoyo de un hijo.


El préstamo le servirá para comprar una yunta de terneras, con esto ella se mantendra mucho mas ocupada, ademas mejorara su patrimonio. 

Su sueño son tener buena salud para seguir trabjando y en caunto a su familia, igual que sigan trabajando junto a sus respectivas familias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 56, did not have the opportunity to go to school.  He life partner passed away.  She has five children; two of them live in the United States.  The three others have their own households.  Only a seven year old grandson lives with her, and he is dependent upon her.

She has a business of raising livestock on pastureland.  She has done this for many years, and she did it together with her life partner.  She keeps the livestock close to her house.  She does this with help from a son.

She will use the loan to buy a pair of calves.  With this she will keep herself much busier.  She will also improve her assets.

Her dream is to have good health in order to continue working.  As far as her family goes, she also wishes for them to continue working together with their respective families.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 34-year-old Aminata from Jui, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with four children. She also supports two relatives at home. 

Aminata runs a plastic food container business within her community, where she sells cups, plates, and food containers. She has been in this business for five years. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. 

In the future, Aminata would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 48-year-old Betty from Jui Western rural area in Freetown. She is single with two children. She started this business to be self-independent and take care of her family’s welfare. 

Betty runs a plastic food container business within her community, where she sells cups, plates, and food containers; she has been in this business for 15 years. Betty says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar  né en Décembre 1972 à Farakoba cercle de Sikasso, il est marié, père de 9 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Fasseribougou un village de Loulouni arrondissement de la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur Oumar mène des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales il ya plus de 12 ans, il s’approvisionne à Dollen et les villages environnants de Loulouni.
 Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, 10 sacs de 100 kg de mil et 15 sacs de 100 kg de haricot. Il a un magasin à domicile après l’achat il fait le stockage des marchandises achetées durant un moment. Sa vente se faite dans sa boutique au marché  une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Oumar was born in December of 1972 in Farakoba, Sikasso Circle. He is married and the father of 9 children. He lives at home with his wife in a traditional family environment in Fasseribougou, a village in the area of Loulouni, Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative district of the Republic of Mali.

Oumar has been buying and selling cereals for over 12 years. He gets his supplies in Dollen and the villages in Loulouni. He is on his 9th individual loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso so that he can better satisfy his growing clientèle. The previous loan was correctly repaid. This loan will enable him to buy 10 100-kilo bags of maize, 10 100-kilo bags of millet and 15 100-kilo bags of beans. He has a warehouse on his property where he stores the cereals for a while after he buys them. He makes his sales in his shop located at the market to a clientèle made up of men and women, for cash or credit. He expects to make an average monthly profit of 100 000 francs. This profit will allow him to repay the loan and its interest and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
This is Matilda, a hard worker according to the villagers’ comments about her, who wants to buy goats with this loan. So far, she has cows, yet no goats. 

“Goat milk and cheese are very healthy and are sold at a better price than other dairy products, and I wanted to try this activity as well. The geographical terrain of our village is very supportive of flocks, particularly goats,” said Matilda. 

Matilda is 39 years old and has two children, 15 and 13. Matilda’s focus has been on activities such as agriculture (dried beans, wheat and corn), livestock (dairy cows), raw honey (ten bee hives), and arboriculture (plums and cherry trees) activity also. 

She sells the products to dairy farms, at the local farmers’ market and to the wholesale buyers/sellers.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Marino De Jesus

texts.es:
Marino, es casado, junto a su esposa han procreado dos hijos, de los cuales uno trabaja, todos viven juntos, el se dedica a la agricultura y venta de lácteos, además recibe una pequeña pensión. Su horario es de 1:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., por el momento  el negocio no representa problemas.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de quesos, cremas, cuajada y requesón, para que sus clientes encuentren lo necesario en su negocio y mantenerlos satisfechos, espera que sus ventas aumenten y así mejorar las ganancias.
Marino sueña con tener un chalet en el que podrá ofrecer lácteos y otro tipo de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en: Marino is married and together with his wife have two children, one of them works. They all live together. Marino is a farmer, sells dairy products and also receives a small pension. His hours are from 1 am until 5 pm and at this time running the business is no problems. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of  cheese, cream, curds and cottage cheese so that his customers find what they need in his store and leave satisfied. He hopes to improve his sales and increase his revenues. Marino dreams of having a chalet where he can offer dairy products and other merchandise to his clients.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curds and cottage cheese.

loans.name: Sevila

texts.en:
Sevila lives with her father, son and daughter in Mrgashat village of Armavir region. Sevila and her son are agronomists. They run a farm that includes cultivation of tomatoes, onions and greens. Sevila's son sells the gathered harvest in local open markets and gathers income, which is vital for the family's living. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Sevila asks for USD 750 to be able to pay for a labor force for cultivation of the land, and onion seeds and fertilizer to fight against diseases of the land. Implementation of these goals is important for Sevila to have sufficient income from the sales of the harvest to sustain her family during the year. 

She waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a labor force for cultivation of the land, and to buy onion seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Sarah from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. In 2012, Sarah established her wax cotton business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m., seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to purchase more wax cotton clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Sarah plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gnogondeme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Gnogondeme  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Aminata fait la vente de pagne wax réal dans ce groupe de femmes Gnogondeme. Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  15 pièces de pagne wax réal à Sikasso pour la revente en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Gnogondeme group are married women who average 35 years of age and five children each. Most of them live in traditional families in HAMDALLAYE, a working-class district of the city of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They are partnering with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the 7th time to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Aminata sells Real Wax pagnes. She is the group member standing second from the right in the photo. 

She plans to use her loan to buy 15 Real Wax pagnes in Sikasso. She will retail her merchandise from her home and at the market to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 38,000 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay this loan and interest, and the remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy Real Wax pagnes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 56 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей.  Зарифахан в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву приданья для невест с 1995 года, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Майрам с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрам обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку материалов и тканей для пошива еще большего приданного на продажу. На доходы от кредита Майрам хочет увеличить товарооборот и женить сына.
texts.en:
Mairam is 56 years old and married. She has three children. In the search of a source of income for her family, [Mairam] has launched a small business sewing bridal clothes and linens. She started in 1995 with a capital of 10,000 KGS. This is a very good business and, what matters most, Mairiam enjoys her sewing work, which brings her a monthly income of 17,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Mairam has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to buy supplies and fabric to sew even more bridal clothes and linens.
Mairam plans to use the revenue from this loan to increase her sales volume and pay for her son’s wedding.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr:
Tchotcho est âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et a 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2009. Elle a en 2010 diversifié son activité avec la vente des bijoux et des produits de beauté.
Actuellement elle aimerait se lancer dans la vente des chaussures hommes et dames compte tenu de l'inexistence de la concurrence de vente des chaussures dans son quartier.
A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 8 unités de chaque types de chaussure mais aussi renforcer son stock de bijoux.
texts.en:
Tchotcho is 28 years old, she is married and has 2 children. She has been reselling charcoal since 2009. In 2010 she diversified her business with the sale of jewelry and beauty products.

Currently she would like to go into the sale of men's and women's shoes taking into account the competition in shoe sales in her neighborhood.

To this end, she is requesting this loan to buy 8 pairs of each type of shoe but also to strengthen her stock of jewelry.

loans.use: to buy 6 earrings, 5 bracelets, and 8 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Sabali sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, et ont en moyenne 8 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  Niena un des villages dans le cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Kadiatou assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  Sabali, fait la vente des riz. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt un sac de 50 kg de riz. Sa revente se faite sur place et à Niéna  à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 8 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Sabali group are married women with an average age of 52 and, on average, 8 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Niéna, one of the villages in Sikasso Circle, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 4th group loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs.

Kadiatou, sitting on the far right in the picture, is the group member who sells rice. She plans to use her loan to buy a 50-kilo bag of rice. She makes her sales locally and in Niéna to a clientèle made up of men and women, for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 8 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Kotognogontala. Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe  Kotognogontala sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Assetou fait la restauration  dans ce groupe des femmes  Kotognogontala. Elle est débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 sacs de 50 kg de pomme de terre et 1 bidon de 20 litre d’huile plus divers condiments pour la restauration. Sa restauration est faite au marché   à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The 8 members of the Kotognogontala group are married women with an average age of 40 and, on average, 4 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 16th group loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs.

Assetou is the group member who runs a restaurant. She is standing on the far right in the picture. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 50-kilo bags of potatoes, a 20-litre can of oil and various condiments for her restaurant. Her restaurant is located at the market, where she sells her meals to a clientèle made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jiguiseme sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  Niéna un des villages dans le cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Yamou assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Jiguiseme, fait la vente des condiments. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt une quantité importante de condiment. Sa revente se faite sur place et à Niéna  à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguiseme group are married women who average 47 years of age and five children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Niéna, a village in the SIKASSO circle (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They are partnering with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the 4th time to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Yamou sells condiments. She is the group member sitting first from the left in the photo. 

She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments. She sells her stock on site and in Niéna to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 5,000 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay this loan and interest, while the remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to stock up on condiments for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Con 44 años de edad María lucha día con día para sacar adelante a su hija de 12 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. María posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar de habitación en la cual comercializa variedad de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, sal, azúcar, golosinas, pan dulce y de más artículos demandados por sus clientes. María y su compañero de vida son personas trabajadoras y visionarias quienes desean dar a su hija mejores condiciones de vida a las que ellos han tenido acceso. FUSAI ha llevado la oportunidad a personas como María que desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida pero que sus ingresos no les permiten hacer mayores cosas. FUSAI con el fin de apoyar a personas con visión emprendedora y de crecimiento brinda créditos que les permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida. María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora de su vivienda dado que las paredes se encuentra deterioradas y es necesario que se repellen lo antes posible. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento y arena y Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica y así poder dejar las puertas abiertas para futuros créditos.
texts.en:
At the age of 44 María fights daily to provide for her twelve-year-old daughter, who goes to the local public school. María has a small store set up in her home, where she sells a variety of basic products like rice, salt, sugar, sweets, pastries, and other items that her customers need. 

María and her life partner are hardworking and visionary people who want to give their daughter better living standards than were available to them. 

FUSAI brings opportunity to people like María who want to improve their living conditions but whose income doesn't allow them to do bigger things. In order to support enterprising people with a vision to grow, FUSAI offers loans that allow them to improve their living conditions. 

María has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in improving her housing because the walls are in disrepair and need to be plastered as soon as possible. She will use the amount she is requesting to buy cement and sand. She says she has the ability to pay off the loan so that she can open herself to the option of future loans.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of her house.

loans.name: Indiana Del Carmen

texts.es: Indiana del Carmen mayor de edad con tres hijos menores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega, Indiana se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superacion personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, Indiana es una microempresaria propietaria de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo comestibles como: arroz, azucar, frijoles, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jabon, productos congelados, golosinas,al igual que ofrece productos de mercaderia en general como: ropa, cosmeticos, perfumenes calzados entr otros, negocios el cual los tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion de la mercaderia de forma ambulante por pedidos que les piden, negocio el cual tiene ya varios años, Idiana abre sus puertas desde muy temprano para ofreceles una buena atencion a sus clientes, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distrubuidoras en esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al credito recuperando semanal y quincenal lo invertido, el objetivo de este credito es para reforzar su capital de trabajo y cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de sus clientes al igual que comprar productos de consumo del hogar como: golosinas, arroz, azucar, aceite, detergentes entre otros, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Indiana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Indiana del Carmen has three minor children.  She is from one of the Chinandega municipalities.  Indiana is known for being a hard-working, responsible woman with a great desire for personal improvement.  She enjoys spending her free time with her children.

Indiana is a small businesswoman with a grocery store.  She sells consumable food products like rice, sugar, beans, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, frozen products, and candy.  She also sells general merchandise products like clothes, cosmetics, perfume, and shoes, among others.

The businesses are located at her house.  She sells the merchandise in an itinerant manner by order.  She has had the business for several years.  Indiana opens the doors very early in order to provide her customers with good service.  She makes her purchases for cash at markets and from distributors in this area.  Her sales are for cash and credit.  She collects weekly and bi-weekly.

The objective of this loan is to reinforce her working capital and to cover various customer orders that she has.  She will also buy consumable household items like candy, rice, sugar, cooking oil, and detergent, among other.  She will do this in order to have better earnings in the not so distant future.

Indiana is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce financial resources.

loans.use: to buy consumable products like rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, candy, detergent, and others.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Badegna sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Médine un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Aminata débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Badegna, fait la vente des oranges. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son pret de 2 paniers d’orange au grand marché pour la revendre en détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Badegna group are married women who average 37 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Médine, a working-class district  of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are partnering with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the 15th time to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. Aminata sells oranges. She is the group member standing second from the left in the photo. 

She plans to use her loan to buy two baskets of oranges at the main market. She will retail her stock on site and at the market to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay this loan and interest while the remainder will be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy oranges for resale.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Carlota se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.


"Este préstamo es parte de la "Credi Yapa" de la Asociación Arariwa, que permite a los prestatarios con un buen historial crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo: un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de seis meses."

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlota works in agriculture. She owns a plot where she grows coffee, cocoa and plantains. She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. She has been doing this for many years now and does very well. Her dream is to have an establishment where she can sell coffee.

Carlota is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. This loan is part of “Credi Yapa”, from Asociación Arariwa. This program allows borrowers with a good credit record to receive a special kind of loan: a small amount complementing their main loan, with flexible repayment conditions during six months.

Carlota feels happy with this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama est né vers1976 à N’golona c/kadiolo, père de 5 enfants, marié et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à N’golokodougou un village de cercle de Kadiolo région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur Adama mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréale  il ya plus de 6 ans, il s’approvisionne à N’golokodougou  et dans les villages environnants de N’golokodougou.
 Il est à son cinquième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissant. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 40 sacs de 100 kg de maïs, Après l’achat il les stocke durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue à N’golokodougou à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme 
au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Adama was born around 1976 in N’golona, Kadiolo Circle. He is the father of 5 children and married. He lives at home with his wife and children in a traditional family environment in N’golokodougou, one of the villages in Kadiolo Circle in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Adama has been buying and selling cereals for over 6 years. He gets his supplies in N’golokodougou and the surrounding villages. He is on his 5th individual loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better satisfy his ever growing clientèle. His previous loan was correctly repaid.

This loan will enable him to buy 40 100-kilo bags of maize which he will then store for a while in his warehouse on his property before reselling. He makes his sales in N’golokodougou to a clientèle made up of men and women for cash or credit. He expects to make an average monthly profit of 100 000 francs. This profit will allow him to repay the loan and its interest and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas,la socia vende galletas,chupetes y dulces por medio de este engocio la socia quiere salir aelante y sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar dulces,galletas y gaseosas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member's business is selling sweets. She sells cookies, lollipops, and candy. She wants to be able to get ahead with her business. Her dream is to have a grocery store. She is requesting the loan in order to buy sweets, cookies, and sodas.

This member is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy sweets, cookies, and sodas.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mariela en su miscelanea pues con su credikiva compró ropa, accesorios utiles escolares que incrmentaron sus inventarios y sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para comprar ropa accesorios femeninos juguetes con los cuales estaría una vez mas aumentando sus utilidades y manteniendo una imagen efectiva en su entorno. Ella dice a sus financiadores : " Gracias por el apoyo prestado espero continúen apoyándome"
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Mariela with her variety store as she bought clothing, accessories and school supplies that increased her inventory and her sales. Now she is requesting a new loan from Kiva to buy clothing, woman's accessories and toys which once again will increase her profits and maintain a good environment in her store. Her message to her lenders: "Thank you for the support you have given and I hope you continue to help me".

loans.use: to buy clothing, woman's accessories and toys.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi vit à Bè, un quartier de Lomé. Elle est en location avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Au cours de l'année 2000, elle a débuté son petit commerce de vente de boule d’akassa( Aliment préparé à base du maïs). Cette activité de préparation de boule d'akassa lui prend 4 heures de temps par jour.
Grâce à cette activité, elle a pu financer en 2013 son commerce d’achat et vente des poules et des produits céréaliers. 
Actuellement, pour renforcer cette activité elle sollicite ce crédit,pour acheter 34 poules et un sac de  maïs. 
Les revenus de son activité lui permettront non seulement d'aider son mari dans les charges du ménage mais aussi d'augmenter le montant hebdomadaire de son épargne.
texts.en:
Afi lives in Bè, a neighborhood in Lomé. She rents a flat with her husband and her four children. In 2000, she started her small business. She makes and sells "akassa balls" (a dish made from corn). It takes her four hours everyday to prepare them.

In 2013, thanks to this business, she was able to finance her other business, which consists in buying and selling chicken and cereal products.

At this time and to strengthen this business, she's seeking a loan to buy 34 chicken and one sack of corn.

The income generated by her business will enable her not only to help her husband cover the household's expenses, but also to increase her weekly savings amount.

loans.use: to buy 34 chicken and one sack of corn

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Jiguiseme sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Médine un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Biba débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Jiguiseme, fait la vente des oranges. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt de 4 paniers d’orange à de sikasso pour la revendre en détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The six members of Jiguiseme Group are women who average 44 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Médine, a working class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They are seeking their thirteenth solidarity loan (group loan) from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to meet customer demand.

Mrs. Biba is the second woman from the left in the photograph. She sells oranges. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy four baskets of oranges in Sikasso. She will retail them, for cash and on credit, at her home and at the market, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 31), to be used in part to repay the loan and interest. The other part will be put away.

loans.use: to buy 4 baskets of oranges

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: Elia es originaria de la comarca Las Trineneras en la ciudad de Boaco, casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con poca mercadería, pero con las ganancias obtenidas logro incrementar su inventario.  Su meta próxima es incrementar el tamaño de su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Azúcar, Arroz, Jabón, Aceite, entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar más mercadería e incrementar sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Elia is from Las Trineneras, in the town of Boaco. She is married and has one child. She works as a merchant and her business is a grocery store. She started her business with little merchandise, but was able to increase inventory with the profit she made. Her next goal is to increase the size of her business. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy sugar, rice, soap, oil, and other items. She estimates the loan will be of great help to her because it will allow her to purchase more merchandise and increase her profit. Her plan for the future is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, wood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is from Qarakert, where she lives with her husband. The couple runs a farm. They keep livestock and cultivate some greens. Now Anahit needs some financial means to improve her farming activities. She wants to purchase three oxen, a cow, and forage for the livestock. The cow will allow her to gather more milk. Anahit dreams of developing her farm so that her family will be able to get more involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain its living in the future. This loan is important for her to develop the farm and reach this goal. So Anahit and her husband hope for a loan. As this is Anahit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, a cow, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Pedro Manrique

texts.es: Pedro tiene 39 años de edad, su oficio a diario es la panadería en donde realiza empanadas, tortas de leche, pan, rosquillas entre otros, labor a la que le dedica todo su tiempo siendo un hombre soltero y sin hijos, el crédito que solicita lo destinara para realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de la panadería el cual tiene el techo deteriorado y desea cambiarlo para trabajar en mejores condiciones, ahora que se aproxima el invierno desea estar preparado.
texts.en: Pedro is 39 years old. His daily work is in a bakery, where he makes empanadas, milk cakes, bread, and doughnuts, among other items. He dedicates all his time to this work, since he is a single man without children. The loan that he is applying for will be used to make improvements in the infrastructure of the bakery, which has a deteriorated roof. He wants to change it in order to work in better conditions. Now that winter is approaching, he wants to be prepared.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc and purlins to repair the bakery roof

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 6 meses de edad. María trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace dos años. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen a su familia. María desea construir el corredor de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two kids who are 5 years old and 6 months old.  María has worked as a housekeeper for the past two years.  This allows her to provide for her household, and with her husband they support their family.

María wishes to build a corridor in her home, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials such as: galvanized metal sheets and wood.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to build a roof over her home.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA VISTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Felicitas se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, cacao  y platanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender el cafe.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Buena Vista" community bank. The bank is located in the Huayopata district, which belongs to the La Convención district in the Cusco department. 

Felicitas has an agricultural business. She has land where she grows coffee, cacao, and bananas. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has been working in this business for many years and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to have a store where she can sell coffee. She requests this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She is happy to receive the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana tiene 38 años de edad y gracias a su gran esfuerzo por mantener a su familia unida junto a su esposo han logrado hacerse de una casa la cual es muy humilde pero propia. Ana habita junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 18 años, 15 años, 7 años y 4 años de edad quienes son su principal fuente de inspiración para seguir luchando y llevando el sustento a su hogar. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace más de 5 años y desea mejorar  las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para construir el corredor de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and, thanks to all their efforts to keep their family together, she and her husband have been able to get a house, which is very humble, but their own. Ana lives with her husband and their four children, who are ages eighteen, fifteen, seven, and four. They are her main source of inspiration in order to keep fighting and providing for her family. 

She has been working as a domestic for over five years and wants to improve her housing conditions. That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI, so that she can build a roof over the corridor in her home. In order to do this, she needs materials like sheet metal and wood.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to build part of the roof on her house.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, requiere de más capital para invertirlo en la compra de 2 vacas horras y pagar mano de obra para procesar una manzana de caña de azúcar, incrementara su ganado y podrá tener mejores ganancias con la venta de dulce de atado proveniente de la caña.
Con el préstamo anterior don José fortaleció su negocio teniendo efectos positivos como incremento de ingresos, mejore estilo de vida para su familia, sus clientes han aumentado y cancelado sus deudas.
texts.en:
José is in need of more capital to invest in the purchase of two cows and pay for labor to process 7,000 square feet of sugar cane.  This will increase the amount of cattle he has and will allow him to increase his earnings with the sale of the sugar from the sugar cane.

With the previous loan, José strengthened his business which had positive effects such as increased earnings, improved lifestyle for his family, an increase in customers and the ability to pay off his debts.

loans.use: purchase two cows and pay for labor to process 7,000 square feet of sugar cane.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from frozen food vending. Norma is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wood planing machine for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Señor De La Misericordia De Surco Group

texts.es: El grupo “Señor de la  misericordia de Surco” está conformado por 09 socios quienes muestran alegría y compromiso por iniciar su primer ciclo en la Alcancía Comunal. Clarisa tiene 45 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos educando. Ella empezó en el negocio de lavado de autos hace 06 años  y con las ganancias que obtenía ha ido mejorando su lavadero. Su anhelo es incursionar en un negocio de diferente rubro que le genere más ingresos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una bomba de agua para su lavadero de autos. El grupo agradece el préstamo brindado por los inversionistas de KIVA. Clarisa es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo viste casaca azul metálico.
texts.en:
The group “Señor de la misericordia de Surco” comprises nine members who are joyful and committed about starting their first cycle with their communal bank.

Clarisa is 45 years old and is raising two children as a single mother. She started her car-washing business six years ago and has gradually improved her carwash with the profit she has made. Her desire is to venture into a different line of business that may generate more income for her. She will invest the loan in purchasing a water pump for her carwash. 

The group is grateful for the loan made available by Kiva lenders. 

Clarisa is the first seated person from the left, wearing a metallic blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Flor Chicualense Group

texts.es:
La señora Francisca es de estado civil casada. Cuenta con 23 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 1 hijo que aún no estudia. Se dedica a la elaboracion de Guipiles tipicos. Inició este negocio con la ayuda de su esposo y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de guipiles. Desea en el futuro que su negocio prospere y poder tener un almacen de guipiles de diferentes diseños.

Las demás integantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Señora Francisca is married and is 23 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has one son who is not yet in school. She makes huipils, traditional embroidered blouses. She began this business with the help of her husband, and up to now, she has four years of experience.

She has organized a group and is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase materials to make huipils. She hopes that her business will prosper in the future and that she will be able to have a shop with huipils of different designs.

The other members of the group work in handicrafts and commerce.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies to make traditional embroidered blouses.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Benkan sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Afou débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Benkan, fait la vente des pièces de pagne wax. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son pret de 20 pièces de pagne wax au grand marché pour la revendre en détail sur place et au à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Benkan group are married women with an average age of 35 and, on average, 4 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 7th group loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs.

Afou, standing on second on the left in the picture, is the group member who sells wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African fabric). She plans to use her loan to buy 20 pieces of wax pagne fabric at the Grand Market so that she can resell it locally to a retail clientèle made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Issouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issouf  né vers1969 à Gningoni cercle de Sikasso, père de 5 enfants, marié et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Kadiolo un cercle de la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur Issouf mène des activités d’achat et de vente des céréales  il ya plus de 6 ans, il s’approvisionne à Kadiolo et les villages environnants de Kadiolo.
 Il est à son neuvième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 40 sacs de 100 kg de céréale, Après l’achat il les stockes durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue à Kadiolo à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Issouf was born in the late 60s in Gningoni, a Sikasso circle. Married with five children, he lives in a traditional family with his wife, in his own home. They reside in Kadiolo, another circle of SIKASSO, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of MALI.

Mr. Issouf has been buying and selling cereals for over six years. He buys his stock in Kadiolo and surrounding villages. 

He is partnering with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for the 9th time to better meet the needs of a growing customer base. Past loans were correctly repaid. 

This loan will allow him to buy 40 sacks of cereals at 100 kg each. He will store his stock for a while in his home facility prior to resale in Kadiolo to a clientele consisting of both men and women, for cash and on credit.

He expects to earn an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA. This will allow him to repay the loan and interest, and the remainder will be invested in his activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Ramona Haydee

texts.es: Ramona Haydee, mayor de edad acompañada con una hija menor de edad, auun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, Ramona se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion personal, Ramona es un microempresaria que se dedca a la comercializacion de frijoles cosidos, los que prepara en su casa de habitacion y que vende en su casa al igual que tambien entrega a comerciantes de comiderias y fritanga, tambien vende refrescos naturales, popsicles, chocobananos, paletas, gaseositas entre otros, sus compras las realiza en mercados de esta localidad y son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su neogcio con fondos propios como una forma de poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa para poder brindarle un techo digno a su hija y el de crecer en su negocio, negocio que tiene ya varios años. el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en materia prima de consumo como: frijoles,leña, ajos, leche, galletas, bananos, chocolate, azucar, entre otros y de esa forma tener un poco mas de ingresos y suplir con varios pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Ramona Haydee is married and has a young daughter who is still under her care.  She is a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is located in the western region of the country.  Ramona is known for being an enterprising, hardworking and responsible woman with aspirations of personal growth.  

Ramona is a small business owner who is devoted to selling cooked beans that she prepares in her home and also sells in her home.  She also delivers them to various restaurants.  In addition, she sells natural drinks, popsicles, chocolate-covered bananas, ice-pops, and sodas among others.  She makes her purchases in the local market in cash.  She has permanent and casual customers.  She started her business with her own money as a way to help with the household expenses.  

One of her dreams is to be able to finish building her home so that she can provide her daughter with decent shelter.  She also hopes to expand her business, which she has had for many years.  

The goal of this loan is to invest it in the purchase of raw material such as: beans, firewood, garlic, milk, cookies, bananas, chocolate, band sugar among others.  This way, she will have more income and will be able to fill many of the orders that she has.

loans.use: purchase raw material such as beans, sugar, firewood, milk, cinnamon, cookies, bananas and others.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Badeya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouaerma II un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Alima fait la vente de condiment dans ce groupe de femmes Badeya, Elle est assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 paquets de cube maggi,  5 sacs de ail et des oignons  pour la revente au détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of Badeya Group are married women with an average age of 39, and an average of two children. They are living for the most part in traditional families in the popular Ouaerma II district in ​​the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are on their seventeenth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and their goal is to meet the needs of their customers.

Alima is a seller of "condiments" (vegetable-based sauces) among the women of the Badeya Group, She is shown in the photo sitting on the far left. With her loan, she intends to purchase ten packets of Maggi (boullion) cubes, five sacks of garlic, and onions, that she will retail at her home and at the market for cash and on credit to a clientele of women.

Alima hopes to earn an average monthly income of 10,000 Francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and the rest she will put into her savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sauces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada, su esposo tiene 32 años de edad, juntos comparten la responsabilidad de crecer a dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, como una forma de apoyo en los gastos de su familia inicio su propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de tamales de elotes, le colabora su mamá en la elaboración de la venta.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, elotes, bolsas, leña y pollo, de esta manera su inventario estará surtido y podrá trabajar por un tiempo sin limitantes, espera mejorar la producción, tener un aumento en sus ventas lo que le dará mayores ingresos.
Anhela en mantener su negocio activo para tener recursos económicos con los que continuara aportando en los gastos de su hogar y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and married.  Her husband is 32 years old and together, they care for their two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  As a way to help with the family's expenses, she started her own business selling corn tamales.  She works with her mother to make the sales.  

The loan that she is seeking will be used to purchase oil, corn, bags, firewood and chicken.  This way, she will be fully stocked and be able to work for a period of time without limitations.  She hopes to improve her production and increase her sales, which would generate greater earnings.  She hopes to keep her business running so that she will have financial resources with which to continue contributing to the household expenses and pay of her debts.

loans.use: purchase oil, corn, bags, firewood and chicken.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Danaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Oumou débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Danaya, fait la vente des jus oranges. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt de 20 sachets de jus, 1 sac de sucre plus les divers ingrédients à Sikasso pour la préparation des quantités importantes de jus d’orange  pour la revendre en détail sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The 4 members of the Danaya group are married women with an average age of 45 and, on average, 3 children. Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of Sikasso town, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 7th group loan with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso so that they can satisfy their customers' needs.

Oumou, standing on second on the left in the picture, is the group member who sells orange juice. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 packets of juice (powder), one bag of sugar and other ingredients in Sikasso so that she can make large amounts of orange juice and resell it locally and at the market to a retail clientèle made up of men and women for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and its interest and part of which will be saved.

loans.use: to buy ingredients with which to make orange juice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foliar products, fertilizer, and other items for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 57 years old. She lives alone in Khoni district, West Georgia. 

Dali works at a local bakery and gets a small monthly income. She decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 1,500 and purchase a cow. Once the cow is purchased, she will start producing dairy products to sell locally. 

Dali is a very hard-working woman and wishes to have her own stable income. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Essie

texts.fr:
Essie est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, âgée de 52 ans elle habite le quartier Bè Adidomé à Lomé. Elle était revendeuse de boisson locale mais après avoir changé de religion, elle a laissé cette activité qui lui était très lucrative.
En 2013, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de mercerie avec l'économie qu'elle a pu réaliser sur son ancienne activité.

En 2013 après avoir suivi avec ASSILASSIME la formation sur la concurrence, elle sollicite ce crédit pour diversifier ses produits, augmenter la quantité à achat de tissus et de fil à coudre afin d’éviter les ruptures et satisfaire une grande clientèle.
texts.en:
Essie is married and has five children. She is 52 years old and lives in the Bè Adidomé district of Lomé. She was a retailer of local drinks, but after changing her religion, she left this very lucrative business. In 2013, she launched her sewing business with the savings she had earned from her former employment. 

Since completing her training with Assilassimé in 2013, Essie is now requesting this loan to diversify her products, and increase the amount of fabric and thread she can purchase, so that she can prevent stock-outs and satisfy her large customer base.

loans.use: to purchase 260 meters of fabric and 50 dozen spools of thread.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesusa is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Jesusa has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like nail polish, a nail cutter, nipper, etc. for her business.

Jesusa has been in this business for sixteen years. Jesusa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like nail polish, a nail cutter, nipper, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est âgée de 35 ans et exerce son petit commerce d'huile de noix de palme et de maïs grillé dans son quartier. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine en huile de noix de palme dans le marché de son quartier. 
Avant de commencer par collaborer avec Assilassimé, Ayaovi achetait les bidons d'huile de noix de palme à crédit ce qui ne lui permettait pas de dégager assez de bénéfice.
Afin de mettre fin aux dettes fournisseurs et d'accroitre ses revenus, Ayaovi sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner au comptant en huile de noix de palme de 4 bidons.
texts.en: Ayaovi is married and the mother of 3 children. She is 35 years old and sells palm nut oil and grilled maize in her district. She gets her supplies of palm nut oil once a week at the market in her district. Before working with Assilassimé, Ayaovi bought cans of palm nut oil on credit and was not able to make enough profit. She is requesting this loan in order to buy 4 cans of palm nut oil for cash so that she can stop being in debt to the suppliers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 4 cans of palm nut oil.

loans.name: Dankay

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 49-year-old Dankay from Waterloo, in the Western rural area near Freetown. She is married with 4 children. One of her children is currently attending school. 

Dankay runs a retails business: she sells charcoal and wood for resale. She has been running this business for 25 years. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. Dankay says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network within her operation area.
