Dankay has requested a loan in order to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Médine l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, d’habillement, de cosmétiques et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Binta  (2 éme de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de tout genre dans le  quartier de Médine et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Binta espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utiliser pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The 8 women of the Benkadi group all live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 29 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in Médine, one of the district of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbourly, family and local business relationships and marriage. They sell condiments, clothing, beauty products and prepared meals. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their 1st group loan.

Binta (second on the left in the picture) is a large reseller of all sorts of condiments in the district of Médine and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments so that she can satisfy her customer demand. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a mostly female clientèle. Binta hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs thanks to this loan, which will be used to cover her children's education expenses and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 50-year-old lady from Kisumu county. She is married to Fredrick, and they have nine children.

She sells bales of secondhand clothes and has done so for 27 years, earning an average income of KES 40,000 per month. She is taking her 8th loan with VisionFund Kenya, requesting KES 74,000 to use in buying a sewing machine. The profits will be used to repay the loan and make some savings.

Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is 62 years old and widowed with four children. 

Pedrita is in the agricultural business, engaging in pig fattening in the Philippines. Pedrita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Pedrita has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Pedrita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, pesticides, and fungicides.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 27-year-old Marie from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. Her children are currently attending school. 

Marie runs a retail business, she sell wood for resale. She has been running this business for some years. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. Marie says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes sales are slow.

Marie has requested a loan in order to purchase more wood to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and repay her loan. In the future she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est âgée de 43 ans. Elle habite le quartier de Bè à Lomé avec ses 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Couturière depuis 1997, Akou achète des pagnes qu’elle coud pour revendre. Ses clients viennent de différents quartiers de Lomé.
Elle envisage découler ses habits sur le Grand marché de Lomé en plus du marché de Vogan un village à l’intérieur du Togo situé à 35km d Lomé. Ainsi elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes supplémentaires afin d’être à la hauteur du niveau des besoins des deux marchés.
texts.en:
Aku is 43 years old. She lives in the Bè district of Lomé with five dependent children. A seamstress since 1997, Aku purchases "pagnes" (traditionally printed West African cloth) that she sews for resale. His clients come from different districts in Lomé. 

She plans to debut her clothing at the Lomé Grand Market, as well as the Vogan market, a village located in the interior of Togo, 35 km from Lomé. Akou is requesting this loan to purchase ten additional lengths of pagne cloth, in order to supply the demand of both markets.

loans.use: to purchase ten lengths of "pagne" (traditionally printed West African cloth).

loans.name: Sector Vi Saquilla Group

texts.es:
La señora tomasa está casada. Cuenta con 39 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela. Tiene 7 hijos y 4 de ellos van a la escuela. Ella se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente a la elaboracion de guipiles típicos. Inició este negocio con la enseñanza de su madre y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para relizar los bordados. Desea en el futuro tener un taller con empleados para poder ofrecer por mayor y variedad de guipiles.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y artesania.

En la fotografía solo aparecen 5 integrantes ya que la otra socia no pudo asistir a la reunión cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Sra. Tomasa is 39 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has two children (ages 7 and 4) who are currently in school. Tomasa is an artisan who specializes in making traditional dresses. She started this business after learning the trade from her mother. As of now, she has three years of experience.

Tomasa organized a group so that she could request a loan. She will use the money to buy thread for making her embroidered works. In the future, she would like to have a workshop with employees so that she can sell in bulk quantities and offer a variety of traditional dresses.

The other members of the group are merchants and artisans. In the photo, there are only five members who appear. The other member was not able to attend the meeting at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy thread for making traditional embroidered dresses.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Banakourou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment,  de grains et d’ustensile. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nabary (1ére femme assise de la droite  vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre  dans le village de Banakourou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle féminine.
 Madame Nabary espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 8 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The 9 women of the Danaya group all live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 46 and, on average, 6 children. They all live in the village of Banakourou, in the region of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbourly, family and local business relationships and marriage. They sell condiments, grain and utensils. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their working capital and are on their 2nd group loan.

Nabary (sitting on the far right in the picture) is a large reseller of all sorts of condiments in the village of Banakourou and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments so that she can satisfy her customer demand. She makes her sales for cash and often credit to a female clientèle. Nabary hopes to make an average monthly profit of 8 000 francs thanks to this loan, which will be used to cover her children's small needs and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María tiene 24 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su padre quien esta bajo su responsabilidad. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal  desde hace más de 2 años.  María desea construir un cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, arena, ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is 24 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and her father for whom she is responsible. She has been selling fruits and vegetables at the municipal market for more than two years.

María wants to build a room, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, sand, brick, cement, sand, and iron. María hopes to have this loan so that she can proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Etonam

texts.fr:
Etonam est une jeune femme mariée âgée de 27 ans. Elle a 3 enfants à charge et exerce l'activité de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans son quartier. Expérimenté de 6 ans dans cette activité, elle accueille beaucoup de clients par jour.
Elle a une technique de bien accueillir ses clients et de pouvoir les fidéliser.
Elle s'approvisionne en poissons frais 2 fois par semaine au marché d'Atikpodji à Lomé. Au retour du marché, Etonam utilise la technique de fumage pour conserver les poissons achetés.
Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter un demi carton de poissons frais  et des condiments afin d'augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Etonam is a young married woman who is 27 years old. She has 3 dependent children and sells staple commodities in her district. She has 6 years experience in this line of work and welcomes many customers every day. Her warm welcome ensures her customers' loyalty. She gets fresh fish twice a week at the Atikpodji market in Lomé. When she gets back from the market, Etonam smokes the fish to preserve it. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to increase her inventory with half a box of fresh fish and some condiments.

loans.use: to buy half a box of fresh fish and some condiments.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Welcome to Goderich, a charming little fishing village, just outside of Freetown, the capital of Sierra Leone. 

Please meet Dora, a local woman who began her business eight years ago. Dora sells ‘fry-fry’. Fry-fry is a Sierra Leonean traditional fast-food plate; passing customers buy a tasty mix of fried plantain, spiced fish, and rice cakes. 

Dora is married and has three children, with ages from 3 to 12. Her two oldest children are in school. Dora started her business eight years ago to support her children by supplementing her husband’s income. She starts early, at 8am, selling her food at a local market. Dora sometimes faces challenges when her trade slows down or when the prices increase for the ingredients she buys. 

Dora would like to use this loan to buy bags of rice, palm oil, onions, pepper, maggi chili spice, and seasoning in bulk, so that she can continue to make fry-fry profitably for her customers. She dreams of opening a little restaurant someday. She says that the support from this loan will help her family have the means needed to pay for school fees and to provide good clothing and care to her children. She says a big thank you for the support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell her dish ("fry-fry") to her customers.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 39-years-old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines.  Nila is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Nila has been in the pig fattening business for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Akossi Amedo

texts.fr:
Akossi Amedo est une restauratrice de pâte fermenté communément appelé "Kom" et de riz depuis 2008, elle à 4 enfants à sa charge et vit dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé capitale du Togo. 
Elle est dynamique et accueillante ce qui lui permet d’avoir l’estime d’un grand nombre de client. Dans son souci de satisfaire ses clients, elle demande un crédit pour renforcer son stock en riz, huile, pâte alimentaire et en protéines animale. Elle pense augmenter ses nombres d'heures de travail de 8h à 13 heures de temps afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Akossi Amedo has been a restaurateur of rice, and the fermented corn dough commonly called "kom" since 2008. She has four dependent children and lives in the Bè district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is dynamic and welcoming which has earned her the regard of a large clientele.

In her efforts to satisfy her customers, Akossi Amedo is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of rice, oil, pasta and animal proteins. She also plans to increase her working hours from 8 to 13 hours of time so that she can better serve her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, a bottle of oil, and a carton of frozen chickens.

loans.name: Tusaidiane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est trésorière du groupement de credit Tusaidiane. Mère de 7 enfants dont seulement 5 sont scolarisés, elle est mariée à un homme sans emploie et âgée de 40ans. Elle est  vendeuse des produits agricoles (mais, fruits, etc..) et installe ses produits dans différents marché. Elle commença le petit commerce dans une petite minorité puis la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires au travers le soutien financier reçu de son mari. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 20 sacs de mais. La vente à crédit et les pertes de change sont de défis de son activité toute fois elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et aider ses enfants à achever les cycles primaire et secondaire. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour la culture de l’épargne et l’appui aux femmes rurales.
texts.en:
The client Furaha is the treasurer of the loan organization, Tusaidiane Group. The mother of seven children, five of whom attend school, she is 40 years old and married to a man who is unemployed. She sells agricultural products (corn, fruit, etc.) and sells her products at different markets. She started with a small petty trade business with financial support she received from her husband before moving on to selling food products.

With this new loan, Furaha will purchase 20 sacks of maize. Credit sales and exchange losses are challenges in her line of work. However, she wants to prosper in this business and help her children complete their primary and secondary education. She thanks Hekima for their culture of savings and support for rural women.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en la ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde siembra y cosecha café , cacao y té. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas.

Julia agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Julia lives in the city of Huayopata, which is located in the province of La Convencion in the department of Cusco. Her primary economic activity is agriculture as she plants and harvests coffee, cocoa and tea. She is a responsible and friendly person that has belonged to the communal bank “Buena Vista” of the Arariwa Asociation for many years. In this opportunity, she needs the loan to buy seeds.

Julia is thankful to the investors for the loan and she promises to pay the dues with much responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.es:
Jerson vive en el distrito de Santiago, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que para poder tener ingresos y poder solventar sus estudios, ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de Computación e informática; es por ello que labora en un fundo agrícola en el área de procesamiento de espárragos, sobre todo para poder verificar la calidad del producto, el labora con mucho entusiasmo ya que es este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos.

Jerson está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites para poder obtener su título profesional, de manera podrá buscar nuevos empleos de acuerdo a su carrera y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su empresa”.
texts.en:
Jerson lives in the district of Santiago. He is a very driven young man, so in order to be able to earn an income and pay for his education he is working for a large farm processing asparagus, mainly checking the product for quality. He works with lots of enthusiasm because this job is his only source of income while he is earning his degree in Computer Science.

Jerson is grateful to Kiva lenders because the help they offer will allow him to go through the process of obtaining his professional degree. Once he earns it, he will be able to look for other work within his field and improve his income in order to keep working towards making his dream of having his own business a reality.

loans.use: to pay for his professional degree.

loans.name: Maria Rosalia

texts.es:
María, es una madre dedicada al cuido de su hija de un año, ella es acompañada, como un esfuerzo para cubrir parte de los gastos de su hogar se dedica a elaborar hamacas y bolsos, todo lo relacionado con la jarcia lo aprendió en cursos impartidos en la comunidad, actualmente lo realiza de manera independiente. Trabaja todos los días su ventaja es que puede estar al pendiente de su familia y a la vez realizar el trabajo.
El préstamo lo invertirá para comprar hilo de cáñamo y algodón, variado en colores, le permitirá entregar los encargos que ya tiene, mejorar su producción, expandir su negocio ya que por el momento no es muy reconocida.
Su sueño es construir su propia casa y ofrecer a su hija la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
María is in a relationship and is devoted to the care of her one-year-old daughter. In an effort to cover part of the household expenses, María makes hammocks and handbags. She learned how to work with rope fibers after taking courses that were offered in her community. At the moment, she works independently every day. Her advantage is that she can look after her family while working at the same time.

María will invest her loan in the purchase of hemp and cotton thread in various colors. This will enable her to complete her outstanding orders, improve her production, and expand her business. At the moment, she is not well-known.

Her dreams include building a house of her own and providing her daughter the opportunity to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy hemp and cotton thread for making hammocks and handbags.

loans.name: Ceferina De Jesus

texts.es:
Ceferina, se dedica a atender su negocio el cual consiste vender pupusas en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá y es el medio que posee para tener ingresos que necesita para cubrir gastos familiares, no posee ayuda del extranjero.  Es casada y madre de una niña de cuatro años. 
Ceferina invertirá el capital en comprar tomates, repollo, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, bebidas, harina, entre otros materiales necesarios para la elaboración de la venta, así su atención y productos serán de calidad, dando como resultado mejores ventas, nuevas ganancias con las cuales cancelara las cuotas del crédito.
Su sueño es tener un negocio competente con el cual su economía sea mucho más estable y tener la oportunidad de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ceferina takes care of her business, which consists of selling pupusas, a traditional Salvadorian dish, from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm. She learned this business from her mother and it is the means she has to make the income needed to cover family costs as she does not have any outside help. Ceferina is married and has a 4 year old daughter. 

Ceferina will invest the loan in the purchase of tomatoes, cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, oil, drinks, flour and other ingredients needed for making her products. This way her attention and products will be of high quality giving her results of better sales and new earnings, which will help her pay back her loan.

Her dream is to have a competent business with which her economic situation will be much more stable and she will have the opportunity to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, pork rinds, cheese, oil, drinks, flour and other ingredients.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration,  de grains et d’ustensile. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa (3éme femme debout de la droite  vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette  dans le village de N’djebougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de mil pour faire des galettes afin de satisfaire de plus en plus la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utiliser pour des petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Danaya group all live in monogamous families. They are, on average, 34 years old with four children. They all live in the the N’djebougouni village in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other through their neighborhood, their relatives and marriage ties, as well as through their businesses in the village. They have small restaurant businesses, and sell grains and utensils. In order to increase their businesses capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Hawa (the third woman standing from right to left in the photo) is a great saleswoman of galettes in the village of N’djebougouni and the surrounding neighborhoods. She expects to use her loan to buy a large quantity of millet to make these galettes to satisfy growing customer demand. Her sales are for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele.

Hawa hopes to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for her children's needs and to increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy millet.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 27-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Elijah, who is also a businessman in the same town. They have one child, aged five years.

She operates a hotel, a business she has done for the last three years, earning an average income of KES 18,000. She is taking her first loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya to use in buying equipment for the hotel, such as seats and foodstuff. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings. Her dream is to open a five star hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic seats, and also foodstuff like sugar and cooking oil for making food for the customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, staple foods, sweets, pastas, soap, etc.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Warda is in her early 30s, married, and has one child who attends school.  She sells snacks such as mandazi, vitumbua, cakes. and cooking oil called alizet, which she has been doing for two years.  She works from 6 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to earn a very good monthly profit.

Warda requested her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to increase her stock of alizet.  She dreams of selling alizet at the wholesale price.

Warda will share this loan with her loan group Kilombero,  which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of the cooking oil called alizet

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, pollo, carne, embutidos, bebidas, verduras, condimentos, harina, etc., son parte la materia prima que maneja en su comedor para elaborar los diferentes platillos y pupusas que ofrece a sus clientes. 
Con la inversión anterior Ana, conto con los materiales necesarios para continuar trabajando, tiene más clientes satisfechos, su economía ha mejorado, la familia se mantiene unida y saludable.
texts.en:
Ana has opted for a new loan to buy oil, chicken, meat, sausages, drinks, vegetables, spices, flour, and more. They are the ingredients that she needs in her dining room to prepare the different dishes and pupusas that she sells to her customers. 
With this investment, Ana will get the ingredients she needs to continue working. She has more satisfied customers, her economic situation has improved, and the family stays together and are healthy.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, chicken, meat, and more ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es soltero, tiene 32 años, vive con sus padres en LA PAZ en una casa de cemento y ladrillo que tiene servicios de luz, agua y alcantarillado pero no tiene gas en su domicilio. Ramiro es de profesión Cheff y tiene condiciones duras de trabajo cuando tiene que hacer horas extras los fines de semana. Ramiro esta expuesto a sufrir quemaduras en su profesión. Necesita crédito para renovar enseres de cocina (ollas, cuchillos, sartenes) y comprar provisiones (carne, papa, fideo) en gran cantidad para su negocio de atención de banquetes. Ramiro es la única fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Ramiro is single. He is 32 years old and lives with his parents in La Paz, in a cement and brick house that has electricity, water, and sewer, but not gas.

Ramiro is a chef by profession, and has tough working conditions when he has to work overtime on weekends. Ramiro is at risk of burns in his profession.

He needs the loan to update kitchen equipment (pots, knives, pans) and to buy provisions (meat, potatoes, noodles) in large quantities for his banquet business.

Ramiro is the only source of income in his home, which is why he needs help.

loans.use: to update kitchen equipment (pots, knives, pans) and to purchase provisions (meat, potatoes, noodles) for his banquet business.

loans.name: Kokadje Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Kokadje vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’djebougouni dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de pâté et farine sucrée, de condiment et d’ustensile. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3 éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mah (2 éme femme debout de la droite  vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse pâté et de farine sucrée  dans le village de N’djebougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux  sacs de farine pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utiliser pour subvenir aux petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kokadje group all live in monogamous families. On the average, they are 43 years old, with four children. They all live in the N’djebougouni village in Segou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, relatives by blood or marriage as well as through their work. They sell dough, sweetened flour, condiments, and utensils. With the goal of bolstering their work capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Mah (the second one standing from right to left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of dough and sweetened flour in the village of N’djaebougouni and nearby. She plans to use her loan to buy two bags of flour in order to meet the growing customer demand. She sells for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Mah hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover some minor expenses for her children and also increase her work capital.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, vive junto a su esposa, en este momento no tiene hijos, como una forma de tener ingresos para los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos, trabaja todos los días, son actividades que por iniciativa propia ha desempeñado. 
El capital que requiere es para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los cerdos, de esta manera los tendrá bien alimentados y saludables, con lo que será más fácil su venta, espera mejorar sus ingresos y cancelar a tiempo su deuda.
Luis sueña con tener una porquería en instalaciones adecuadas e higiénicas y así mejorar la economía que le permita hacer mejoras en su vivienda para recibir a sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife. At this time, they have no children. They earn their living to pay household expenses by raising pigs and growing basic grains. They work everyday on their own initiative. 
The capital that they require will be used to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for pigs so they will be well-fed and healthy which will facilitate their sale. They hope to improve their income and pay their debts on time.
Luis dreams of having a pig farm with adequate and hygienic facilities which will improve their household economy and make home improvements for their future children.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es: Rosa Esmeralda tiene 40 años de edad y desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la compara y venta de pescado seco en el mercado central de su localidad. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar las condiciones de la cocina y cambiar las puertas y ventanas de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, dos puertas y ventanas. Confía que con los ingresos que percibe de su negocio logrará cancelar la deuda que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Rosa Esmeralda is 40 years old and has earned her living buying and selling dried fish at the central market in her region for a long time. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI because of the condition of her home. She wants to repair the kitchen and change the doors and windows of her house. With the amount she is requesting, she will buy galvanized steel sheeting, wood, two doors, and windows. She is confident that she will be able to pay her debts with the earnings of her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for repairing her kitchen's ceiling.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Socorro

texts.es: Yolanda del Socorro mayor de edad acompañada con dos hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, oroginaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, Yolanda es una una mujer trabajadora, responsable, que ha tenido que luchar desde muy joven para salir obtener su alimento diario, en sus ratos libres le gusta mucho disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos y compañero, gracias a sus esfuerzos y espiritu de emprendedora y sus ganas de salir adelante es propietaria de un negocio que consiste en la compra venta de ropa nueva, cosmeticos entre otros, negocio el cual lo inicia con fondos propios desde hace mas de seis años, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano para asi lograr brindar una mejor atencion a sus clientes, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería en la compra de Variedades estilos de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos, entre otros de esa manera obtener mas ingresos y suplir con los pedidos de los clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Socorro, of legal age, has two minor children who are still under her care. She hails from Chinandega, which is situated in the western part of the country.

Yolanda is a hardworking and responsible woman, who has had to struggle from a young age to get ahead and get her daily bread. In her free time, she enjoys spending time in the company of her children and her partner.

Thanks to her efforts, entrepreneurial spirit and her desire to get ahead, she is the owner of a business that consists of the purchase and sale of new clothes and cosmetics, among other things. She started this business with her own funds more than six years ago. She begins her work day very early in order to provide better service to her customers.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying various styles of clothes, cosmetics, shoes, and other things. In this way, she hopes to increase her earnings and fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise like:  various styles of clothes, shoes, cosmetics and perfumes, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 22 años de edad vive en casa con su familia, ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y loroco, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo y seguir dándole a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 22 years old and lives at home with her family. She makes her living in agriculture, in particular, growing corn, sorghum and loroco [Central American bud].

When her harvest is ready, she stores it in sacks, as the photograph shows, in order to later sell it in the different markets that are near her home.

The client is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc., to be able to continue with her work and to continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Nyagachu Group

texts.en:
Mwangi lives in Murang'a area, which lies in the central region in Kenya. He is a member of Nyagachu dairy goat Self help group. He has 4 children and has been a farmer for 30 years. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea and his crops.
He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is the income that he gets out of it. His biggest challenge is getting laborers. He chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because Juhudi helps small scale farmers. During training, he learnt how to develop a savings culture.
Mwangi said that this loan will help his family save money spent on kerosene by buying a d.light solar lantern.

loans.use: For purchasing d.light solar Lanterns

loans.name: Isamar De Los Angeles

texts.es: Isamar es originaria de Boaco casada y madre de un hijo. Tiene 21 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de cosméticos. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de su papa quien le suministro el dinero para iniciar el negocio, luego con las ganancias obtenidas pudo independizarse y tener su propio negocio. Su meta próxima es construir una casa propia y ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Frijoles, Aceite, Azúcar, Arroz, Gaseosa y Leña. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá incrementar su negocio, obtener mejores ganancias y darle mejor presentación a su negocio. Su plan futuro es comprar un Freezer y una vitrina.
texts.en:
Isamar is originally from Boaco. She is 21 years old, married, and the mother of one child. Isamar is a merchant by trade. She has a grocery business and also sells cosmetics.

Isamar established her business with the help of her father, who provided the startup capital. Later on, the profit she generated allowed her to become independent and gave her the ability to manage the business on her own. Her next goal is to build a house and to help her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy beans, oil, sugar, rice, sodas, and firewood. Isamar expects this loan will be of great help so that she can increase her business, generate more revenue, and create a better image for her business. Her plan for the future is to buy a freezer and a display cabinet.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, sugar, rice, sodas, and firewood.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. She began her business because she wants to create income to take care of her children and parent.  

Kadiatu runs a retails business, she sell palm oil for resale. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is poor road network within her operation area.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and repay her loan. In the future she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is an agronomist. She lives in Pshatavan village with her husband and son. Astghik is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. The land that she owns is used for cultivation of grass and growing some fruit trees (apricot, cherry). 
Astghik's husband was an army officer and now is retired with a pension. The family gets its main income from agricultural business. So, Astghik now asks this loan of USD 1600 to purchase fertilizer, pay for watering the land, and to hire workers. This loan will greatly help Astghik's farm and she hopes for lenders' support. As this is Astghik's loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, watering the land, and to hire workers

loans.name: Edilma

texts.es:
Edilma es una persona comprometida con las responsabilidades que adquiere, siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
Vive solo con los dos hijos, se desempeña como agente educativo del instituto colombiano de bienestar familiar desde hace 5 años, y en busca de mejorar los desempeños encontró el programa de atención integral a la primera infancia en el instituto campo alto, en el que está muy interesada en continuar con la formación para perfeccionar el perfil profesional para servir con calidad a la infancia de la comunidad junto con las familias, ya que esta importante y maravillosa tarea solo será exitosa solo si se puede trabajar en conjunto con las familias de los niños y niñas para poder conciliar el sueño de construir un proyecto de vida armónico y feliz.
Es de aclarar que Edilma pertenece a comunidad de bajos recursos donde trabajar vale la pena y sobre todo porque aquí se necesita hacer transformación de realidades sociales desde la búsqueda de una nueva forma de pensar para reinventar aquello que ha impedido estar y ser mejores seres humanos por una nueva cultura y sociedad  donde vivir sea una fiesta y participar en ella un precioso arte que todos los días se reviste de color y amor por la vida misma.
Edilma desde muy niña siempre le llamo la atención la labor docente, pero por razones económicas no se logró que anteriormente se profesionalizara y pudiera ejercer la labor en más alto nivel.
Por las casualidades de la vida en un momento determinado estudio logística, pero como dicen "a veces uno no hace lo que quiere sino que son los oficios escogen las personas" pero finalmente lo importante es la actitud con que la que se asumen el reto que traen consigo las oportunidades. 
Los recursos económicos de edilma son un poco limitados ya que tiene varios gastos y le queda muy poco dinero para poder cumplir con el pago en la totalidad de las cuotas, se entero del convenio  kiva que ofrece la institución y el pareció una buena manera para ella de poder realizar el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Edilma is a person committed to her responsibilities. She has always concerned herself about improving her family's quality of life. She lives alone with her two children. She has been an educational agent of the Colombian Institute of Family Welfare for 5 years and is looking to improve how she carries out her work. She found the comprehensive care program for early childhood a the CampoAlto school. She is very interested in continuing her training to improve her professional resume and serve the children of the community together with their families. This is an important and wonderful task. She will be successful if she can work with families with the dream of building harmonious and happy lives.

It is clear that Edilma belongs to a low-income community where handwork is worthwhile especially because work needs to be done in order to transform social realities. She is in search of a new way of thinking to reinvent what has prevented her community from improving. She seeks a new culture and society where living is a party and participating in life is a beautiful art where everyday is full of color and love for life itself.
Edilma, from a very young age, felt that teaching was her calling. For economic reasons, she was not able to become a professional previously and do a higher level of work.

The coincidences of life at this particulate time presented the ability to study. As they say, "sometimes you do not choose your career, it chooses you." Ultimately, what matters is the attitude with which you assume to challenges that bring opportunities.
Edilma's economic resources are somewhat limited. She has several bills and has very little money to meet the payment of her tuition. Her loan with Kiva will be a good way for her to be able to make the tuition payments.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment such as beds, mattresses, and televisions, and make improvements to the house.

loans.name: Irma Simona

texts.es: irma es una señora de 41 año de edad,  dedicada a la enseñanza de los niños, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 7 años de impartir tan noble labor, soltera con 2 hijos a los que apoya en su desarrollo, esta señora se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y de construir un cuarto, ya que dicho financiamiento lo utilizara en la compra de materiales de construcción  como: cemento, hierro corrugado, hierro liso, piedrín, arena, zinc, perlin  y mano de obra, lo que le vendría ha mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is a 41-year-old woman who is devoted to her job of teaching children. She is an elementary school teacher and has been in this noble profession for seven years. Irma is single and has two children who she supports in their development.

Irma came to CEPRODEL to request loan for building a room. She says the funds will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, corrugated iron, flat iron, gravel, sand, zinc, and crossbeams, as well as to pay for labor. This will help to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ceramic tile, cement, and sand to improve her home.

loans.name: Daniel Isaac

texts.es:
Daniel, se dedica a reparar calzado, tiene su propio local, su horario es de 7:00 am a 4:00 p.m., en sus inicios desempeñaba el trabaja como ayudante, en la actualidad lo realiza de manera independiente. Daniel es casado y por el momento no poseen hijos.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar hilo, agujas, pega, pastas de lustre, cepillos, tapas para tacón, etc., todo los implementos básicos para hacer un buen trabajo y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, espera atraer a nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
Su objetivo es crecer en su negocio continuar dando un buen servicio y tener diversidad de calzado a la venta.
texts.en:
Daniel works repairing footwear. He has his own premises, and he works from 7 am to 4pm. At the start he learnt the trade as an assistant, and currently he is an independent cobbler. Daniel is married and he and his wife do not yet have any children.

He will use the loan to buy thread, needles, glue, shoe polishes, brushes, heel covers etc., all the basic tools to do his work well and keep his clients satisfied. He hopes to attract new customers, increase his income and have a better family lifestyle.

Daniel's goal is to grow his business, to continue offering a good service and to have a diverse range of footwear on sale.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, glue, shoe polishes, brushes, heel covers etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Juana Norma

texts.es: Norma es una señora que por muchos años a impartido clases de educacion primaria , con 56 de edad,y 36 años de impartir clases,  mostrando buenas relaciones con los niños y compañeros de trabajo, es casada con 3 hijos los cuales ya son independientes, esta señora tiene la necesidad de cancelar una deuda que utilizo en gastos medicos,por tal razon visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y de esa manera cumplir con su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Norma is a lady who taught elementary school for many years.  She is 56 years old, and she taught for 36 years.  She had good relationships with the children and her work colleagues.  She is married and has three independent children.

This lady needs to repay a debt that she used for medical expenses.  It is for that reason that she came to CEPRODEL to request a loan.  This way she will fulfill her responsibility.

loans.use: to pay off a debt for medical expenses.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Kadie. She is married and has three children aged 17, 12, and 9 years. In 1983, Kadie established her local food stuff (palm oil and garri) business. She began her business because she wants to help take care of her family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women, men, and children. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Kadie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires this loan in order to buy more garri and palm oil to re-sell. In the future, Kadie plans to build a house and give quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garri and palm oil to re-sell.

loans.name: Luisa Iveth

texts.es:
Luisa, comenta que con el crédito  anterior se le facilito la compra de los productos que ofrece en su negocio, se mantuvo en el mercado sin problemas, su situación económica por no ha tendido muchos cambiaos pero se esfuerza por salir adelante con su familia.
Está solicitando capital para comprar bolsas plásticas, jabones, detergentes, shampoo y papel higiénico, para surtir el inventario, satisfacer a sus clientes y continuar generando ingresos.
texts.en:
Luisa says that she used the previous loan to buy the products that she sells in her business.  She has maintained herself in the market without problems.  There have not been many changes in her financial situation, but she puts forth great effort to get ahead with her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy plastic bags, soap, detergent, shampoo, and toilet paper in order to stock up on inventory, to satisfy her customers, and to continue generating income.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags, soap, detergent, shampoo, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Don Gregorio es originario de la comarca Llano Grande en la ciudad de Boaco, casado y padre de nueve hijos, tres de ellos ya independientes. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz, Frijol y Trigo. Inicio su negocio hace varios años y poco a poco ha logrado los objetivos que se ha propuesto. Su meta próxima es cancelar el crédito obtenido. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Abono, Semillas de Maíz y Alambre de Púa. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a cubrir los gastos de la siembra que realizara. Su plan futuro es preparar el terreno para la cosecha de Maíz, Frijol y Trigo que realizara.
texts.en:
Don Gregorio is from the Llano Grande region in the city of Boaco. He is married and has 9 children, three of whom are independent. He is a farmer by trade and sows corn, beans and wheat. He started his business several years ago and bit by bit he has achieved the objectives he had set himself.

His next goal is to pay back the loan obtained. Don Gregario is asking for this loan to buy: fertilizer, corn seed, and barbed wire. He calculates that the loan will help him to cover the costs of the sowing he will carry out. His future plan is to prepare the land for the crop of corn, beans and wheat he will plant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed and barbed wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new vehicle to respond to a growing demand for his services.

loans.name: Oscar Jose

texts.es: Oscar de 32 años de edad es un pequeño agricultor, cultiva maíz, frijol y hortalizas. Oscar vive con su compañera de vida y tienen un niño de 5 años de edad. Oscar quiere comprar e instalar los balcones y puertas de la vivienda que hace 4 años adquirió, pero no tiene el total del dinero para este trabajo. Por lo anterior solicitó un crédito a FUSAI para comprar e instalar 4 balcones de hierro cuadrado y 2 puertas de hierro para su vivienda. La fotografía muestra como Oscar se las ha ingeniado hasta la fecha colocando alambre de púas y madera en la ventana, que no es nada seguro para proteger sus pocas pertenencias y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 32 years old and a small farmer who grows corn, beans, and vegetables. He lives with his life companion and their five-year-old son.

Oscar wants to install security bars and doors on his house that he acquired four years ago. However, he does not have enough money to complete this job. The loan he is requesting from FUSAI will be used to buy four sets of iron security bars and two iron doors for his home. The photo shows Oscar standing next to a window that is currently covered with plywood and barbed wire, which is not a safe way of protecting his family and the few belongings they have.

loans.use: to buy four sets of iron security bars and two iron doors for his home.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 34 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Alejandro vive en casa propia con su familia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, y así continuar con sus siembras ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo, y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 34, has been growing corn and sorghum for 15 years.  He sells his products in the areas surrounding the zone.  With what he gets in earnings he manages to cover the household expenses.  Alejandro lives in his own house with his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  He will also improve the land where he plans to plant.  This is shown in the photo.  This way he will continue with his crops.  This is his only source of income and his ability to give his family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Magna Jeaneth

texts.es: Magna de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja de mecánico y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, Magna esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para su siembra como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Magna is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and her two children. She has worked in agriculture for 5 years and her main crops are corn and beans. She sells her produce in the markets found near her home. With the income she gets from her sales and the help of her husband they manage to pay some of the household bills.

Magna is asking for a loan in order to buy the necessary supplies for her crops such as: fertilizers, compost, pest controls, weed-killers, seeds etc. and to improve the land (shown in the photograph) so that she can continue her sowing and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, weed-killers seeds etc.

loans.name: Amora

texts.en:
Amora is 55 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Amora has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, sugar, shampoo, hair conditioner, soft drinks, etc. 

Amora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year old Fatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with seven children. She also supports two relatives at home. One of her children is going to school. 

Fatu runs a plastic food container business within her community where she sells cups, plates, and food containers; she has been in this business for the past 15 years. Fatu says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates, and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es:
Irma, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas  de 10 y 16 años de edad, su lucha diaria es trabajar en su negocio de comida rápida en el que ofrece pupusas, panes con pollo, tacos, entre otros, tiene 10 años realizando este trabajo, en un horario de 4:30 p.m. a 9:30 p.m., todos estos esfuerzos son con el afán de salir adelante con su familia.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en comprar mesas, pan, carnes, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, aceite, etc., lo que le ayudara a mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, y tener mejores ganancias.
Como toda madre responsable sueña dar a sus hijas estudios universitarios que les ayuden tener mejores oportunidades de superación.
texts.en:
Irma is a single mother with two daughters, ages 10 and 16. Her daily routine involves working at her fast food business where she offers “pupusas” (stuffed tortillas), chicken sandwiches, tacos, and other dishes. She has been in this line of work for 10 years. Her schedule is from 4:30 P.M. to 9:30 P.M. All of her efforts are directed toward helping her family get ahead.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of tables, bread, meat, vegetables, condiments, beverages, oil, and other supplies. This will help her to provide better service to her customers, increase her sales, and generate more income.

Like all responsible mothers, Irma dreams of providing her daughters with a university education, which will help them have more opportunities to succeed.

loans.use: to buy tables, bread, meat, vegetables, condiments, beverages, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Angel Isaias

texts.es: Angel tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y sobrina. Angel trabaja como cargador de mercadería en camiones desde hace 6 años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Angel desea mejorar el techo y el piso de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  lámina galvanizada, madera, cemento y arena para reparar el techo de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que es de tierra y desea dar mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: Angle is 22 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and niece.  For the past six years, he has worked as a merchandise truck loader.  This is how he makes his living and supports his household.  Angel wishes to make improvements to the roof and floor of his home for which he is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  He will purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, and sand to repair his home’s roof and concrete the floor because it is a dirt floor and he wishes to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets, wood, cement, and sand to repair his home’s roof and concrete the floor.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: “el grupo “YAHVE YIRE” esta conformada por socios jóvenes ansiosos por mejorar la calidad de sus vidas. Alexis tiene 18 años es soltero. El hace 04 años que implemento sus cabinas de Internet y una pequeña librería. Tiene como principales clientes a sus amigos y conocidos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su librería cuadernos lapiceros lápices colores plumones. Tiene como fin implementar mejor su librería. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Alexis es el segundo del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The “YAHVE YIRE” group is made up of young members who want to improve their quality of life. Alexis is 18 years old and is not married. 4 years ago he started up an internet cafe and a small bookshop. His main customers are his friends and acquaintances.

Alexis will invest his loan by buying products for his bookshop such as notebooks, pens, colored pencils and felt tip pens. His aim is to improve his bookshop. The group is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan offered. Alexis is the second from the right in the picture.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, colored pencils and felt tip pens.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Victor es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente estudia la carrera de administración de empresas, por ello trabaja muy duro, ya que actualmente trabaja en una pequeña empresa como obrero, lo cual le permite poder solventar sus estudios.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una computadora, lo que le permitirá tener una herramienta adecuada para poder elaborar sus informes  y poder mejorar en su trabajo y seguir luchando para poder realizar su gran sueño:” Tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en: Victor is a young man with strong desires to get ahead.  Currently, he is studying for a degree in business administration, and he works very hard at it.  Right now, he is working at a small business as a laborer, which enables him to pay for his studies.  Victor is very grateful for the Kiva loans because thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to purchase a computer.  This will allow him to have the proper tool and enable him to prepare reports, continue to improve in his job, and to keep striving to realize his great dream: “to have his own business”.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, skirts, shirts, underwear for men and women, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make spicy stews for her customers

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo de 47 años  de edad es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable en su trabajo. Desde hace cinco años dio inicio a un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas el cual tiene en su hogar de habitación y gracias al buen trabajo que realiza ya cuenta con muchos clientes que casa día lo prefieren más. Teofilo desea reparar el techo de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: arena, madera y polines.
texts.en:
Teofilo, 47, is an enterprising man who works very responsibly.  Five years ago he opened a small metal shop in his home.  Thanks to his good work, he has a lot of customers who prefer him more all the time.

Teofilo wants to repair his roof, so he's asking FUSAI for a loan to buy the materials he needs, such as sand, wood, and beams.

loans.use: to buy sand, wood, and beams to repair his roof

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a candle vending business in the Philippines.

Annabelle requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more candles to sell to her customers.

Annabelle has been in this business for one year now.

Annabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Santigie. He is married and has four children, aged 5, 7, 14, and 18 years, who all are school-going children. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to assist him in his schooling. In 1997, Santigie established his hardware business selling paint, shovels, hammers, door locks, etc. He began his business because he did not have the opportunity to attend school. He was only introduced to business and Arabic. He used to sell for his elder brother and after some years his brother established the business for him.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, Santigie earns about SLL 4,200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Santigie requires a loan in order to buy rolls of assorted sizes of electrical cables and cartons.

His succeeded in the building project, which is still on. He thanks ARD for access to the loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rolls of assorted size electrical cables and cartons.

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es:
Juan, a sus 66 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre carismático, humilde y trabajador, que se gana la vida como vendedor ambulante, ofreciendo churros azucarados, papas fritas y algodón de azúcar, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y es una actividad con la que genera recursos para solventar los gastos de su familia, desde hace 10 años.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (papas, salsas, desechables, bolsas para empaque, aceite, azúcar), esto le permitirá mantener la producción y poder satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos, esto dará como resultado un incremento en el nivel de ventas e ingresos.
Juan expresa que su edad no le impide soñar y mucho menos luchar para hacer realidad el deseo de tener su propio local comercial, en el que pueda ofrecer mucha más variedad de productos y le permita generar una mayor rentabilidad, para así seguir apoyando a sus dos hijos y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan is 66 years old. He is a charismatic, humble, and hard-working man who earns a living as a street vendor. He sells sugared donuts, french fries, and cotton candy. He learned the business through experience. The business has allowed him to earn money to pay for his family's household expenses for the past 10 years. 

Juan will use this loan to buy goods in bulk (potatoes, sauces, disposables, bags, oil, sugar) which will allow him to keep up production and satisfy current customer demand for his products. This will result in increased sales and income. 

Juan says that his age doesn't stop him from dreaming and striving to set up his own shop where he can offer a greater variety of products and earn more money, which would allow him to continue supporting his two sons and enjoy a better quality of life alongside his wife.

loans.use: to buy goods in bulk (potatoes, sauces, disposables, bags, oil, sugar).

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year old Mariama from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. She began her business to take care of her family's welfare.  

Mariama runs a plastic food container business within her community where she sells cups, plates, and food containers. She has been in this business for 20 years. Mariama says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cups, plates and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family. 

She has a business, selling used shoes and she has been in this business for three years. 

Christine has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more pairs of used shoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and she sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Christine aspires to sell on a wholesale basis and also to own a fully-stocked stall. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of used shoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Elizabeth has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: This is 30 year-old Issa. He is married and has two children who are three years old and three months old. He has one additional dependent who lives with him as an assistant.  In 2009, Issa established his fish business. He began his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Issa requires a loan to buy more cartons of fish for resale. In the future, Issa plans to expand his business for more development and to repay the loan. He is very hard working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Massah.  She is married and has 4 children who are 14, 10, 8 and 5 years old. 

In 2008, Massah established her onion, maggie and palm oil selling business. She began her business because she was not too educated. Working 7 days a week and 8hrs per day, she earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more palm oil and onions to sell. 

In the future, Massah plans to educate her children at the university level. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy  palm oil and onions to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies (ink, caustic soda, brilliant material, dye) to produce various dyed items.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo Western  in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children.  

For the past 18 years, she has operated a retail business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are inflation and a good business location.

Fatmata requests a loan to purchase bread, drinks, pure water and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bread, drinks, pure water and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes  is a single mother of three school-aged children. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a sold shoes for 3 years and requests 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She sells shoes at the market four days every week. She generates additional income from plaiting hair. 

Her major business challenges include changing weather conditions and theft. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to import used shoes. She resides in the family house  which has access to electricity and running water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to  buy bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Loida requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Kadiatu Rackson

texts.en: This is 46 year-old Kadiatu.  She is married, and has three children, aged 30, 25, and 22 years. She has three additional dependents who live with her and are school aged.  In 2011, Kadiatu  established her provision and drinks business. She began her business because she could not further her studies, due to some family problems.  She had gotten married at an early age.  She has been in petty trade for a long time.  Her business grew over the years, and she now owns a provision and drinks store.  Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase crates of soft drinks. In the future, Kadiatu  plans to expand her business. A high rate of taxation is levied on goods bought from a neighboring country.  She is a hardworking business woman.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 43 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangeline has been in this business for eight years. Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yusufu R.

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Yusufu R. He is married and has four children, aged 22, 19, 17, and 13 years.  Three are school aged children. 

In 2005, Yusufu R. established his Palm Oil business. He began his business because he could not further his studies because of lack of finances. His elder sister advised him to join her husband's business instead of sitting at home idling, and he thought it a wise decision. Several years later he decided to be independent and was successful.  

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le2,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Yusufu R. requires a loan in order to purchase rubbers [plastic containers] of palm oil.   The loan has helped him improve his business because he is now able to purchase large amounts of palm oil.  Yusifu faced a lot of difficulties this year; prices of palm oil have decrease in terms of selling cost.  He planned to purchase more bags of rice in order to cover the losses on the palm oil product.  His major challenge is that the sales of palm oil is very slow now.  He hopes to make more sales during the rainy season.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rubbers of palm oil.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen lives in Lukashin village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. Her son is an army officer and her daughter is a student at university. Ashkhen and her husband work hard to sustain their family and provide appropriate living conditions for their children. 

Ashkhen asks for financial support to pay for her daughter's university tuition. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her with the loan. 
The entire family hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Raquel Guadalupe

texts.es:
Raquel, vive en casa de su papá, es casada, no tiene hijos, hace mucho tiempo por iniciativa propia emprendió su negocio el cual consiste en atender una tienda en la que pone a disposición de sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. No representa problemas por el momento.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, huevos, azúcar, etc., le será de mucha ayuda para mantenerse trabajando y evitar que sus clientes prefieran la competencia. 
Raquel sueña con tener un negocio más grande y que le de la rentabilidad necesaria para cubrir sus gastos familiares y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Raquel lives in her father's house. She is married and doesn't have children. For quite some time now, she has run her own business: a shop where she sells basic goods. At this time, the business is going well. 

Raquel will use the loan to buy drinks, basic grains, snacks, detergents, eggs, sugar, etc. The loan will really help her to continue working and prevent her customers from going to her competitors. 

Raquel dreams of having a larger business which will provide her with the income needed to cover her family's expenses and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, snacks, detergents, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with four children. She began her business because she wanted to create income to take care of her children and parent.  

Salamatu runs a retail business. She sells palm oil and coal nuts. She has been running this business for 28 years. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week. Salamatu says that sometimes her purchasing power is very slow.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil and coal nuts to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and to repay her loan. 

In the future, she plans to open a big food store. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil and coal nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie wants to buy a trailer and milling machine for the tractor that her husband operates.
