Marie practices:
a) Livestock; she’s got three milk cows, and sells the raw milk to a dairy farm. And 
b) Agriculture; she plants corn, rye, and fodder for animals. She sells the produce at the farmers’ market of their nearby city, in Korca. She also sells the fodder to other villagers.

Marie and her family live in a little town with approximately 5,500 residents that, under the communist era, became an important industrial town. There was a sugar beets processing plant; the only one in Albania. In the fielded areas around, villagers planted sugar beets that were delivered to the sugar plant for processing. No one plants sugar beets anymore, and no sugar processing plant has been functioning since the collapse, unfortunately.

loans.use: to buy a trailer and milling machine for the tractor her husband operates.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Dalarik village with her husband, son, and daughter. Lusine and her family are occupied in breeding cattle and land cultivation. Lusine is a very enthusiastic woman, willing to improve her family’s living condition. She asks for this loan to be able to buy some forage for the livestock and hire workers for land cultivation.
 
The family gets its main income from selling milk. With the profits, Lusine hopes to be able to repair her house.

loans.use: to hire workers for land cultivation, and purchase forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Rosa es empleada de oficios varios en una empresa de su localidad. Rosa necesita cambiar la cubierta del techo y las láminas de las paredes de su vivienda ya que el tiempo y la corrosión han deteriorado las láminas existentes. Por tal razón Rosa ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para la mano de obra y comprar; lámina galvanizada y clavos de acero necesarios para el techo y las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old and resides in her own home along with her family. She is an employee who is charged with various duties at a company in her town.

Rosa needs to replace the roof and the metal sheets that make up the walls of her house. Over time, corrosion has caused the existing metal sheets to deteriorate. For this reason, Rosa is requesting a loan from FUSAI. The money will be used to pay for labor and to buy galvanized sheets and steel nails, which are needed to repair the roof and the walls of her home.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor in order to repair the roof and walls of her house.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married 45-year-old woman with four children. Two children are currently in school.

Estela is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Estela requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Estela has raised pigs for 10 years and has previously borrowed 9 times from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 38 years old and married with three children who are 5, 7 and 11 years old. In 2007, he established his spare parts business to support his family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 750,000 every month.
 
Michael requests a SLL 5,000,000 loan to buy assorted spare parts for motor bikes. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 250,000. Michael’s plans changed because of his business location, but still plans to open two spare part shops, buy a vehicle and bike for commercial use, and educate his children to the highest level. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted spare parts for motor bikes.

loans.name: Eutropia

texts.en:
Eutropia is a 63-year-old married woman with eleven children. 

She is in the agricultural business to raise pigs in the Philippines. Eutropia requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eutropia has raised pigs for 15 years and has previously borrowed 11 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eutropia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Lamin.  He is married and has two children who are five and two years old.  In 2007, Lamin established his onions, pepper, oil and salt business. He began his business because he wanted to generate more income. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Lamin requires a loan in order to buy more oil, salt, pepper, etc. for resale. In the future, Lamin plans to expand his business for more development and to repay the loan. He is very hard working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more oil, salt and pepper to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is 34 years old and married.  She has five children. With four children currently in school, Julie Ann works very hard to provide for them. Julie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, coffee, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Julie Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of frozen fish and chicken.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Goderich, a charming little fishing village which is just outside of Freetown.

Adama is a 42-year-old local business woman who is married to a local plumber. They have five grown-up children between the ages of 18 and 27. Two of their children go to school. 

Adama began her business four years ago to improve the family's standard of living. Adama sells ‘cookery’ which is the modest term for the wealth of local delicious spiced stews sold to customers. Adama faces the problem faced by many local cooks in the area which is supply prices that rise suddenly.

Adama wants to use this loan to buy rice by the bag, palm oil, pepper, ‘maggi’ spice, onions, fish, ground nuts and spices so that she can continue to sell ‘cookery’ profitably to her customers. 

Adama would like to have a little restaurant in the future. By strengthening her business, Adama will be able to support her school-going children. She thanks you and BRAC Sierra Leone for the support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell spicy stews to her customers.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 49 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Leonida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients, such as fish, spices, rice, vegetables, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonida has been in this business for four years. Leonida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as fish, spices, rice, vegetables, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Vard

texts.en:
Vard lives in Margara village in the Armavir region of Armenia with her two sons. Because of high unemployment in the region, Vard's two sons work abroad. Meanwhile, Vard runs a farm to grow cabbages, tomatoes, peppers, apricots, cherries and grapes.

Vard has applied for this loan to purchase seed and fertilizer and hire workers to harvest her crops. Vard dreams of developing her farm so that her sons will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future. This loan is important for her to develop the farm and reach this goal.

This is Vard's second loan (she applied for loan to local financial institutions but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time), and she has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer and hire workers to harvest her crops.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Kadie.  She is married and has 3 children who are 12, 8, and 6 months old.  Two children attend school. 

In 2005, Kadie established her food market business, selling ketchup, maggie, seasons, rice, and beans. She began her business because she was brought up by an aunt who could not send her to school.  She used to sell goods and do domestic work.  She got married at an early age and later decided to start a business instead of staying at home. Her husband supported her decision to to establish a business.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns 890,000 SLL every month. She would like  3,000,000 SLL to purchase bags of rice & vegetable oil. In the future, Kadie plans  to change her social status by improving her business. She is a committed and hardworking business woman.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice & vegetable oil.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Khanjyan village with her husband and two grown up sons. Her husband works at a local village hall, and her elder son is an army officer. However, it is not possible to survive on their salaries alone. For that reason, Aida is involved in agriculture to make ends meet. She keeps a small livestock and cultivates tomatoes and some grass. Aida also grows peach, apricot, and plum trees.
 
The harvest is sold at a local open markets, and Aida is able to cover family's basic costs. 
She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase two oxen, seeds, fertilizer, and fuel, and hire workers for land cultivation. 

The family will hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase two oxen, seeds, fertilizer, and fuel, and hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Genara requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

She has been in this business for 6 years now.

Genara would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Andrea Paola

texts.es:
Andrea paola es una joven que tiene muchos proyectos y sueños en la vida, uno de ellos es estudiar auxiliar judicial porque siempre le gusta ayudara otras personas en procesos donde no saben nada o quizá se sientan desprotegidos, en la adolescencia siempre fue personera en el colegio donde estudiaba.
Hoy en día tiene 22 años, vive en un barrio estrato medio en el centro de la ciudad por el cual su mente a estado alimentando los sueños, al ver abogados jurídicos, jueces, entre otras personas de la rama judicial. 
Aunque puede tener la oportunidad de ingresar a una universidad en la mente a decidido empezar de cero, cree que empezar un programa técnico es el inicio para sembrar una buena carrera. 
La familia de ella es muy numerosa tiene siete hermanos y tres hermanas los cuales ya cinco son profesionales, los padres están muy orgullosos y ella no quiere verse por fuera, por eso quiere esforzarce arduamente en los estudios técnicos.
Hace poco firmo contrato con una empresa muy buena la cual por suerte le permite superarse en cuanto a los estudios, quiere aprovechar muy bien el tiempo, pues en la situación que se encuentra tiene que aprovecharlo al máximo, como acabo de ingresar a laborar ella sabe que debe colaborar en la casa con alguno  de los gastos y si a eso le suma el pago mensual del semestre el dinero que ella gana no le al cansaría para pagar todos los gastos que tiene, es por eso que  ella estaría interesada para tener el convenio con kiva el cual le da un subsidio en e pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Andrea Paola is a young lady with many goals and dreams, one of which is to study to become a legal assistant since she has always enjoyed helping others in situations where they don't understand what is happening or perhaps feel vulnerable. As a teenager, she was always a student representative in her school. Today she is 22 years old, and lives in a middle-class neighborhood in the city center, where she sees lawyers, judges, and other legal workers, thus sustaining her dreams. Although it is possible for her to study in a university, she has decided to start from scratch, as she believes that a technical program will be a good start for a good career. 

Andrea's family is large: she has seven brothers and three sisters. Of these siblings, five are already working professionals. The parents are very proud of them, and Andrea doesn't want to be different, which is why she is studying hard in her technical program. 

Not long ago, she signed a contract with a very good company, which, luckily, will help her do well in her studies. She wants to manage her time well, as she wants to get the most out of her current situation. Since she just started working, she knows that she will have to help out with some household expenses, and on top of this, she has monthly tuition payments. The money she earns will not cover all her costs, and this is why she is interested in working with Kiva, which will help her with her expenses through a loan.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es:
Fatima es una señora de 44 años de edad, con don de servicio, de profesión auxiliar de enfermería, trabaja en un puesto de salud de la localidad donde habita, con 25 años de laborar, es casada con 1 hijo   a su cargo a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, Una de las necesidades que la señora Fátima atraviesa es de  cancelar una deuda que tiene por gastos médicos, como es el tratamiento médico, El que necesita para mantenerse en forma activa  para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, para ella y su familia, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para lo antes mencionado. 
con este financiamiento es el numero 5 y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, esta señora se encuentra muy agradecida  con ceprodel que pormedio del financiamiento ha resuelto su necesidad.
texts.en:
Fatima, 44, with the gift of service, works as a nursing assistant. She has worked in this health care position in the region where she lives for 25 years. She is married with one dependent son that they have to provide the necessary conditions to develop. One of the necessities that Fatima needs is to pay the debt she has from her medical costs such as medical treatment. What she needs to maintain active form, to improve her medical condition and standard of living for her and her family allowed her to make the decision to visit CEPRODEL to ask for this loan for the aforementioned needs.

This loan is her fifth and she has proven herself to be a responsible person. She is very thankful for CEPRODEL because through this loan her needs have been met.

loans.use: to pay medical costs.

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es: Paula Emilia mayor de edad casada con seis hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria de una de las comarcas de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria propietaria de un negocio venta de refrescos naturales como: calala, ensaladas de frutas, naranja con zanahorias, leche con bananos, pitaya, chilla con tamarindo entre otros al igual que vende hielo, tambien vende enchiladas, tacos, sus compras son al contado en mercados de la localidad, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus ventas son al contado, Paula poco a poco ha ido incrementando su negocio tiene mas clientes gracias a la buena atencion que ella les ofrece, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como: frutas naturales, azucar, bolsas plasticas, pajillas, leche, carne, tortillas, aceite, sal, palillos entre otros mas. Paula Emilia. agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.-
texts.en:
Paula Emilia is married and has six adult children.  She is originally from one of the Chinandega regions located in the western part of the country.  She is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman who has a desire to improve herself.  

She is the owner of a small business that sells natural drinks such as passion fruit, fruit salads, orange with carrots, milk with banana, pitaya (a cactus fruit based drink), and chilla with tamarind (a drink made from chia seeds).  She also sells ice, enchiladas and tacos.  She makes her purchases in cash from markets in her area.  She has loyal and occasional customers who pay in cash.  Paula has slowly expanded her business and has more customers thanks to the good service she offers them.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as natural fruits, sugar, plastic bags, straws, milk, meat, tortillas, oil, salt, and toothpicks.  Paula Emilia is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, including a variety of fruits, sugar, bags, straws, meat, tortillas, and oil.

loans.name: Marcet

texts.en:
Marcet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to resell in her coconut wine vending business.

Marcet has been in this business for two years. Marcet earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marcet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to resell.

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 44 years old and has six children. Melodina is widowed and has two children who are currently in school.

Melodina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melodina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melodina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to resell in her general store.

Meriam has been in this business for four years. Meriam earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 26 years old and has three children. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school.
She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Remedios requested a PHP 6,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Remedios has been farming vegetables for seven years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Rosvita

texts.en:
Rosvita is a married woman with nine children. Rosvita is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosvita has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

Rosvita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, rice, fish, meat, spices, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Rosvita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, rice, fish, meat, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Vanessa Grace

texts.en:
Vanessa Grace is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. All three children are in school. 

Vanessa Grace is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. 

She requested a 9,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

In the future, Vanessa Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Dashmire

texts.en:
Dashmire has prepped the soil for the seasonal planting already, and is waiting to buy potato seeds with the loan that she is requesting from Kiva's lenders. 

These little so called ‘greenhouses’ (shown in the photograph) covered with waterproof, are where villagers throw the seeds of veggies to grow to seedlings. Inside, are covered ‘warm beds’, called differently. Once they become seedlings, they then are taken off the warm beds and planted outside.
  
Dashmire’s focus is on planting potatoes, tomatoes, peppers, and wheat. She’s also got orchards of cherries and apples. Her husband does seasonal work in Greece.
 
Dashmire is a married mother of two who lives with the family in a little town of Korca city. Its where the sugar beets processing plant was built in the communist era; it was the biggest in the Balkans region. It has been out of use since the collapse.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: José tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos. José se dedica a la prestación de servicios de seguridad desde hace más de 4 años y de esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. José solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de tres paredes anexas a su casa para construir un cuarto para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder da a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old and lives in a house he owns with his life partner and their five children.  José has worked providing security services for more than four years and this is how he supports his household and gives his family what they need.  

José is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of three add-on walls to his house to build a room.  He needs to purchase materials, including galvanized metal sheeting, cement, bricks, sand, and iron.  He hopes to count on this loan to be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, cement, bricks, sand, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Жумакан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумакан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумакан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 20 овец, также имеется земельная доля, на которой ежегодно выращивает картофель, огурцы, помидоры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумакан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа высококачественных семян картофеля, огурцов, помидоров для посевных работ. Жумакан намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство незавершенного дома.
texts.en:
Jumakan is 41 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Jumakan has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Jumakan works with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding, after having started 19 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Jumakan's persistent work, she currently has three dairy cows, one calf and 20 sheep. She also has a plot of land on which she grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes each year, for farm consumption and for selling. The aggregate monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Jumakan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan to purchase high quality seeds for potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes for sowing. Jumakan intends to get a good harvest, which certainly will lead to an increase in the family's capital. Jumakan plans to invest the income from the loan in increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for building of her unfinished home.

loans.use: to buy seeds of potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business and farms vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for 12 years and has borrowed one time in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to sustain her business.

She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ayisa

texts.en:
Ayisa is single and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

She requested a 12,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

In the future, Ayisa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Bibizainab

texts.ru: Бибизайнаб жительница района Кубадиён. Ее возраст 43 года. Она занимается торговым бизнесом. Бибизайнаб имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания, а также сладости, сухофрукты, орехи и фисташки. Бибизайнаб в торговле помогает вся ее семья -  муж и дети. Это их семейный бизнес и единственный источник дохода. Они занимаются данным бизнесом более двух лет. Бибизайнаб хочет сейчас увеличить товарооборот. Она запрашивает кредит для купли ассортимента сухофруктов, орехов и фисташек. Приближается праздник "Навруз" и она хочет успеть закупить товар и пополнить полки магазина. Она очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bibizainab is a resident of the Qubadiyon region. She is 43 years of age. She works with sales. Bibizainab has her own grocery store, where she sells food products and also sweets, dried fruits, nuts and pistachios. Bibizainab's family - her husband and children - help her with the business. It is their family business and only source of income. They have had this business for more than two years. 

Bibizainab would like to increase her turnover. She requests a loan to purchase an assortment of dried fruits, nuts and pistachios. The "Navrus" festival is approaching, and she would like to purchase goods and replenish the shelves in time. She very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits, nuts and pistachios for reselling in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university degree.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ida

texts.en:
Ida is a married woman with seven children. She is 45 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Ida has a business buying and selling soft drinks in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell.

In the future, Ida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 32 years old and single. 

Rachel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Rachel has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, milk, toothpaste, noodles, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Rachel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rochan

texts.en:
Rochan is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rochan is 37 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rochan has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Rochan requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods like accessories, blouses, wallets, etc. to sell.

Rochan has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Rochan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, se dispone a surtir el inventario de la tienda por lo que opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que comprara golosinas, pan, bebidas, huevos, granos básicos, entre otros productos que luego ofrecerá a sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le permitió incorporar la venta de mariscos con los cual mejoro sus ingresos, su familia se encuentra saludable y apoyándola para continuar con el negocio.
texts.en: Eva wants to stock-up the store with inventory, reason why she requests a new loan to buy snacks, bread, drinks, eggs, basic grains and other products that she will offer to her customers.  The previous loan allowed her to incorporate seafood sales into her store which increased her income, her family is healthy and supports her to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, drinks, eggs, basic grains and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of cosmetics and cooking pots to add to his current stock

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура активная и энергичная женщина, занимающаяся швейным делом в своем городе Худжанд. Ей 40 лет. У нее муж и двое взрослых сыновей. Старший сын работает, а второй студент. Он учится в Худжандском Государственном Университете по специальности "Финансы и кредит". В этом году семья Манзуры еще не оплатила за учебу сына. Ее муж вынужден был покинуть страну и уехать на заработки в Россию. Сама Манзура зарабатывает за счет шитья, но накопить сбережение для оплаты учебы сына они в этом году не смогли. Единственный выход из трудного положения Манзура видит в получении кредита. Она просит в займы 2000 долларов США, чтобы оплатить учебу сына. Она хочет, чтобы ее сын получил высшее образование и нашел себе достойную работу в своем городе.
texts.en:
Manzura is an active and energetic woman, working with sewing in her city, Khujand. She is 40 years old. She has a husband and two adult children. Her eldest son works, and the other is a student. He studies at the Khujand State University, specializing in "finance and credit". 

This year, Manzura's family has not yet paid for her son's tuition. Her husband was forced to leave the country and go to Russia as a migrant worker. Manzura earns money sewing, but was not able to save money for her son's tuition this year. The only way Manzura could see in order to get out of the difficult situation was to borrow money. 

Manzura requests a loan of 2,000 US dollar in order to pay for her son's tuition. She would like her son to get higher education and find a decent job in his city.

loans.use: to pay for her son's higher education

loans.name: Mp - Ban Bua Group

texts.en:
Ha is  a 23-year-old woman, living in a small Thai traditional house with another five members in her family, including her parent-in-laws, her husband and two children. 

Her family's source of income mainly comes from agricultural activities, thus, they have diversified the forms of growing and rearing. Specifically, they cultivate rice, vegetables, cereal, and raise chickens, pigs, fish, and buffalo. Despite the hardship in life and low income, Ha sends her children to school fully. To cover better living expense and tuition fees for the children, Ha wants to expand her business by taking out a loan from Anh Chi Em Program to buy more piglets. 

Ha hopes that, by constant effort in work, her family life would be improved, her children will be more abundant and successful. 

Ha is elected to be team leader of the group of 11 Thai people. In the picture, Ha is wearing a red coat.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts, coconut, candy, bread, etc. to attract her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase slippers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy radios, cassette recorders, torch-lights, etc. in large quantities to add to his current stock

loans.name: Carmen Pastora

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer que trabaja de sol a sol para que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios superiores y sean profesionales, se dedica al alquiler de cuartos  y tiene un pequeño gimnasio, medio de ingresos con los que se apoya a mantener sus gastos del hogar y colegio. Solicita este crédito para pintar paredes de su casa con el f in de darle mejor apariencia a su casa y negocio.
texts.en: Carmen is a woman who works twenty-four seven so that her children can finish their studies and become professionals. She makes a living by renting out rooms and she has a small gym. This source of income enables her to cover household and schooling expenses. She is requesting this loan so she can paint the walls of her home, with the goal of giving her home and business a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy oil-based paint and paintbrushes

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita works hard to support her family. She is married and she has a tobacco-vending business in the Philippines.

Purita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of tobacco to sell.

Purita has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cabbages, green beans, tomatoes, onions, cucumbers, papayas, apples, bananas, etc

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра приятная отзывчивая женщина. На нее приятно смотреть и за нею приятно наблюдать. На свои хрупкие женские плечи она мужественно несет все хозяйство по дому, воспитывает детей, работает и трудится не жалея сил. У нее трое прекрасных детей. Гулчехра воспитала их достойно, и теперь они  помощники мамы. Муж Гулчехри находиться в трудовой миграции. Раз в году приезжает повидаться с родными. По возможности отправляет  деньги жене, но, увы, их недостаточно, чтобы прокормить семью, одеться, обуться и позволять мелкие женские «капризы». У Гулчехры среднее образование. После окончание школы отец выдал ее замуж, и она не смогла продолжить обучение. 
У Гулчехры двадцатилетний опыт в скотоводстве и разведении скота. Начинали они с мужем с двух барашек, но по необходимости муж уехал в РФ а она продолжила это дело. К ее счастью на сегодня ее дети выросли и стали помощниками маме. Сейчас она имеет более 8 КРС и МРС. Пользуясь моментом, хочет приобрести еще несколько барашек и корм для них. В связи с сезонностью, ей не выгодно продавать своего скота, но и на покупку новых не имеет достаточную сумму в руках. Для приобретение нужной суммы обратилась в «Арванд». Заранее благодарит «Кива»за поддержку женщин и надеется, что сможет получить нужную сумму.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a pleasant and symphatetic woman, and she looks nice. She couragously carries the whole household economy on her fragile female shoulders, raising the children, working and striving sparing no effort. Gulchehra taught her children dignity, and now they are their mother's helpers. Gulchehra's husband is a migrant worker. Once a year he comes home to see his family. He sends money to his wife when he can, however it is not enough in order to feed the family, provide clothing and shoes and small, female "whims". 

Gulchehra has secondary education. After finishing school her father married her away, and she was not able to continue her education. Gulchehra has more than twenty years of experience in livestock breeding. She and her husband started with two lambs, but her husband went to the Russian Federation out of necessity and she continued this business alone. To her joy, her children grew up and became her helpers. 

Currently Gulchehra has more than eight heads of livestock. She would like to take this opportunity to purchase yet some lambs and fodder for them. Due to the season, it is not profitable for her to sell her livestock now, and she does not have enough money on her hands to purchase new livestock. To obtain the required amount she turned to "Arvand". She thanks Kiva in advance and hopes that she will receive the necessary loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients and other items for her food business

loans.name: Hm - Ta Let 2 Group

texts.en:
Thanh is a Thai woman who is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, who are both school age. 

Her family's main earnings come from agricultural production and the core livelihood strategy is diversifying farming activities, such as: planting rice, vegetables and cassava, and keeping 20 chickens, six pigs and a buffalo for plowing. Because of bad weather last year, she had a poor crop. Despite the difficulties in life, she still sends her children regularly to school. 

Thanh wants to take out a loan from Anh Chi Em to cover the expense of leveling the field. She hopes that through this loan and the training sessions of ACE, the yield will increase and accordingly, her income will be improved. Thanh dreams of a better future for her children.

In the picture, Thanh is wearing Thai traditional clothes with a pink shirt and standing at the far right.

loans.use: to level rice field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and new potato seed for her crops

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina vive en la encantadora ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedico a la agricultura y le va muy bien pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde por ejemplo tiene frutales, café, té, cacao y coca, ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Huayopata - Chonta" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes. 

Justina agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Justina lives in the enchanting city of Huayopata, which is located in La Convención Province in the Department of Cusco. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who has been farming since she was a very young girl. Justina is doing very well since she has plots of land on which she grows fruit, coffee, tea, cacao, and coca.

She is a very responsible and outgoing person. Justina is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayopata-Chonta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy fertilizers. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders who participate in this loan and promises to handle her payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jesseca

texts.en:
Jesseca is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesseca is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Jesseca has a candle-making business in the Philippines. Jesseca requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her candle-making business.

Jesseca has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jesseca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her candle-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Karol Viviana

texts.es:
Ella es una niña llamada karol viviana, que vive con la mamá y la hermana siempre ha tenido deseos de salir adelante con el apoyo de la mamá, pero con mucho esfuerzo ella le ha pagado los estudios, ella para poder ayudar en los estudios trabaja los fines de semana con la hermana, ella quiere en un futuro ser una gran profesional para así retribuir al esfuerzo que la mamá le brindo; el gran sueño de ella es en futuro tener el propio spa con la hermana que también estudia cosmetología para poder brindar trabajo a otras personas para que tengan un mejor bienestar, pero para este proyecto  ella necesita de un apoyo económico que le puede ofrecer KIVA, ya que ella misma ayuda para el pago de las cuotas mensuales y con el trabajo que tiene los pagos se le hacen un poco mas complicados. 
Gracias por leer la historia de esta niña con ganas de ser alguien en la vida y solo necesita un gran apoyo, que más adelante les retribuirá en este medio social colaborándole a otras personas que necesiten de la ayuda.
texts.en:
This young lady is named Karol Viviana and lives with her mother.  She has always had a desire to get ahead with her mother’s help, but she has paid for her education with lots of effort.  She works with her sister on the weekends and wants to become a great professional in the future so she can repay the effort that her mother put forth.  Her greatest dream is to have her own spa with her sister, who also studies cosmetology, so she can create jobs for others so they can have better wellbeing.  She needs financial help from Kiva for these plans.  She pays some of the monthly fees and they are difficult to manage with the job she has.

Thanks for reading this young lady’s story.  She wants to be someone in life and only needs some help that she will repay in the future by helping others who also need help.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new sewing tools and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy smart cell phones

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more electronic devices.

loans.name: Arslonbek

texts.ru:
Арслонбек  молодой и активный человек, который с раннего возраста научился самостоятельности и трудолюбию. У него большая счастливая семья. Живет в сельской местности. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. У него среднее образование. Несмотря на то, что не получил высшего образования Арслон очень ответственный и знает свое дело на «отлично». Арслонбек не любит по просту тратить время. Всегда старается чем- то себя занять. Делает все свои дела во время и обязательно уделяет время своему единственному ребенку. 
У Арслона большой земельный участок и много свободного открытого места.  Из-за расположения деревни в зеленой территории вот уже много лет, семья Арслона разводят овец. Его отец был пастухом. Теперь и он сам занимается скотоводством. Преодолев  все трудности в течении десяти лет Арслон накопил себе огромный опыт в этой сфере. У него семь барашек и три КРС. Каждый день выводит овец и коров на пастбище. Также Арслон дополнительно работает на птицефабрике и получает дополнительный доход. 
Так как наступила весна, и все  зимние запасы корма закончились, Арслон решил закупить корм для скота. Но так как овец еще не продал и не имеет нужную сумму на руках, решил воспользоваться кредитом. С этой целью обратился в ООО МДО «Арванд». Очень надеется, на поддержку  и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en:
Arslonbek is a young and active man, who has learnt to work hard and be independent since early age. He has a large and happy family. He lives in a village. He is married and has a child. He has secondary education. Despite the fact that he did not receive higher education, Arslonbek is very responsible and knows his work perfectly well. 

Arslonbek does not like to waste time. He always strives to know things. He does all his work on time and always make time for his only child. Arslonbek has a large plot of land and a lot of free space. Due to the location of the village in a green area, Arslonbek's family has bred sheep for many years. His father was a shepherd. Currently Arslonbek also works with livestock breeding. After having overcome difficulties for a period of ten years, Arslonbek gained large experience in this area. 

Arslonbek has seven lambs and three heads of cattle. Every day he leads the sheep and cows to the pasture. Arslonbek also works at a poultry farm to receive additional income. As spring has come and the whole winter stock is used, Arslonbek decided to purchase fodder for the livstock. However as he did not sell his sheep yet and thus does not have the necessary sum of money on his hands, he decided to take a loan. With this aim he turned to "MDO Arvand". He very much hopes for support and thanks you for the help in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Trecenas

texts.en:
Trecenas works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

Trecenas requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, like curtains, pillow cases, and blouses.

Trecenas has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, like curtains, pillow cases, and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Runa is 27 years old and married, with two children. With one child currently in school, Runa works very hard to provide for them.

Runa runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Runa has been in this business for four years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, biscuits, cooking oil, and noodles. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elvira is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Elvira has a roasted, whole chicken-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more chickens, ingredients, and materials for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens, ingredients, and materials for her business.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío El Muñuño, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, que se caracteriza por un clima variado su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee dos reses de su propiedad, cliente cría su ganado vacuno en la inverna de su padre, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, también se dedica al cultivo de cafeto y caña de azúcar, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café y caña y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Francisco, 41, lives with his wife and children in the village of El Muñuño, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás, known for its varied climate, located in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru. The people there work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

José raises and sells cattle. He owns two bulls. He raises his cattle in his father's pasture and he has been doing this work for 10 years. He also grows coffee and sugar cane and his wife helps him. He has asked for a loan of 2,000 new soles to pay workers to care for his coffee and sugar cane crops. This way, he can have a timely production to offer his customers.

loans.use: to pay workers to maintain his coffee and sugar cane crop.

loans.name: El Mantial De Pariachi Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Manantial De Pariachi” está conformado por 05 socios responsables y dinámicos. Este es el caso de Yrene de 35 años de edad viuda con 01 hijo Dependiente.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de panes. Se siente feliz pues a pesar de las competencias Yrene ha llegado fidelizar a sus clientes. Su anhelo es comprarse un triciclo para distribuir sus productos. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de panes. El grupo “El Manantial De Pariachi” agradece el crédito solicitado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Yrene es la segunda del lado derecho y viste pantaloneta rojo. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra Yhomara la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank has five members who are responsible and dynamic. This is about Yrene who is 35 years old, and is a widow with one dependent child.

She sells bread and is happy because despite the competition, her customers have been loyal to her. Her goal is to buy a tricycle to use for delivering her products. She will use the loan to buy bread. The “El Manantial De Pariachi” communal bank is grateful for the loan they are requesting and promise to continue to work hard. Yrene is the second one from the right, wearing pink capris. The picture in the upper left corner is of Yhomara. She had to be at work when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina Maria, 43 años de edad, soltera madera de un hijo mayor de edad e independiente, origianria de Chinandega lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del pais, desafortunadamente por falta de recursos económicos, no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, terminando con muchos esfuerzos la secundaria; ella se caracteriza por ser una persona, trabajadora, responsable, de buenas costumbre, con ganas de superación personal, lo cual lo ha demostrado en sus créditos anteriores en el cumplimientos de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Reina es una microemrpesaria propietaria de un negocio que consiste en la compra venta de mercadería en general, que consisten en vender pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, camisetas, ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, artículos escolares. inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano de forma ambulante entregando mercaderia que le han encargado sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de otra localidad sus ventas son al contado y al credito recuperando semanal y quiencenal lo invertido. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Reina Maria agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Reina María, 43, is the single mother of an adult child.  She's from Chinandega, in the western part of the country.  She finished secondary school with a lot of effort, but unfortunately she lacked the financial resources to attend college.  She's known as a hardworking and responsible person with good habits and a desire for self-improvement, as she has shown by making her previous loan payments on time.

Reina's a micro-entrepreneur whose business is buying and selling general merchandise.  She sells pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, underwear, cosmetics, perfume, and school supplies.  She starts her work day very early, delivering merchandise on foot to customers.  She makes cash sales in markets in another area.  She sells in cash and on credit, and recovers her investment weekly or every two weeks.

The goal of Reina's loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with merchandise so in the near future she'll earn a better income.

Reina María is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, school supplies, and other merchandise

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 62 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Emelda has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell of charcoal business for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama né en Avril 973 à Loulouni, il est marié, père de 3 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Loulouni arrondissement de la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur Adama mène des activités d’achat et de vente des plastiques et des tasses il ya plus de 6 ans, il s’approvisionne à Sikasso.
 Il est à son huitième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 30 douzaines de plastique et 20 cartons de 10 pièces de tasse. Sa vente se faite dans sa boutique à Loulouni à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama, born in Loulouni in April 1973, is married and the father of three children. He lives in his own home with his wife in a traditional family in the Loulouni neighborhood of the Sikasso region, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mr. Adama began purchasing and selling plastic goods and cups more than six years ago, getting his supplies in Sikasso. He is on his eighth individual loan with microfinance institution (MFI) Soro Yiriwaso, hoping to better meet the needs of his growing customer base. The previous loan was properly repaid.

This loan will allow Mr. Adama to purchase 30 dozen [containers] of plastic goods and 20 boxes of 10 cups each. His sales take place in his shop in Loulouni to a group of customers made up of men and women, for cash and credit.

Mr. Adama expects to see an average monthly profit of 105,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow him to pay the loan and his interested, and invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic goods and cups.

loans.name: Maria Anali

texts.es:
María Analí tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque , lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas y cerdos, los cría en la parte posterior a su domicilio, María se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar con gastos familiares es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevo soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Analí is 22 years old and lives with her two children in Zaña, a village near the Jequetepeque River valley, which has permitted it to develop through agriculture, commerce and livestock. It is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

María Analí raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens and pigs which she keeps in back of her house. She engages in this work to help with the family's expenses. This entrepreneurial mother has asked for a loan of 500 Nuevo Sols to buy feed to fatten up her animals and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit such as bananas, mangos, apples, and oranges

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a fishing business. She is 27 years old and married with two children. Tuyết lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tuyết has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arcelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Arcelita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Arcelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is earning a living through his motor transportation service. Aside from this, he also prepares some snacks and sells them in the market. He earns well from this. 

Gerald has successfully repaid his previous loan used in his transportation business, buying tires for the vehicle. Currently, he is taking a new loan to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. He uses his motorcycle for carrying his stock. 

He hopes to gain more return to help him improve the general living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng operates a fishing business. She is 28 years old and married with two children. Hồng lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nguyệt

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt operates a fishing business. Nguyệt is 64 years old and married with two children. Nguyệt lives with no dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nguyệt's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nguyệt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Nguyệt faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Nguyệt hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Robert

texts.es:
Robert tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío Cabra Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de piña desde hace 5 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra a jornaleros por la cosecha de su cultivo de piña y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Robert is 29 years old.  He lives together with his wife and children in the hamlet of Cabra Chica, a rural area in the Pucará district.  This is a community with a hot climate.  The people there work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.  It is located in the Jaén province of the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.  

Robert works in farming, specifically growing pineapple.  He has done this for five years.  His wife helps him in the work.  He has asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to pay for laborers to harvest his crop, and in this way to offer it to his customers.

loans.use: to pay laborers to work on his pineapple crop

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a 49-year-old parent of six children, Margarita works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn and vegetables. Margarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell for her vegetables vending business.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marigel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marigel works hard to support her family.

Marigel has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marigel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Marigel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to puchase an additional fishing net

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor  vive en la encantadora ciudad de Huayopata que está ubicado en la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco, él un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica es la agricultura donde siembra café, cacao, coca y frutales como por ejemplo plátanos, naranjas, piñas y mangos, él es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Huayopata - Chonta" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas.   

Victor  agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victor lives in the charming city of Huayopata, which is located in the La Convención province of the Cusco region.  He is a hardworking father who is getting his family ahead.  He works in agriculture, where he sows coffee, cacao, coca, and fruit trees such as bananas, oranges, pineapple and mangos.  He is a responsible and kind person who belongs to the Huayopata-Chonta communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa.  At this point in time he needs a loan to buy more seed.

Victor is thankful to investors for this loan, and is committed to making his payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy more seed

loans.name: Hậu

texts.en:
Hậu is 31 years old and is married with two children. Hậu supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hậu operates a fishing business. Hậu has been involved in this business for six years.

In 2012 Hậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hậu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hậu faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares a neighbor’s latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Hậu hopes that her children will find good jobs, her business will do well, and that she can build a new house with her business profits.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: María Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
En el sitio Resbalón del  cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Primavera. En este lugar la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la agricultura y venta de sus productos así como también a la preparación de dulces que son reconocidos en todo el país.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos, tres de ellos  mayores de edad y la menor de 14 años que estudian en colegio, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa.
Doña María tiene una finca en la cual junto a sus hijos cultivan, ellos tienen cultivos de coco, cacao y en época de invierno también siembran maíz y verduras, la producción de coco y cacao recogen cada mes y medio y una vez recogida la producción la venden a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlas a otras ciudades a vender.
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas que necesita para sus cultivos y así obtener una buena producción. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank Grupo de Credito Primavera meet every 15 days in Resbalon in Rocafuerte Canton. Most of the people who live here are engaged in agriculture and the sale of their products.  They are also known throughout the country for the candies which are made here.

This is where Maria lives.  She is 49 years old and is the single mother of four children who all live at home. Three are older and the youngest, who is 14, is still in school. Maria has a farm where she and her children grow coconut and cocoa, and in the winter they also grow corn and vegetables. They harvest their crops every six weeks and then sell it to merchants who come to their house to buy it. They, in turn, take it to other cities to sell. 

This loan is to buy fertilizers and insecticides which are needed for their crops in order to get a good harvest. Maria has been with Grupo de Credito since the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans provide. Her dream is to give her daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, et ont en moyenne 7 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à  Niena un des villages dans le cercle de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Mamou assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes Benkadi, fait la vente des condiments. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt une quantité importante de condiments. Sa revente se faite sur place et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are, on average, 44 years old with seven children. For the most part, they live in traditional families in Niena, one of the villagies in the Sikasso circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fourth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Mamou, seated first on the left in this photo of the women in the Benkadi group, sells condiments. With her portion of the loan, she would like to purchase a large quantity of condiments. She resells them onsite and in the market to male and female clientele, on credit and for cash.

She expects to earn an average monthly income of 15,000 FCFA, of which a portion will be used to pay back the loan and its interest, and the rest will be used for her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Fausto Francisco

texts.es:
Fausto en un pequeño productor de café en el departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Su finca es de 28.2 hectáreas de las cuales 10.6 son de café. Su visión es duplicar el área de café en su finca de manera gradual para lo cual está gestionando recursos acordes a esta actividad, aprovechando las condiciones favorables que tiene su finca para la producción de este rubro. 

En los últimos años Dn. Fausto ha logrado cosechar un promedio de 350 quintales de café pergamino. Para este año, está solicitando un financiamiento para garantizar la mano de obra y la compra de insumos y materiales que le permita tener bajo control las plagas y enfermedades en las áreas de café cosechero que tiene actualmente. Con la implementación de estas actividades, se logrará garantizar y mejorar la producción en el ciclo 2014-2015, y hacer frente a la inestabilidad en el mercado de café, lo cual también ha enfrentado al estar certificado bajo el sello Fairtrade.
texts.en:
Fausto is a small coffee producer in the Jinotega region of Nicaragua.  His farm is 28.3 hectares, of which 10.6 are coffee.  His vision is to double the coffee area of his farm gradually, so he is managing his resources accordingly, taking advantage of the favorable conditions that his farm has for this line of production.

In recent years, Don Fausto has managed to average a harvest of 350 quintales of pergamino coffee.  For this year, he is asking for a loan to ensure the labor and the purchase of supplies and materials that allow him to keep pests and diseases under control in the areas that are currently sown with coffee.  With the introduction of these activities, he will be able to ensure and improve production in the 2014-2015 cycle, and deal with the instability of the coffee market, which he has also faced by being certified under the Fairtrade stamp.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase supplies such as pesticides

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Tiessiri vivent toutes dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Banakourou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment  d’ustensile et la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2 éme   cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Ba Bintou (1 ère femme debout de la droite  vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre   dans le village de Banakourou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Ba Bintou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 6 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utiliser pour subvenir aux petits besoins de  ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women in the Tiessiri group all live in monogamous families. They are, on average, 41 years old with four children. They all live in the Banakourou village in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know each other through their neighborhood, their relatives and marriage ties, and through their businesses in the village. They have small restaurant businesses and sell condiments and utensils. To increase their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Ba Bintou (the first woman standing on the left of the photo) is a great saleswoman of all kinds of condiments in the Banakourou village and the surrounding neighborhoods. She expects to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments to meet the growing demands of her clients. Her sales are made for cash and often on credit to a mixed clientele. Ba Bintou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 6,000 FCFA with this loan, half of which will be used for her children's needs and half of which will go into her business funds.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Este préstamo es parte de las lineas de créditos "Credi Yapa" de la Asociación Arariwa, que permite los prestatarios con un buen historial de crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo, Credi Yapa es un pequeño préstamo, además de su préstamo regular, que tiene un calendario de pagos flexible de cuatro meses.

Pascuala se dedica a la venta de frutas pues tiene varios terrenos de plantaciones frutales. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que pertenece al banco comunal "Buena Vista" de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas.

Pascuala agrace a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
This loan is part of the “Credi Yapa” line of credit from Asociación Arariwa, which permits borrowers with a good credit history to take out a special loan.  Credi Yapa is a small loan, in addition to their regular loan, which has a four-month schedule of flexible payments.

Pascuala works selling fruit because she has a number of pieces of land with fruit orchards.  She is a responsible and kind person who has belonged to the Buena Vista communal bank of Asociación Arariwa for a number of years.  At this point in time, she needs a loan to buy seed.

Pascuala is grateful to investors for this loan and is committed to making her payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seed

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa tienen una bodeguita donde ofrecen variedad de productos arroz, aceite, azúcar y leche, son una familia emprendedora, hay solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 46, lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotun, which is a community that works in agriculture, trade and livestock. Oyotun is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is part of the Lambayeque region in the north coast of Peru.

Together with his wife, they run a small shop that offers a variety of products such as rice, oil, sugar and milk. They are an enterprising family and are asking for this loan of 2500 nuevos soles to buy a variety of products to grow their business and gain a higher income for their family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries such as sugar, rice and milk to supply his business.

loans.name: Veronica Eliseth

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodeguita donde ofrece variedad de abarrotes arroz, aceite, azúcar, huevos, cereales entre otros , es conocida en su distrito por el buen servicio que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para hacer crecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
